loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Rahim was born in 1965. He lives in Khachmaz region. He is married and has 3 children. He has been in cattle breeding for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $975 to buy 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en: Mr. M. Tolibjon lives in the B.Gafurov region. He is divorced and has 2 children. Mr. M. Tolibjon has been engaged in raising livestock since his early years. He learned the first skills when helped his father with taking care of the livestock. The love to animals keeps him in the livestock business as an adult. He has a good flock but dreams of having a large-scale farm. Now, Mr. M. Tolibjon applies to KIVA with the request of a business support loan so that he can purchase one more pedigree bull. In addition to the general livestock business, Mr. M. Tolibjon also has a shoe repair business at home.

loans.use: To purchase one pedigree bull

loans.name: Mayngul

texts.en: M. Mayngul is 39-years old. She is married and has 4 children. For 8 years, Mayngul has been selling rice in the local market of the city. and she is an expert in rice. Rice is very popular staple food in Tajikistan. One of the most widely spread meals made of rice is called “plov”. “Plov” is cooked very often, moreover you can hardly find any family occasion which can be conducted without that delicious meal. There are various types of “plov”, and each depends upon the meat and the rice that are used for cooking. Mayngul is not only rice, but her clients seek her advice in which rice to choose for which recipe. She is requesting a loan of $600 for the term of 9 months. She will spend the loan to upgrade and replenish her stock. Mayngul thanks everyone for their support and she assures she will repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for selling

loans.name: Shikdjamal

texts.en: Shikdjamal (his brother is pictured) is married and has two children. He was born in 1961. He lives in Khachmaz region. He started this business 10 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $750 to buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Aubjon

texts.en: K. Aubjon lives in Khujand. Mr. K. Aubjon has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. He showed himself to be a reliable client who follows the MicroInvest loan procedure. Now, he applies for a business development loan for 8 months. Mr. K. Aubjon is engaged in commercial service and trade. He has a business in food selling (milk products, meat products, sugar, etc…). He has a trade outlet and a good assortment of products. Mr.K. Aubjon wants to widen the assortment of products that he sells. Mr. K. Aubjon thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To widen the existing assortment

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen M. is a man with a big heart of gold. His group, Kewerimidde women’s group, meets in one of the rooms at his home for free, a case that is rare to find among all groups countrywide. Probably this is one of the reasons why God has continuously blessed him. He is a fisherman with 37 boats, plus a container boat for collection and transportation of fish from the various boats on the waters around Katosi, on Lake Victoria. The fishermen on boats work for him, and the payments are agreed upon by the parties involved depending on their catch. In addition to the fishing business, he is a farmer growing food both for sale and home consumption, and this has eased his home expenses. He also has various other businesses, including shops in Katosi. He is one of the founding members of his group, and although he has all this, he needs the support of the loans for his current businesses and more business ventures. He is married with children.

loans.use: To improve his businesses of fishing, retail and farming

loans.name: Gun Keshari

texts.en: Gun Keshari M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Thecho village. She opened her grocery shop 5 years ago to improve the living standard of her family.  She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses, biscuits, and noodles in her shop. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in that area so she is requesting a loan of 30,000 Rupees to buy grocery items to meet the demand.  Mrs. M. lives with her mother-in-law, husband and one son. Her husband is Shiva Das M. and is a farmer. Her son is studying in grade 7.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Ahabu

texts.en: Ahabu N. is a farmer and a fisherman in Katosi. On the farm, he employs people to help ease and quicken his work, because mostly his food is for sale. He grows ginger, cassava, sweet potatoes and matooke (green bananas). For fishing he has a boat and would like to buy fishing nets as well as more fish to sell. At times when he does not have a good catch, he buys from others so as to keep his customers. Through his Kewerimidde group, he is asking for a loan to hire workers on the farm and buy fishing nets and fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and hire workers on his farm

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en: J. Ilhomjon was born in 1976 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. Mr. J. Ilhomjon has a good reputation. He is a very hard working man and a good family man. Mr. J. Ilhomjon has been interested in photography since his early years. He took special courses and learned the specified skills. Now Mr. J. Ilhomjon is a professional photographer and has a photography studio. Mr. J. Ilhomjon applies to KIVA with the request of a business support loan for 8 months so that he can purchase new equipment.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment

loans.name: Narin

texts.en: 10 years ago Narin started this business. She is a mother of 3 children. Narin was born in 1957. She lives in Khachmaz town. She has her own hotbed where she grows vegetables. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy vegetable seedlings and fertilizer for improving her hotbed.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seedlings and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.en: B. Sharifjon lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. Mr. B. Sharifjon is engaged in the family business of livestock. He inherited the business from his father. He has a good flock of cows, bulls, sheep  and rams. Now Mr. B. Sharifjon applies to KIVA with the request of a business development loan for 8 months so that he can build a new cowshed building that will permit him to enlarge the livestock area and increase the number of livestock.

loans.use: To build a new cowshed building

loans.name: Sros

texts.en: Mrs. Sros K., a 22-year-old married mother of one child, lives in Popeal Khaer Village in Kandal Province, where she is a garment worker and farmer. Her husband, Mr. Yoeurng Meas, is a construction worker who can only generate a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sros K.’s crops faced a drought last year; therefore she is asking for a loan to buy a pump to water her fields.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a pump to water her crops.

loans.name: Jonnex

texts.en: M. Jonnex is a fisherman at the Katosi fish landing. He has been fishing ever since he left school some years back, and he does not regret it. He owns a boat with which he earns a living for his family. He is asking for a loan through his Kewerimidde group to help him do his fishing job better.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and hooks

loans.name: Srey On

texts.en: Mrs. Srey On S., 20 years old and the mother of one child, is a vegetable seller in Popeal Khaer Village in Kandal Province.  Her husband, Mr. Sophal Meas, a farmer in the local village, grows vegetable for his wife to sell in the local market. Now, he would like to start a motorbike taxi  business, so Mrs. Srey On S. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike. The rest of the money she will use to buy seeds and fertilizer for her field. Last year, Mrs. Srey On S. got typhoid fever and spent an unforeseen amount of money to get cured, and so is looking to increase the family’s income through this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use as a motorbike taxi, plus seeds and fertilizer for her field.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia N. has a wholesale shop in Katosi that she has been running since 1998. She is married with six children, and she cares for two orphans. She has been our client for ten years as a member of Kewerimidde women’s group, and she is 100 percent reliable. She would like to transform her wholesale shop so that it is more stocked to the brim with everything that customers would ask for. If given a loan, she would like to increase the quantity of sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, and maize flour, and also pay school fees for her children. In the shop, she works with her husband and one of her boys to help with the lifting of heavy bags.

loans.use: To increase her stock of sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, and maize flour, and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Khulkaroi

texts.en: A. Khulkaroi was born in 1967 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. She lives in the high-mountain region where livestock is important. She is engaged in the livestock business, as are many her fellow villagers. Mrs. A. Khulkaroi raises and sells livestock. It is the family business. She is also a school teacher. She has 10 years of experience in livestock so she has appropriate skills and knowledge that she uses in practice. Now, Mrs. A. Khulkaroi applies to KIVA with the request of a business development loan for 8 months to purchase special milk-making equipment to start milk production and selling. Mrs. A. Khulkaroi thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA gives to entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase special milk-making equipment

loans.name: Bena

texts.en: N. Bena has had a business selling green bananas just next to the local borehole for three years, and she is one of the founding members of Kewerimidde women’s group in Katosi. She is a widow taking care of her four children, the eldest being 17 and the youngest being 7, all of whom are in school. She is in need of a loan to help with buying more bananas to sell, as well as to pay school fees for her children. Usually, she buys bunches and breaks some of them out into pieces for customers who cannot afford a bunch.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas to sell and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif was born in 1974. He lives in Khachmaz region. He is married and has two children. Seven years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $975 to buy two calves.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Kewerimidde Women's Group

texts.en: Forty-three-year-old N. Mastula, treasurer of Kewerimidde women’s group, is a businesswoman who owns a retail shop in Katosi. Katosi is a port city, with the main activity being fishing. In Mastula’s shop, she sells fishing materials such as floaters, oars, jerry cans, fishing nets, and hooks. She has had her shop for six years. Her dream is for her shop to grow and become more lucrative with more fishing supplies of different types. She would like a loan to buy more floaters, fishing nets, hooks, jerry cans and oars. She is a widow with seven children to care for, of which four are her own. Mastula also has a tailoring business just outside her shop, through which she buys material for school uniforms and women’s traditional and casual wear, all for sewing. For the uniforms, she gets contracts from schools, and this only booms at the beginning of each school term. She does all this for the sake of her children’s future.

loans.use: To buy more fishing supplies to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Pearl Microfinance Limited - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny K. and her husband live with one child in Sneng Village, Kampong Thom Province. She arises early each morning to buy fish from her village to sell in the market, earning about $1.30 per day. Her husband, a farmer who grows rice crops twice a year, during both the rainy and dry season, makes $2.60 per day.  K. is now seeking a loan to purchase a buffalo for her husband’s farm. This loan will help increase the family income and make the farming more efficient.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo for her husband's farming business.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil was born in 1957. He is married and has one child. He has been in this business for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of $975 to buy clothes for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea C. sells groceries in Boeng Mealea Village, Siem Reap Province, earning about $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Hen Hoeurm, 32, makes $2 per day grinding rice. They have four children, one married and three others attending school. With a growing business and increasing family’s expenses, C. is seeking a loan to purchase more grocery stocks and to repair their grinding workshop; these measures will help them to expand their businesses and increase family income so they can pay their children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stocks and fix  their grinding workshop.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama N., age 42, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Simbandi Brassou for six and a half years. She has a commercial business consisting of buying peanuts, honey, and lemons and selling them retail. With her income, she helps improve the living conditions, health, and education of the children. Adama is one of the best in her group and wants to maintain her business. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Adama N., 42 ans, mariée, 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Simbandi Brassou depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle mène une activité de commerce qui consiste à acheter des arachides, du miel et du citron et revendre. Avec ses revenus elle contribue à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, la santé et la scolarité des enfants. Adama est une des meilleures de son groupe et veut maintenir son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Commerce in foods

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou D., age 42, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Simbandi Brassou for six and a half years. At the weekly markets, she wants to buy brooms , made from oil palms, and some peanuts to make peanut butter and to sell her goods in Dakar. The income derived from her commerce will enable her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Aissatou D., 42ans, mariée, 05enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Simbandi Brassou depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires des balaies de l’huile de palme et des arachides pour faire de la pâte d'arachide et vendre ses produits à Dakar. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Commerce in foods

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S., age 42, is married and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Simbandi Brassou for six and a half years. She wants a loan to buy brooms and peanuts at the weekly markets and to resell them in Kaolack. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve the living conditions, health, and education of the children. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Fatou S., 42ans, mariée, 04enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Simbandi Brassou depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des balaies et des arachides au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre à Kaolack. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie, la santé et la scolarité des enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy peanuts and brooms to sell

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou C., age 42, is married and has four children, one of whom is in her care, in addition to her grandson. She has been a member of the village bank of Simbandi Brassou for six and a half years. She sells medicines and ice cream, which is made starting with monkey bread (baobab fruit), bissap (hibiscus flower), and sugar. She is the matron of her village. She gets her stock of medicines at the health district. She wants a loan that will help her to contribute better to community health (given the frequent shortages of medicines in the village) and to the support of her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Aissatou C., 42 ans, mariée, mère de 04 enfants dont 01 en charge en plus de son petit fils est membre du banc villageois de Simbandi Brassou depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle vends des médicaments et des crèmes glaces fait à partir du pain de singe, bissap et du sucre. Elle est la matrone de son village elle s’approvisionne en médicament au niveau du district sanitaire. Elle veut un prêt qui l’aidera à mieux participer à la santé communautaire avec les ruptures de médicaments fréquentes au niveau du village et à l'entretien de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell refreshments and medicines

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is married, but her husband's income from taxi driving is not sufficient for Mary and her four children. Mary sells ice water and food. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort S. is married, but her husband's income from teaching is not sufficient for Comfort and her four children. Comfort sells food items. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Mulika

texts.en:
Mulika O. sells cosmetics and bread. This is a skill that she acquired for over two years. She has been in this business since1988. She is 50 years old and married with six children. She lives in Okoko in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Mulika has been a LAPO client for the past four years and she needs a loan for $425.00 to enable her buy more cosmetics and bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and bread to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary C. is married, but her husband's income from the sanitary office is not sufficient for Mary and her four children. Mary sells oranges, groundnuts, and other fruits. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing O. runs a restaurant, a place where cooked food and drinks are sold. She acquired her skills over eight months. She is 31 years old and married with no children. For her business to keep booming, she must have good customer service. She has been offering this since the commencement of her business in 2005. She lives at Ilufe in Ojo Igbede, Lagos State, Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan for $850.00 to buy more drinks and food to sell in her restaurant. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food items for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mansa

texts.en:
Mansa T. is married, but her husband's income from his job as a tailor is not sufficient for Mansa and her two children. Mansa sells "Kenkey", a local dish that is very popular. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. lives in Ajamgbadi in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuff in her community. She is 28 years old and married with three children. She is very focused and determined to alleviate poverty from her family. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past five years. She acquired the skill of trading over six months and she has been in this business since 1998.

She is requesting a loan for $850.0 to buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell at her shop. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. sells a hot drink called Ogogoro in the Ilogbo community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is able to sell her product well because she offers excellent customer service. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years and has been in this business since 2006. She learned her business over three years.

She needs a loan of $850.00 to buy more hot drinks (Ogogoro) so that she can increase the profitability of her business.

loans.use: To buy more hot drinks (Ogogoro) to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima S. is married, but her husband's income from farming is not sufficient for Fatima and her three children. Fatima sells soup. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Sikiratu

texts.en:
Sikiratu I. booming business shows that the financial help she has been receiving from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years has had great impact on her business and her family's lifestyle. She is 62 years old and married with four children. She sells fresh fish, a business she has been into since 1970. Sikiratu lives at Ajamgbadi in Lagos State Nigeria.

She is requesting for the loan amount of $1200 to buy more fresh fish for sale. She say thanks to all that makes the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa S. is married, but her husband's income from the church he works at is not sufficient for Yaa and her three children. Yaa sells oranges, mangoes, bananas, etc.. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
The growing business of Doris B. shows that she is utilizing the funds that she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells cosmetics and cooking utensils in her shop. She acquired the skill over three years of training and has been in business since 2001.

She needs a loan for $850.00 to buy more cooking utensils and cosmetics so that her business can expand. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine I. sells in the Shibiri community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 1988 and she acquired her skills over three months of training. She is 30 years old and married with three children.

She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. Catherine needs for a loan of $850.00 to buy more kerosene in her shop. She is grateful to all who make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
Augusta G. sells provisions and foodstuffs. She lives in Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria. She acquired the skill of trading over three months. She has been in this business since 2000 and borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. Augusta is 28 years old and married with three children.

She is requesting a loan of $425.00 to buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says a big thank you to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella A. is a business-oriented woman because she was able to put the money that she borrowed from LAPO Microfinance into good use. She sells foodstuffs and provisions at Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 2004. She is 25 years old and married with two children.

Stella is determined to lift her family above poverty. She is requesting the loan of $425.00 to buy more foodstuffs and provisions for sales.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia B., 30, wife of M., 35, lives in Arifwala, Pakistan, where she owns a two-room brick house. She is a mother of four children. Her husband manufactures a cloth washing soap, an enterprise he has operated for the last five years. She is now seeking a loan for his soap business in order to expand his income and improve the financial condition of his house. Safia recently repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan.

Safia has been joined in her loan group by two other members: Abida Shaheen, who wants to expand her spare parts business, and Azra B., who wants to buy a donkey cart. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses and improve their financial conditions.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema B., 49, the wife of A. A., 50, lives in Arifwala, Pakistan, where she owns a two room brick house and is the mother of two children. Her husband has been operating a cycle-renting business for the last three years, and she is now seeking a loan for the business to enable him to increase his income and improve the financial condition of his house. She recently successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan.

Haleema has been joined in her loan group by four other members: Zubaida B., who wants to buy wheat; Ghafooran B., who wants to buy fruits for her fruit business; Muniran B., who wants to buy items for her electric shop; and Razia B., who wants to expand her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve their financial situation.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr:
Diouma C., age 38, is married and has five children in her care, of whom four are in school. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara in Vélingara for 5 years. She wants to buy peanuts to make peanut butter to sell. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Diouma C., 38 ans, mariée, 05 enfants en charge parmi lesquels 04 vont à l’école est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter des arachides, les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu N. lives at Igbelerin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, foodstuffs, and provisions and has been in this business since 2001. She is 35 years old and married with has five children.

Abibatu has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. She needs a loan of $850.00 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ail

texts.en:
Ail A. is married, but her husband's income from his taxis are not sufficient for Ail and her three children. Ail sells rice and beans. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira B., the widow of M., lives in Arifwala, Pakistan, where she owns a two room brick house and is the mother of four children. She runs a grocery shop which she started after her husband’s death. In order to diversify her product line and expand her business, Tahira is requesting a loan. She recently successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan.

Tahira has been joined in her loan group by two other members: Iqbal B., who wants a loan for her spare parts business, and Ramzana B., who wants a loan to buy welding tools for her son. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses and improve their financial situations.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana A. lives in Igbelerin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells firewood and akara as beancake (product from beans). She has been in this business since 1988. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years. She is 56 years old and married with five children.

She is soliciting for the loan amount of $1200.00 to buy more beans and firewood to sell. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and beans to sell.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel J. sells clothes and is also a fashion designer, a skill that she acquired over four years. She has been in this business since 1998. She is 37 years old and married with four children. She lives at Ilogbo Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She is soliciting for the loan amount of $425 to buy more clothes and tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia Baji, the wife of M.., lives in Arifwala, Pakistan, where she owns a two room brick house and is a mother of three children. Her husband has been a farmer for the last 10 years. She is requesting a loan for her brother-in-law, a 25-year-old farmer who wants to expand his pesticide business. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan.

Safia has been joined in her loan group by four other members: Shamim Baji, who wants a loan for her vegetable and fruit business; Rasoola Baji, who wants a loan for her clothes business; Afshan Baji, who seeks a loan for her flower business, and Ruqaiya Baji, who wants a loan for her food-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. (Ruqaiya baji in the above picture wasn't present that time)

loans.use: To expand their businesses and improve their financial conditions.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Mrs. Bola A. lives in Lagos State in Nigeria. She is a hair stylist in her area. Bola acquired her skill over three years and has been in this business since 1998. She is 32 years old and married.

She needs a loan amount of $1025 to buy more weavons, attachments, and hair cream so that she can serve her customer better.

loans.use: To buy weavons, attachments, and hair cream for her salon.

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
During the visit to Ifeoma I. at Okoko in Lagos State, Nigeria, it was observed that her business is booming because it's located at the center of Alaba International Market. She is 40 years old and has two children and she is the breadwinner of the family. She sells snacks and VCD plates. She acquired the skill over six months and has been in this business since 1999.

Ifeoma needs a loan of $425.00 to buy more snacks and VCD plates in order to expand her business. This will equally help her serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more snacks and VCD plates.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria I. is a married woman of strength and stamina, hence she is able to sell provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks. She also hawks her goods every morning before coming to her shop. She acquired her skill over six months and has been in this business since 1997. She is 38 years old and married with four children.

Victoria has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past four years. She needs a loan of $425.00 to buy a deep freezer.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en: The hardship and the struggle for survival is seen in Tawa S., who has been a widow for the past eight years. She is 40 years old and has four children to cater to. She sells garri at Sabo Oniba in Lagos State, Nigeria. She acquired her skill over four years and has been in this business since 1988. Tawa needs a loan of $700.00 to enable her to buy more bags of garri to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Garri to sell.

loans.name: Adebinpe

texts.en:
Adebinpe O. is known as Mama Charcoal because she has been a charcoal distributor for a very long time in her community. Customers within and outside of her community patronize her. She is 45 years old and married with six children. She has been in this business since 1999. She lives at Sabo oniba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Adebinpe has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past four years. She needs a loan of $700.00 to buy more charcoal so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Genisis Group

texts.en:
Celsa is a 48 year-old woman who lives with her three children in Luperon, Dominican Republic. When we arrived in Luperon she was behind her house killing chicken to supply the meat for her small restaurant that she runs. Celsa is famous for her Dominican soup, which has big chunks of fresh vegetables, chicken, and spices. She wants to use her loan to buy more food for her “comedor” including rice, live chicken, and vegetables. When Celsa isn’t working or caring for her children, she enjoys going to church and helping out in the community. She hopes that in the future she will have a bigger and nicer restaurant, and that she will be able to help the orphans in Luperon by making them lunch every day.

Thank you to all of the Kiva lenders who will help these entrepreneurs realize a better future!

loans.use: To buy more rice and vegetables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Aleyda

texts.es:
Aleyda and her husband created a shoe factory in their own home 2 years ago. With the experience that her husband acquired while working at a large shoe factory, they started their dream business. Now, Aleyda has become an expert in putting the finishing touches on shoes. The high demand for their shoes makes them happy, and they would like to improve and increase production buy purchasing more supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Aleyda y su esposo constituyeron hace 2 años una fábrica de zapatos en su propia casa. Con la experiencia que adquirió su esposo durante muchos años en una gran fábrica iniciaron sus sueños y ahora Aleyda se ha vuelto toda una experta en los acabados de los calzados.La demanda de sus zapatos los tiene muy contentos y desean mejorar e incrementar su producción con la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies to make shoes

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel is a young man with the desire for continuous self-improvement, which is why he finished his studies in computer sciences. His wish is to be able to start his own computer assembly shop. His efforts have given him and his sister the possibility to improve a food stand in a nearby street market. They rent it out and have turned it into their source of income. He is requesting a loan in order to keep improving his stand and rent it out at a better price. Help Miguel move forward with his efforts of self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel, es un joven con muchos deseos de superación y mejoramiento continuo es por ello que terminó sus estudios técnicos en computación y su deseo es poder tener su propio taller de ensamblaje de computadoras y sus esfuerzos le ha dado la posibilidad de mejorar junto con su hermana un puesto de comidas en el mercadillo cercano a su casa para poder alquilarlo y que éste sea una fuente de financiamiento importante para ellos, solicita un préstamo para continuar mejorando el puesto de mercado que tiene y poder alquilarlo a un mejor precio. Apoya a Miguel a seguir adelante con estos esfuerzos de superación.

loans.use: Improvement of rental space

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida is a hardworking mother who saw the need to open up a small, basic foodstuff general store for the benefit of both her beloved family and the community. She has been in business for almost 5 years now, and would like to improve her business space even more since her good service and her care for the needs of her friends have contributed to her popularity.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Zenaida, es una trabajadora madre que ha visto en la instalación de una pequeña bodeguita de abastecimiento de productos de primera necesidad en beneficio de su amada familia y de su comunidad.Ya ha cumplido cerca de cinco años de trabajo y desea mejorar aún más su espacio de ventas ya que la buena atención y preocupación que demuestra por las necesidades de sus amigos han contribuido ha mantener su preferencia.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand business space

loans.name: Awa Tidiane

texts.fr:
Awa Tidiane G., 53 years old, is married with children, and has been a member of the village bank o Djilacoune in Ziguinchor for 7 years. She would like to buy oil, fish, and peanut paste for resale. Her income allows her to improve the living conditions of her family. Awa's business is supported by her husband, who is in Kaolack, where a portion of the goods are sold. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Awa Tidiane G., 53 ans, mariée avec ses enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Djilacoune à Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans. Elle veut acheter de l’huile, du poisson et de la pâte d’arachides puis revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Awa est soutenue par son mari qui se trouve à Kaolack ou une partie de ses produits sont vendus. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a responsible and very loving woman. Day to day she eagerly manages her small general store, in which she sells groceries to the members of her community in order to earn income and her family’s wellbeing. Her ongoing commitment and kindheartedness has brought her much satisfaction. She now wishes to improve her business space in order to offer her customers greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha, es una mujer responsable y muy amorosa. Día a Día se desenvuelve muy contenta y con mucho ahínco en su pequeña tiendita de abarrotes desde donde oferta sus productos a los miembros de su comunidad para obtener ganancias en bienestar de su familia. Su continuidad y amabilidad le han dado muchas satisfacciones y ahora desea mejorar su espacio para brindarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Expansion of business space for greater customer comfort

loans.name: Zelmira

texts.es:
Zelmira is very optimistic about working, which is why she decided to utilize a very important appliance in her home to start a business: her washing machine. She has been offering laundry services to her neighbors and acquaintances for 3 years. She mentions that she started out almost in jest, but now, it is a great relief since this business generates the income needed for her to get ahead. She is requesting a loan in order to give the last payment on her newly acquired washing machine. Help Zelmira keep moving forward with her efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Zelmira, tiene mucho optimismo para trabajar es por ello que decidió utilizar un instrumento importante que tiene en su casa para emprender su negocio, su lavadora. Es por ello que desde hace 3 años ella ofrece sus servicios de lavado a sus vecinos y conocidos, nos menciona que comenzó esto como jugando y ahora es un gran alivio ya que esta actividad en la actualidad le genera los ingresos necesarios para que ella pueda seguir adelante. Solicita un préstamo para pagar la última letra de la lavadora nueva que adquirió. Apoya a Zelmira a seguir adelante con sus esfuerzos.

loans.use: Finish paying off washing machine for business

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
Ketty is a very hardworking person who is always committed to her job in her small hardware store. Thanks to her dedication, she has been able to improve her services, increase her sales, and of course offer more products little by little. Because she has decided to continue to develop professionally, she is requesting a loan in order to improve her business space, thus assuring the profits that will contribute to her personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ketty es una persona muy laboriosa que siempre esta pendiente de su trabajo en su pequeña ferretería y poco a poco gracias a su empeño ha podido mejorar sus servicios y cuenta con más solicitudes y por supuesto mayor cantidad de artículos.Debido a que decidido continuar con su desarrollo profesional solicita un préstamo para mejorar su espacio de labor y así asegurar las ganancias que contribuirán con su desarrollo.

loans.use: Improve services and selection

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia and her spouse work independently producing plans on the computer using the program Autocad. This business arose from her desire to advance in her profession independently and, at the same time, not to neglect giving attention to her 3 children. Sonia is happy to be able to use her certificate in Architecture and be a good mother at the same time. It is for this reason that she has planned her continued carrier advancement. Because her basic work tools are computers, she needs a loan to buy a printer that produces maps and plans and to upgrade the machines that she uses.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia y su esposo trabajan independientemente realizando trabajos de planos a computadora mediante el programa de Autocad. Todo surgió por el deseo de seguir adelante ejerciendo su profesión independientemente y a la vez no descuidar la atención de sus 3 hijos, Sonia está contenta de poder ejercer su carrera de Arquitectura y a la vez ser buena madre es por ello que se ha proyectado seguir avanzando y debido a que su instrumento básico de trabajo son las computadoras necesita un préstamo para comprar una impresora que plotea planos y además repotenciar las máquinas que utiliza.

loans.use: To buy a printer and upgrade of computers used in a business that produces architectural plans

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin is a young man with the desire for self-improvement. For many years, he has been making bricks from home. He now wishes to start a new business working for himself raising small animals because he has noticed that this is a very lucrative activity in his city.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Edwin, es un joven con muchos deseos de superación. Durante mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a la elaboración de ladrillos en su espacio familiar y ahora desea emprender un negocio de manera independiente criando animalitos menores ya que ha observado la rentabilidad de esta actividad dentro de su ciudad.

loans.use: Capital for starting a new business

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna S., 27 years old, is married with 2 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Djilacoune in Ziguinchor for 6 and a half years. She is seeking a loan to enlarge her store and increase her income by buying oil, petrol, soap, and sugar for resale. The income drawn from this business allows her to take care of the feeding and health of her family. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Maimouna S., 27 ans, mariée, 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Djilacoune à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer sa boutique et augmenter ses revenus en achetant de l’huile, du pétrole, du savon et du sucre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer pour la nourriture et la santé de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To stock her food store

loans.name: Judy

texts.es:
Judy works untiringly with one objective: to provide for her beloved little child for whom she is the sole provider in the world. She travels monthly to the city of Lima to acquire unique goods to sell upon her return in the Sunday fairs in her city. She wishes to improve her market stall and for this reason she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Judy, trabaja incansablemente con un solo objetivo otorgarle bienestar a su querida pequeña para quién es ella la única ayuda en este mundo. Mensualmente viaja a la ciudad de Lima para adquirir novedosos artículos para ofertarlos a su regreso en las ferias dominicales de su ciudad. Desea mejorar su stand de ventas y por esta razón solicita un préstamo

loans.use: Capital to buy a greater number of unique items from the city for resale in regional fairs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria's enthusiasm is contagious which significantly adds to the daily sales of her high quality beauty products. Everyday she goes out to earn her daily sales accompanied by her catalogs and product samples which are points in her favor. She is very satisfied with her work because this activity allows Maria to provide for the needs of her 3 children and to better herself.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

El entusiasmo de Maria es contagiante y favorece significativamente las ventas diarias de sus productos de belleza de las más exigentes marcas de calidad, día a día sale a realizar sus jornadas de ventas provista de sus catálogos y probadores de productos que son un punto a su favor, está muy satisfecha de la labor que realiza ya que esta actividad le permite a Maria velar por el cuidado de sus 3 hijos y desarrollarse.

loans.use: Capital to increase supplies of her high quality beauty products

loans.name: Tai

texts.fr:
Tai D., 46 years old, is married with 6 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Colobane Fass in Ziguinchor for 7 years. She runs a business selling clothing (outfits) and jewelry (gold-plated necklaces). With her income, she participates in the support of her family, notably in taking care of the children's education, clothing, and health. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Tai D., 46 ans, mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Colobane Fass à Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente d’habits (des ensembles) et de bijoux (colliers en plaqué or). Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’entretien de sa famille notamment dans la prise en charge de la scolarité, de l’habillement et la santé. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita lives on Pujio street in the San Juan zone of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are 7 and 3 years old. Her occupation is the creation of bedspreads, which she sells in the main fair of the city of El Alto. Her husband is currently working as a bricklayer in the city of La Paz, with which he helps with the sustenance of the family.

The loan will be used to purchase a sewing machine so that it facilitates her workload and increase her production. This is her second loan with Impro through Kiva, and the evaluation conducted on her qualifies her to receive this loan. The previous loan has been repaid punctually and in the terms that were established.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita vive en la calle Pujio de la zona de San Juan en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 7 y 3 años respectivamente. Trabaja en la confección de cubrecamas las cuales vende en la principal feria de la cuidad de El Alto; su esposo actualmente trabaja como albañil en la cuidad de La Paz, con lo cual ayuda al sustento de la familia.

El crédito lo destinara a la compra de una máquina de coser para facilitar su trabajo y aumentar su producción. Es el segundo crédito con Impro a través de Kiva; la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. El préstamo anterior ha sido pagado puntualmente y en los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine for her business in the creation of bedspreads.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Lenor and her family have decided to acquire a quarry to extract the clay they need for their brick making business. Brick making is the main source of income and welfare of her family. Her wish is to improve her manufacturing conditions and thus to make more money and increase her supplies in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Leonor y su familia decidieron adquirir una cantera para extraer la arcilla necesaria y dedicarse en conjunto a la fabricación de ladrillos. Ésta actividad es la principal fuente de ingreso y bienestar de su familia y su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de fabricación para elaborar mayores cantidades y elevar su oferta en el mercado.

loans.use: Purchase of a clay quarry to improve a brick making business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda lives on Fuerza Aérea Avenue in the Ferropetrol zone of the city of El Alto. She lives with her children and has her own stand where she sells clothing, mostly for women and girls, and is situated in a central market in the city of El Alto.

The loan she is requesting will be used toward the purchase of merchandise so that she may increase her sales, and therefore, her earnings. This is her second loan from Impro through Kiva, and her previous loan has been repaid in its entirety. The evaluation conducted qualifies her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda vive en la avenida Fuerza Aérea de la zona Ferropetrol en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus hijos y tiene un puesto en el cual vende ropa, preferentemente de mujeres y niñas, ubicado en un mercado céntrico en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra de mercaderías y así poder incrementar sus ventas, por lo tanto sus ingresos. Es el segundo crédito con Impro a través de Kiva; el crédito anterior ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of women's and girls' clothing to sell in her stand.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina, along with of her spouse, has been dedicated to brick manufacture insiD. their humble home for many years. Now that their age has diminished their strength, they work on a smaller scale. For this reason Segundina has decided to focus on the care of baby animals, to sell them in her community's fairs to obtain earnings to benefit her household.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Segundina, en compañía D. su esposo por muchos años se ha dedicado a la fabricación D. ladrillos dentro D. su humilD. hogar, ahora que los años han disminuido sus fuerzas se dedican a esta labor en menor escala. Por esa razón Segundina, ha decidido ocuparse D. la crianza D. animales pequeños para ofertarlos en las ferias D. su comunidad y así obtener ganancias en beneficio D. su hogar.

loans.use: Capital to acquire more baby animals and to improve sales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ludy

texts.es:
Ludy is a young women who, disheartened by inclement weather and by the loses she suffered as a result, decided to invest the little money she had in the purchase of small bulls to raise and sell when they gained enough size and weight to be used for farming. She's a requesting a loan to purchase two more.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ludy, es una joven que abatida por las inclemencias del tiempo y por las pérdidas que le han generado estos fenómenos ha decidido invertir el poco dinero que tenía en la compra de toros pequeños para engordarlos y venderlos cuando estos alcancen un peso y tamaño especial para las familias que se dedican a la agricultura.

loans.use: Acquire two more bulls / Incremento de capital para adquirir un par de ejemplares más.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou T. is 46 years old, married with 1 child and 2 grandsons in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Colobane Fass in Ziguinchor for 2 and a half years. She would like to strengthen her business, which consists of buying and selling smoked fish. Her income allows her to take care of her family, and she has always respected her financial obligations. Fatou is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of 6 monrhs in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Fatou T., 46 ans, mariée 01 enfants et 02 petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Colobane Fass à Ziguinchor depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter et revendre du con fumé (poisson fumé). Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille. Elle a toujours respecté ses engagements. Fatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell smoked fish

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz saw the best way to generate income for her family and achieved it by selling used clothing every Saturday at the local flea market. Her expectations have risen thanks to the reception of her offerings, and for this reason she's requesting a loan so she can increase her supplies and better provide for her beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Liz vio la mejor manera de generar ingresos económicos para su familia y lo ha conseguido mediante la venta de ropa usada todos los días sábados en la feria de su localidad. Sus expectativas se han incrementado debido a la acogida de sus ofertas y por esa razón solicita u préstamo ya que tiene en mente elevar sus ofertas para beneficio de sus amados hijos.

loans.use: Increase her supply of used clothing / Incremento de capital para elevar la oferta de sus productos.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Thanks to their preparation and experience, Karina and her husband decided to enter the dental-health field to help the thousands of people in their beautiful city. Now, they lend their services daily from a comfortable office, and the requests for extractions and false teeth have increased thanks to the quality service they provide. They wish to keep improving their workspace and acquire higher-quality resin and equipment so they can continue satisfying the demands of their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Gracias a su preparación y a la experiencia que adquirieron Karina y su esposo decidieron incursionar en el campo de la salud dental en beneficio de miles de personas de su bella ciudad. Ahora prestan sus servicios a diario desde un cómodo lugar y las extracciones y encargos de dentaduras postizas se han incrementado gracias a la buena atención que prestan en conjunto. Desean seguir mejorando su espacio de trabajo y adquirir mayor cantidad de resina y herramientas para seguir satisfaciendo las exigencias de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase resin and dental equipment / Compra de resina y herramientas dentales.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is a creative and hard-working woman who learned to embroider only by watching others and without the aid of a teacher. Thanks to her ability and her effort she's been able to help improve her family's quality of life and now, with festival season approaching her valley, she knows that demand for her products will soon increase. For this reason she wishes to acquire a larger quantity of threads and fabrics to be able to meet demand for the orders that are sure to come.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Vilma es una mujer muy creativa y trabajadora que aprendió a bordar sólo observando y sin la necesidad de una maestra de manera continua. Gracias a su desempeño y a su esfuerzo ha podido contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar y ahora que se acerca las festividades en todos su valle sabe que la demanda se va a incrementar dentro de poco y por esa razón desea adquirir mayor cantidad de telas e hilos para prever los pedidos que está segura vendrán.

loans.use: Purchase thread and fabric / Compra de tela e hilos en mayor cantidad.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora is a young mother of a 6-month-old little girl with whom she leaves daily for her job selling arts and crafts she acquires from her city's most skilled artisans. This work allows to her to keep her baby safe and care for her well-being. Nora is requesting a loan in hopes to improve her offerings and obtain higher-quality products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Nora, es una joven madre de una pequeña niña de seis meses con quien día a día se desplaza hasta su centro de trabajo para ofertar los bellos trabajo artesanales que adquiere de los mejores artesanos de su ciudad. Su actividad le permite mantener a su bebé a salvo y gozando de bienestar, por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de mejorar sus ofertas y obtener mayor cantidad de novedosos artículos.

loans.use: Acquire higher-quality arts and crafts to sell / Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de artículos.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda is highly creative, so day by day she captures her good taste in every one of her small handicrafts. She makes key chains, little clay pots, and other items that she sells wholesale at weekend markets. With this business and her daily efforts, she has gotten the possibility of providing wellbeing to her young daughter. She would like to improve her products, which is why she is requesting a loan in order to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Olinda tiene una gran creatividad y día a día plasma su buen gusto en cada una de sus pequeñas artesanías. Elabora llaveritos, ollitas de barro y demás para ofertarlos al por mayor en las ferias dominicales. Con esta actividad y su esfuerzo diario tiene la posibilidad de brindarle bienestar a su pequeña niña. Desea mejorar los acabados de sus objetos y por esta razón solicita un préstamo a fin incrementar su producción.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies that will increase amount of handicrafts

loans.name: Mara

texts.es:
Mara is very happy and satisfied to have taken-on independently her own business selling fruits, with which she can offer her two children everything necessary for their development. Her constant efforts have improved the conditions of suppland demand and now that the dreams of her darling children are expanding and changing she needs to redouble her efforts. It is for this reason that requesting the loan is so important.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Mara, está muy contenta y satisfecha de emprender independientemente su propio negocio de venta de frutas con el que puede ofrecer a sus 2 hijos lo necesario para su completo desarrollo. Su continuo esfuerzo ha mejorado sus condiciones de oferta y demanda y ahora que los sueños de sus amados hijos experimentan un amplio cambio necesita doblegar este esfuerzo. Por ese motivo tan importante solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Capital injection in order to continue offering her bargains.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Three years ago, Vicenta noticed the huge demand for internet services in her community and didn’t hesitate to invest her husband’s retirement money in order to set-up this large family business: with the help of all the family they have been able to harvest the fruits of this investment. Now her dream is to improve still further the business’ environment, as a result for the demand for innovation from her youthful customers who have converted this space into one of their favourite afternoon hang-outs.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Hace tres años Vicenta, observó la gran demanda de los servicios de internet en su comunidad y no dudó en invertir el dinero de la jubilación de su esposo para iniciar este gran negocio familia, con ayuda de toda su familia han podido cosechar los frutos de esta inversión. Y su deseo es mejorar aún más su ambiente por la demanda de novedosos artículos de los jóvenes que han convertido a este espacio en uno de sus favoritos por las tardes.

loans.use: Installation and renovation of the business' space

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
For 15 years the husband of Irma was dedicated to the exchange of used clothes. Because of that, she knew the business of selling scrap, in which she has labored for 12 years.

Irma and her husband have a business that is dedicated to the buying and selling of scrap in the provinces. They travel constantly to the interior of Peru to buy scrap, that then will be sold to wholesalers in Lima. 4 years ago they bought a truck and currently they have 3 mototriciclos (motorized tricycles), with which they collect the scrap. One mototriciclo is found in Lima, and the other two in Ica.

She goes to Ica weekly in her truck to collect scrap, while she travels to the forest every month or more, with all her family. She says that there she is more profitable because there are boots, metal and batteries.

In Ica, Irma has a localitions where she stores all the scrap, that then will be transferred to Lima.

From moment she bought the truck Irma was without capital to buy more scrap, for which she had to request loans.

She would like to have a large warehouse in lima to store her scrap, so that she could work only in the capital and not travel so far away so that she would be able to take care of her children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 15 años el esposo de Irma se dedicaba al canje de ropa usada. A raíz de eso, ella conoció el negocio de la venta de chatarra, en la que labora desde hace 12 años.

Irma y su esposo tienen una empresa que se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra en provincias. Ellos viajan constantemente al interior del Perú a comprar chatarra, que luego será vendida a mayoristas en Lima. Hace 4 años se compraron un camión y en la actualidad tienen 3 mototriciclos (triciclos motorizados), con los que recogen la chatarra. Un mototriciclo se encuentra en Lima, y los otros dos en Ica.

Ella va a Ica semanalmente en su camión a recoger chatarra, mientras que a la selva viaja por lapsos de un mes o más, con toda su familia. Dice que allá es más rentable porque hay botas, metales y baterías.

En Ica, Irma tiene un local donde almacena toda la chatarra, que luego será trasladada a Lima.

Irma, al momento de comprarse el camión se quedó sin capital para comprar más chatarra, por lo que tuvo que pedir préstamos.

A ella le gustaría tener un depósito grande en Lima donde almacenar su chatarra, al igual que trabajar solo en la capital, para así no viajar tan lejos y poder cuidar de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more scrap in the provinces for resale in Lima.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery is an enterprising woman whom in conjunction with her husband decided to sell CDs every Sunday in the commercial markets around their local area. This all began when she received a relative’s advice to occupy herself with this business activity. Mery’s ambition is to be able to establish a business site where she will be able to sell the products daily. In order for the business to continue growing and her merchandise stock to continue expanding, Mery is asking for a loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Mery es una mujer emprendedora y en compañía de su esposo decidió vender CD’s todos los domingos en las ferias comerciales que se dan en su localidad. Todo empezó cuando ella recibió la recomendación de uno de sus familiares a dedicarse a este negocio. El anhelo de Mery es poder establecerse en un local donde pueda diariamente vender estos artículos. Para seguir creciendo y aumentando su mercancía Mery solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to improve her supply

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas has sold school equipment, but since 3 years ago she has been selling cebiche (a traditional Peruvian seafood dish) in the market near her house.

She rises at 5 in the morning to prepare the cebiche. At 9 o'clock she goes to the market and she takes out her wagon, where she sells until 2 in the afternoon.

The loan that she has requested will serve as capital for her food business. But Leonidas would like to have her own position in the market to be able to sell fruits, and to leave the sale of cebiche.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Leonidas vendía útiles escolares, pero desde hace 3 años vende cebiche en el mercado cerca de su casa.

Ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana a preparar el cebiche. A las 9 va al mercado y saca su carreta, donde vende hasta las 2 de la tarde.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido como capital para su negocio de comida. Pero a Leonidas le gustaría tener un puesto propio en el mercado para poder vender frutas, y dejar la venta de cebiche.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making cebiche for sale in the market.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou C. is a 57 year old widow with 6 children and 3 other people in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Colobane Fass in Ziguinchor for 6 and a half years. She would like to strengthen her business by buying palm oil for resale. Her income will allow her to take charge of the feeding, education, and health of her family. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Aissatou C., 57 ans, veuve avec 06enfants et 03 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Colobane Fass à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce en achetant de l’huile de palme pour revendre Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge l’alimentation, la scolarité et la santé de sa famille.Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell palm oil

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth has a great vocation to serve people: from when she was very young she wanted to study medicine but for financial reasons she was unable to do this. However, this didn’t deter Ruth and instead she completed Pharmaceutical studies and she decided to open a site, hiring a small pharmacy after many years of selling medicines door-to-door. Now she has grand projects in mind and is planning to open another branch. Her request for a loan is because she wants to stock this new space with the best-quality medicines in her country.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Ruth, tiene la gran vocación de servir a las personas, tuvo desde muy joven el deseo de estudiar la carrera de medicina que no pudo cumplir por motivos económicos pero su situación no la detuvo a Rut y estudió la carrera técnica de farmacia y se decidió a abrir en un local alquilado una pequeña botica después de muchos años de vender medicinas de manera ambulante. Ahora tiene grandes proyectos en mente y está planeando abrir una sucursal. Su solicitud es porque desea implementar este nuevo espacio con las mejores medicinas de su país y las de mejor calidad.

loans.use: Stocking her new sales space

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica has handbags made which she has distributed to diverse stores for 10 years. She buys the material for the party handbags, and she sends them to be made by an acquaintance. Weekly, she sells a dozen handbags to the stores that sell evening dresses in the center of Lima.

3 years ago, Angélica had a store where she sold the handbags, but she had to leave it because the rent was very expensive.

The loan that she has requested will serve for the purchase of materials for the handbags.

Angélica would like to put a wine cellar or phone booth in her house so that she would not have to leave her house.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica manda hacer carteras y las reparte a diversas tiendas desde hace 10 años. Ella compra el material para las carteras de fiesta, y las manda a hacer donde un conocido. Semanalmente, ella vende una docena de carteras a las tiendas de vestidos de noche del centro de Lima.

Hace 3 años, Angélica tenía una tienda donde vendía las carteras, pero tuvo que dejarlo porque el alquiler estaba muy caro.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para la compra de materiales de las carteras.

A Angélica le gustaría poner una bodega o locutorio en su casa para así no tener que salir de su casa.

loans.use: To buy materials for making handbags to sell.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Monica is determined to keeping pushing herself continuously in order to benefit her small daughter. For this reason, a little after having joined with a family member in business she decided to take-on her occupation independently. She is already very content because in a short time she has obtained a great deal of satisfaction and has decided to improve her sales space.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Mónica, está decidida a esforzarse continuamente en beneficio de su pequeña. Por esa razón poco después de haberse asociado con un familiar decidió emprender su ocupación de manera independiente. Y está muy contenta porque en poco tiempo ha obtenido muchas satisfacciones y ha decidido mejorar su espacio de ventas.

loans.use: Renovation of her sales space.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo has been dedicated to the sale of spices in a stall in the market, but for personal reasons had to leave that business. It was thus, that for 6 years he has made churros caseros (a candy based on flour and blanc-mange) that a friend taught him in 1975.

He rises to prepare the churros at 3 in the morning and at 8 o'clock he is on his way to the center of Lima to offer them for sale on a small table. Daily, he sells between 120 and 150 fritters. His clients are the workers of diverse factories and offices. Lorenzo stays selling until 2 in the afternoon.

The loan that he has requested will serve to buy the ingredients for his fritters. Lorenzo would like to return to the business of selling spices in the market, but he does not have the necessary capital.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorenzo se dedicaba a la venta de especería en un puesto en el mercado, pero por motivos personales tuvo que dejar ese negocio. Fue así, que desde hace 6 años volvió a hacer churros caseros (un dulce a base de harina y manjar blanco) que un amigo le enseñó en 1975.

Él se levanta a preparar los churros a las 3 de la mañana y a las 8 se dirige al centro de Lima a ofrecerlos sobre una pequeña mesa. Diariamente, él vende entre 120 y 150 churros. Sus clientes son los trabajadores de diversas fábricas y oficinas. Lorenzo se queda vendiendo hasta las 2 de la tarde.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los ingredientes de sus churros. A Lorenzo le gustaría regresar al negocio de la especería en el mercado, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients to make churros caseros for sale in the market.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly has worked in her salon for 10 years, but for two she has been dedicated, along with her husband, to the buying and selling of steel. Likewise, her husband manufactures furniture and surgical materials, that have this metal as a raw material, in a small workshop located in his house. They sell furniture, like refrigerators, showcases, etc. to the public in general.

The loans that she has received have served to invest in the purchase of steel.

Kelly would like to have a larger workshop equipped with industrial machines, since now she relies only on small machines. Kelly would not hesitate to close the salon if with that she could expand her steel furniture business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Kelly atiende en su peluquería desde hace 10 años, pero desde hace dos se dedica, junto con su esposo, a la compra y venta de acero. Asimismo, su esposo manufactura muebles y material quirúrgico que tienen como materia prima este metal en un pequeño taller ubicado en su casa. Ellos venden muebles, como refrigeradoras, escaparates, etc. al público en general.

Los préstamos que ha recibido han servido para invertir en la compra de acero.

A Kelly le gustaría tener un taller más grande equipado con maquinarias industriales, ya que ahora solo cuenta con máquinas pequeñas. Kelly no dudaría en cerrar la peluquería si con eso puede ampliar su negocio de muebles de acero.

loans.use: To buy more steel for making furniture.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
Ayde has been a seamstress for over 10 years, when she decided to begin to make clothes in a small workshop located in a space inside the kitchen of her house.

She works according to sales campaigns and to orders from clients, who request pants, skirts and custom-made dresses for festivals. She also does alterations of dresses and makes curtains. She has a small sewing machine and a mender.

The loans that she has requested will serve for purchasing dressmaking materials. Ayde would like to have a location equipped with display windows to install her workshop and thus to be in sight of the public.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Ayde es costurera desde hace más de 10 años, por lo que decidió empezar a confeccionar ropa en un pequeño taller ubicado en un espacio dentro de la cocina de su casa.

Ella trabaja de acuerdo a campañas de ventas y a pedido de clientes, quiénes le demandan pantalones, faldas y vestido de fiestas a la medida. También hace arreglos de vestidos y elabora cortinas. Tiene una pequeña máquina de coser y una remalladora.

Los préstamos que ha pedido han servido para la compra de materiales de costura. Ayde quisiera contar con un local implementado con vitrinas, para así instalar su taller y estar a la vista del público.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen has had a workshop for making footwear for 20 years. The idea was her husband’s, who takes charge of the production of the shoes.

In their workshop which makes use of diverse machines, Carmen and her husband have 3 employees who manufacture around 20 dozen shoes per week. She is dedicated to distributing them to the markets.

The loan that she has requested will serve to buy leather, threads, and linings, among others basic materials, for the making of shoes.

Carmen would like to enlarge her workshop, to sell in more provinces and to improve the quality of her shoes.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen tiene un taller de confecciones de calzados desde hace 20 años. La idea fue de su esposo, quién se encarga de la fabricación de los zapatos.

En su taller implementado con diversas máquinas, Carmen y su esposo tienen 3 empleados quienes fabrican alrededor de 20 docenas de zapatos a la semana. Ella se dedica a repartirlos a los mercados.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado han servido para comprar cuero, hilos, forros, entre otros materiales básicos para la confección de zapatos.

Carmen quisiera agrandar su taller, vender en provincias y mejorar la calidad de su zapatos.

loans.use: To buy materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María has been reading Tarot cards for 25 years. But for the past 15 years she has prepared ‘flourishing baths’ (a ritual flower bath meant to bring good luck), worked with candles, passed the egg and the guinea pig (a treatment meant to heal illness), and done spiritual cleansing.

Her former husband was the one who taught her and even today she is dedicated to this activity. Ana María has clients from all parts of the country that come to her humble house for a consultation. She has clients abroad, to whom she reads the Tarot by telephone. She has even traveled to other provinces to do spiritual cleaning. She attends to 10 people in her house daily.

The loans that she has requested will allow her to implement her candles, perfumes and essences. Ana María would like to have her own doctor's office in another zone of Lima.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana María se encarga de la lectura de cartas del Tarot desde hace 25 años. Pero desde hace 15 hace baños de florecimiento, trabaja con velas, pasa el huevo y el cuy, y limpia espiritualmente.
