Su ex esposo fue quién le enseñó y hasta el día de hoy ella se dedica a esta actividad. Ana María tiene clientes de todas partes del país que llegan por una consulta a su humilde casa. Tiene clientes en el extranjero, a quienes les lee las cartas por teléfono. Incluso ha viajado a provincia para hacer limpieza espiritual. Al día, atiende en su casa a 10 personas.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para implementar sus velas, perfumes y esencias. Ana María quisiera tener un consultorio propio en otra zona de Lima.

loans.use: To purchase candles, perfumes and essences for her spiritual healing practice.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es:
Maria Nela, her partner and her two children (7 and 2 years old) live on 25 de Julio Street in the zone of the same name in the city of El Alto. The couple works in a small workshop in which they repair refrigerators and gas stoves. They are requesting a loan so they may acquire a necessary tool for their work.

This is her second loan from Impro, and the evaluation conducted qualifies her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Nela, su concubino y sus dos hijos (7 y 2 años) viven en la calle 25 de Julio de la zona del mismo nombre en la ciudad de El Alto. La pareja trabaja en un pequeño taller en el cuál realiza la reparación de refrigeradores y cocinas a gas. Solicitan crédito para adquirir una herramienta de trabajo.

Este es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a necessary tool for their work.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe has a wife and two children, ages 19 and 24. He breeds cattle, whose milk production is sold to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). The family lives in the Igachi Community in the Los Andes province (three and a half hours from the city of La Paz)

He will use this loan to purchase livestock of a better breed. This is his first loan from Impro, and the evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipe tiene una esposa y dos hijos de 19 y 24 años respectivamente. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). La familia vive en la comunidad de Igachi, provincia Los Andes (a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz).

El monto del crédito será destinado en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase livestock of a better breed.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo lives in the Igachi Community in the Los Andes province (three and a half hours from the city of La Paz) with his wife and five children, ages 14, 13, 11, 8 and 6. His work is the breeding of cattle, whose production is sold to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant).

He will use this loan to acquire livestock of a better breed. This is his first loan from Impro, and the evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo vive en la Comunidad de Igachi, provincia Los Andes (a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz) junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 14, 13, 11, 8 y 6 años respectivamente. Su actividad comercial es la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche es comercializada a la Planta Industrializadota de leche PIL Andina.

El crédito lo usara para adquirir ganado de raza mejorada. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo. .

loans.use: Purchase livestock of a better breed.

loans.name: Angelino

texts.es:
Angelino lives in the Igachi Community in the Los Andes province, three and a half hours from the city of La Paz. He has a wife and two children, ages 17 and 8. He breeds cattle, whose production is sold to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). He also works as a bricklayer to increase his monthly income.

He is requesting a loan to invest in fodder and to improve his cultivating fields. This is his first loan from Impro; the results of our evaluation approve of Angelino’s request.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Angelino vive en la Comunidad de Igachi provincia Los Andes a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene una esposa y dos hijos de 17 y 8 años respectivamente, se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción es comercializada a PIL Andina (una Planta Industrializadota de Leche). También trabaja como albañil para incrementar sus ingresos mensuales.

Solicita crédito para invertir en forraje y mejoramiento del terreno de sembradío. Es el primer crédito con Impro, los resultados de nuestra evaluación aprueban la solicitud de Angelino.

loans.use: Purchase fodder and improve his cultivating fields.

loans.name: Wellinton

texts.es:
Wellinton is a selfless father and a loving husband who sacrifices himself daily in order to ensure his small daughter and dear wife’s well-being. With the aim of acquiring the medicine necessary for the well-being of Delia – he toils daily in his fields, and even more so when the time for harvesting arrives as the swift gathering of his crops guarantees their immediate sale. He has ambitions to improve his work and produce with better tools, manures and fertilizers.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Wellinton, es un abnegado padre y un amoroso esposo dispuesto a sacrificarse diariamente para procurarle bienestar a su pequeña hija a su querida esposa. Con el deseo de adquirir el medicamento necesario para el bienestar de Delia, se esfuerza a diario en sus campos de cultivo y aún más cuando llega la época de cosecha ya que el recojo oportuno de sus productos le garantizan la venta inmediata. Tiene deseos de mejorar su ocupación y productos con mejores herramientas y abonos y fertilizantes naturales.

loans.use: Purchase of tools, manure, fertilizers etc. to improve his production.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando is a very hard-working man; he has always been responsible, especially when it comes to being a father. He has been earning a living by raising potatoes for a very long time now. Unfortunately this year his crop has not been very successful, mainly due to harsh weather. That is why he is asking for a loan to be able to buy a larger amount of seeds and fertilizers so that he can have a productive farming season.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

ORLANDO, es muy trabajador y siempre ha asumido con responsabilidad su rol de padre. Desde hace mucho está dedicado a la siembra de papa y debido a las inclemencias de este año las pérdidas han sido cuantiosas, desea revertir este hecho e incrementar su producción esta próxima temporada, por esta razón solicita un préstamo ya que con el comprará mayor cantidad de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa makes a living by raising cows and raising vegetables on her parcels of land in the community of Santa Clara, which is far away from her home. She spends a lot of time working alone on the land and far away from her beloved family. She suffered from a tragedy when she lost her husband. Now she has to work hard to provide her children with food and other necessary things. She hopes to better her crops and she has decided to obtain a small calf and natural fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

ELSA se dedica a la crianza de vacas y al cultivo de vegetales en sus pequeñas parcelas que tiene en la comunidad de Santa Clara muy lejos de su hogar y por este motivo pasa muchas horas sola sin la compañía de su amada familia.Esto a causa de la trágica situación que le tocó vivir cuando perdió a su amado. Ahora tiene la convicción de seguir trabajando para tener a buen recaudo a sus pequeños hijos. Desea mejorar su sembrío ha decidido adquirir una pequeña ternerita además de abonos y fertilizantes naturales para su cultivo de vegetales.

loans.use: Purchase a calf, manure, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Every morning Valeriana, with the help of her beloved children, milk their cows to sell the product to customers that buy from them every day. She also makes cheese while her husband tends to his vegetable crop on their land. Thanks to her hard work her older children have been able to go to school in the capital of the country without lacking any basic needs. Her biggest wish is that her potato crop will be productive and for this reason she is asking for a loan that will enable her to purchase a greater quantity of natural fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Todas las mañanas Valeriana con ayuda de sus amados hijos, procede extraer leche de sus vaquitas para comercializarla a las personas que acuden por ella a diario y también para elaborar quesos mientras su amado esposo se dedica al cultivo de vegetales en sus campos. Gracias a su esfuerzo sus hijos mayores pueden desarrollarse en la capital de su país sin privaciones.Su deseo es mejorar su cultivo de papas y por esa razón solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes naturales.

loans.use: The purchase of natural fertilizers to benefit her potato crop.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Thanks to Dina’s cows, which she tends every morning and they love her attention, they give Dina a great amount of milk. She sells the milk and also prepares delicious cheese. Thanks to the cows and Dina’s grand effort she is able to have the necessary income for her household needs. She would like to purchase another cow to be able to increase the making of cheese and also to satisfy her clients needs.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

DINA gracias a sus vaquitas a quienes atiende desde muy temprano, debido a que complacidas por la buena atención que les otorga día a día le otorgan una gran cantidad de leche para que pueda comercializarla y también para preparar deliciosos quesos. Gracias a ellas y al esfuerzo de Dina las cosas dentro de su hogar marchan muy bien y tiene el deseo de comprar una vaquita más para incrementar su producción de quesos y así satisfacer las peticiones de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase a little cow.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Denis T. is from the El Sauce municipality of the city of León. Currently, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. He is the father of three small children who he cares for and has the responsibility of educating.

It’s important to note that Denis is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. It’s for this reason that he turned to CEPRODEL to obtain a loan to purchase some pregnant cows to help him increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Denis T. es originario del municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León, actualmente se dedica al negocio de la ganadería ya que este municipio se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera en altos porcentajes. Es padre de tres pequeños hijos los cuales atiende y esta en el deber de proporcionarles todas las condiciones necesarias para que ellos se desarrollen en sus estudios.

Es necesario destacar que hoy en día, el señor Denis esta consciente de que debe de apoyar a su familia con el recurso económico para subsistir. Es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual poder comprar vacas en preñez para sacarles el máximo provecho y comercializarlas en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cows.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
The agriculture business is one that requires much effort for the simple reasons that it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops.

Mr. Juan Narváez, from the El Sauce municipality of the city of León, has dedicated himself for a number of years to farming which supports his humble family who so relies on him. Currently, he has turned to CEPRODEL for a loan to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his children and wife who he loves greatly.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio agropecuario es un negocio que requiere de muchísimo esfuerzo por la sencilla razón de que se necesita exposición al sol y al desgaste físico en el traslado de los animales de un lugar a otro y además en el proceso de asistencia en los cultivos para llevar a cabo las siembras.

El señor Juan Narváez es originario del municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León dedicándose desde ya hace varios años al negocio agropecuario con el cual sustenta a su humilde familia que tanto necesita de él. Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el cual comprar vaquillas para el desarrollo. Es de importancia destacar que con el otorgamiento de este crédito se beneficia tanto él como sus hijos y esposa a los que tanto ama.

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria V. is someone who, for the past several years, has had a farming business in the El Sauce municipality of the city of León. She is very knowledgeable in the areas of agriculture and livestock, and with these endeavors she supports her humble household.

The problem in the area where Maria lives, which affects her as well as the other villagers, is the fact that they do not have electric power as it is an isolated area. They use candles for illumination, which does not afford them many advantages in their efforts to get ahead. For this reason, she has requested a solar panel with which to provide light. Upon its purchase, she turned to CEPRODEL to obtain a loan to pay for the panel. This installation will greatly help her and her family, which is composed of her four small children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria V. es una persona que desde hace varios años ha venido desempeñándose en el negocio agropecuario en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. Es muy conocedora del negocio agrícola y ganadero y con este sustenta su humilde hogar de habitación.

En el sector de habitación de la señora Maria la problemática que atraviesa tanto ella como sus aledaños es que no poseen energía eléctrica por estar en una zona muy alejada y por este motivo hacen uso de candiles para iluminarse sin embargo no les es de mucho provecho para su desarrollo. Es por esta razón que ella ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar con el cual pueda iluminarse y al haberlo adquirido ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para el pago de este bien que le será de mucho provecho tanto para ella como para su familia compuesta por sus cuatro pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel for her home.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa R. works in farming in the El Sauce municipality of the city of León. She is the mother of four small children. They are all of school age, and she has the responsibility of providing for their educations.

Currently, due to the fact that they live in an area that does not have electric power, she has asked for the installation of a solar panel so she can have light in her house and better undertake her household tasks and allow her children to be able to study. It’s for this simple reason that today she seeks the support of CEPRODEL to help her pay for the solar panel and, in this way, she can provide the conditions necessary for her children’s development.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Teresa R. trabaja en el negocio agropecuario en el municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León. Es madre de cuatro pequeños hijos todos en edades escolares los cuales ella está en el deber de proporcionarles todas las comodidades para que ellos puedan estudiar.

Actualmente por vivir en un sector donde no se cuenta con energía eléctrica, ella ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para alumbrarse en su casa de habitación y así llevar a cabo los quehaceres del hogar y además permitir que sus hijos estudien sin ningún problema con la falta de energía. Es por este sencillo motivo que hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita cancelar el pago del panel solar y de esta manera continuar brindándole a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel for her home.

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
In the municipality of El Sauce, in the city of León, lives Marina de Jesús a hard working older woman who for many years has dedicated herself to farming with the objective of maintaining her humble home which is in much need of investment. Her need today results from living in an isolated area, where she does not have access to electric power. Therefore, she asked for the installation of a solar panel so she could have use of two lamps and a small television.

For this sole reason, she has asked for the support of CEPRODEL to obtain a loan with which to pay for the solar panel. Her wish is to continue working under improved conditions so she can have a better chance of getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León la señora Marina de Jesús es una ancianita muy esforzada que desde hace muchos años se ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario con el objetivo de mantener su humilde hogar de habitación que tanto necesita de inversión. Hoy en día la necesidad que ella atraviesa es que debido a que vive en una zona muy alejada, donde no se cuenta con energía eléctrica, ella ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para tener acceso a dos lámparas y un pequeño televisor.

Por esta unica razon es que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el credito con el cual pagar el panel solar y de esta manera continuar con su actividad economica bajo mejores condiciones de vida para salir adelante.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel for her home.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha Lorena M. is a very hardworking woman, dedicating herself to her agricultural business for several years now with the aim of improving her living conditions and concurrently provide a better education for her three school-aged children.

Since she started her business, she has always had in mind improving her status of living and investing to generate a better income for her children who hope to continue their studies.

The need she currently has occurred because she does not have electricity in her home, given that she lives in a very isolated area. For this reason, she has reached out to CEPRODEL for assistance in obtaining a loan to pay for installation of a solar panel. Upon receipt of the loan, she must be very responsible and cancel her debt so that she can get ahead along with her kids who rely on her a great deal.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Lorena M. es una mujer muy esforzada en su negocio agropecuario dedicándose a esta labor desde hace varios años con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y de igual manera de brindarles las mejores condiciones de estudio a sus tres hijos en edad escolar.

Desde que inició su labor siempre ha tenido en mente mejorar su status de vida invirtiendo para obtener mejores ingresos para sus hijos con el propósito de que logren estudiar.

La necesidad que actualmente atraviesa es que no posee energía eléctrica en su hogar por vivir en una zona muy alejada. Por esta razón es que ha solicitado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito oportuno para el pago del panel solar debido que al haberlo obtenido tiene que ser muy responsable y cancelar esta deuda para que de esta manera logre salir adelante junto con sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel for her home.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha has worked since she was a small girl in growing flowers and we found her working hard in her fields where she showed us a special flower called "Lentejas". This flower is used for decorations and flower arrangements. These flowers are placed around different kinds of flower arrangements. This work is difficult and the fruits of her labor come to be every five months. Her husband is also a farmer and his desire to contribute to bettering the family has brought him to consider the possibility of increasing their family's income by growing of vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

BERTHA, trabaja desde muy joven en el cultivo de flores y la encontramos efectivamente en sus campos donde nos mostró una especial flor llamada lentejas que sirven para las decoraciones y adornos que ponen alrededor de los diversos arreglos de flores.Este trabajo es muy arduo y los frutos de su cuidado se dan cada cinco meses. Su esposo también es agricultor y el deseo de contribuir a mejorar la han llevado a contemplar la posibilidad de incrementar sus ganancias con la siembra de vegetales.

loans.use: Capital to start her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is a woman with self-discipline and she is very dedicated to her work and her beloved children. She plants small flowers so that she can make decorative floral arrangements. This has she has become the activity that gives her the main source of income for her family. She hopes to increase her production and plant a larger quantity of flowers and decorative plants next year.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

NELLY, es una mujer abnegada y muy dedicada a su labor y a sus queridos hijos. Siembra plantitas para decorar los arreglos florales y se ha convertido su actividad en la principal fuente de ingreso económico para su familia. Desea seguir mejorando su producción y plantar la próxima temporada mayor cantidad de flores y plantas decorativas.

loans.use: Investment of capital to diversify her crop.

loans.name: Vilma Angelica's Group

texts.es:
Damelta, Luz, and Vilma belong to the “Union II” comunal bank.

Damelta is married, is 39 years old and has 3 children. Luz lives with her husband, is 26 years old and has 2 children. Damelta and Luz each sell ice cream as street vendors on two important streets in the city of Ayacucho. Damelta also has a car which her husband uses for a taxi service.

Vilma, meanwhile, is a widow, is 51 years old and has 3 children. She has a small grocery store in her house, which is located in the Santa Ana neighborhood. Additionally, she also makes items on a loom, such as tapestries, and knits sweaters that she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Damelta, Luz, and Vilma need loans of 1,250.00 soles, 450.00 soles, and 900.00 soles, which they will use to buy a variety of ice creams, sugar, rice, and wool yarns.

The dreams of Damelta, Luz, and Vilma are to have their own houses, to expand their businesses, to have a restaurant, and that their children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Damelta, Luz y Vilma pertenecen al Banco Comunal Union II.

Damelta es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, por otro lado Luz es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos. Damelta y Luz venden helados por separado, de manera ambulatoria en dos calles importantes de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Damelta tiene un carro con el cual su esposo realiza servicio de taxi.

Mientras que Vilma es viuda, tiene 51 años y 3 hijos, Vilma tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa ubicado en el barrio de Santa Ana. Además Vilma hace artesanía en telar como tapices y también teje chompas que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Damelta, Luz y Vilma necesitan préstamos de 1250 soles, 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de helados variados, azúcar, arroz y lanas.

Los sueños de Damelta, Luz y Vilma son tener casa propia, ampliar su negocio, tener un restaurante y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Damelta, Luz, and Vilma need loans of 1,250.00 soles, 450.00 soles, and 900.00 soles, which they will use to buy a variety of ice creams, sugar, rice, and wool yarns.

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.es:
Hudulia, Agripina, and Erlinda belong to the “Union II” comunal bank.

Hudulia lives with her partner, is 27 years old, and has 2 children. She works as a street vendor selling ice cream on a well-transited street in the city of Ayacucho. She also makes gift and craft items.

Agripina is married, is 56 years old and has 5 children. She sells food and drinks from her house, which she does everyday.

Erlinda is married, is 36 years old and has 3 children. She sells food in a bus terminal in the city of Ayacucho. She also has a small grocery store in her house.

Hudulia, Agripina, and Erlinda need loans of 1,250.00 soles, 1,000.00 soles, and 600.00 soles, which they will use to buy ice creams, soft drinks, rice, cooking oil, and sugar.

Hudulia’s, Agripina’s, and Erlinda’s dreams are to have their own house, a car, to expand their business, and for their children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hudulia, Agripina y Erlinda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Unión II.

Hudulia es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Hudulia vende helados de manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además hace artículos de regalos y manualidades.

Por otro lado Agripina es casada, tiene 56 años y 5 hijos, Agripina vende comida y bebidas en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Mientras que Erlinda es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Erlinda vende comida en el terminal de una empresa de transportes de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Erlinda tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Hudulia, Agripina y Erlinda necesitan un préstamos de 1250 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de helados, gaseosa, arroz, aceite, azúcar y aceite.

Los sueños de Hudulia, Agripina y Erlinda son tener casa propia, un carro, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Hudulia, Agripina, and Erlinda need loans of 1,250.00 soles, 1,000.00 soles, and 600.00 soles, which they will use to buy ice creams, soft drinks, rice, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny belongs to the “Unión II” comunal bank.

Marleny is married, is 25 years old, and has one child. She sells telephone cards as a street vendor on a well-situated street in the city of Ayacucho. She works from very early in the morning until very late at night, making sales as she walks. She sells all types of telephone cards.

Marleny needs a loan of 1,000.00 soles, which she will use to buy phone cards of several brands.

Marleny dreams of having economic stability, of establishing her business in a store space, and that her son will have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marleny pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión II.

Marleny es casada, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Marleny vende tarjetas telefónicas de manera ambulatoria en un calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la noche, sus ventas los realiza caminando, actualmente vende todos los tipos de tarjetas.

Marleny necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas de diferentes marcas.

Marleny sueña con tener una estabilidad económica, establecer su negocio en un local y que su hijo tenga una buena educación.

loans.use: Marleny needs a loan of 1,000.00 soles to buy telephone cards of several different brands.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana belongs to the “Unión II” comunal bank.

Maximiliana is married. She is 40 years old and has 3 children. She and her husband have a store where they sell computers and accessories. The store space is rented and is located on a well-situated street in Ayacucho. They have had this business for 3 years and little by little they are improving it. They now have employees with technical training.

Maximiliana needs a loan of 2,500.00 soles, which she will invest in buying computer accessories, such as surge protectors, back-up batteries, and printer inks.

Maximiliana’s dreams are to buy a house in the center of the city, to own her own store space, and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Maximiliana pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión II.

Maximiliana es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Maximiliana junto a su esposo tienen una tienda donde vende computadoras y accesorios, el local es alquilado y esta ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realizan hace 3 años y poco a poco esta mejorando ahora cuenta con personal técnico.

Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios de computadora como fuentes, estabilizador y tintas.

Los sueños de Maximiliana son comprar una casa en el centro de la ciudad y tener local propio, brindar buenos estudios a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy computer accessories such as surge protectors, back-up batteries, and printer inks, for sale in her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina is a member of the “Union II” comunal bank.

Justina is a widow. She si 62 years old and has 4 children. She has a small store in her house where she sells grocery items, soft drinks, ice creams, and telephone cards. She runs the store with the help of her son. In the last few months, she has begun selling stationary items and medications.

Justina needs a loan of 1,500.00 soles, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, and telephone cards.

Justina’s dreams are to buy a car to carry her products and also to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II.

Justina es viuda, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos, Justina tiene una bodega en su casa donD. venD. abarrotes, gaseosas, helados, tarjetas telefónicas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hijo, en los últimos meses comenzó a vender papelería y medicamentos.

Justina necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, gaseosas y tarjetas telefónicas.

Los sueños D. Justina con comprar un carro para trasladar sus productos y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, and telephone cards to sell in her store

loans.name: Kimly Chay Group

texts.en: Five people in Sala Lek Pram village will be forming a group. Mrs. Kimly C. is the group leader. She sells clothes in the local market. Her business activity improved largely lately, so she would like to expand her business. Unfortunately, Mrs. Kimly C. does not have enough money to buy more new fashion clothes for her customers.  Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Kimly C. is 55 and the mother of two children, one of whom owns a small restaurant where breakfast is sold to the villagers. The other one is a cake maker and seller. Her husband, Mr. Sun E., is unemployed and he usually assists his wife in the market.

loans.use: Buy more new fashion clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Oun Nong Group

texts.en: Mrs. Oun N. is the leader of a group of six in Sala Lek Pram Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells fish in the local market. Her business activity works well, but her family needs more money. In order to improve her family's condition, Mrs. Oun N. decided to request a loan to buy more fish to expand her business. Mrs. Oun N., 46, has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are studying at the state school. The remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Lon Min, is unemployed, but he always helps his wife to buy more fish to re-sell. Previously, Mrs. Oun N. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Bilquis' Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji, wife of M. N., lives in a small city named Arifwala in Pakistan. (Baji is a term meaning 'elder sister' in Urdu). Bilquis is five years younger than her husband. She owns a two-room brick house. She is a mother of two sons. Her younger son has a fruit business. She is applying for a loan for her elder son who is 22 years old and has a crockery business. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members. Akbar baji wants a loan for her jam business. Nusrat baji wants a loan for her husband’s catering business. Mukhtaran baji wants a loan for her food business. Salma baji wants a loan for her spare parts business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is the wife of N. M., who is 54 years old. Shamim and her family live in a small city named Arifwala, Pakistan. Shamim owns a two room brick house, and she is a mother of two sons. She successfully completed her frist loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession, and she is applying for a loan for her husband, who wants to buy the masonry tools to expand his business.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members who are: Gulzaran baji (Baji is a term meaning "elder sister" in Urdu) wants a loan for her fruit business; Amna baji wants a loan for her fruit business; Sharifan baji wants a loan for her wood business; and Kosar baji wants a loan to buy electronic items for her husband’s electric shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Phany Pin Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phany P. is the leader of a group of five in Sala Lek Pram Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Phany P. is a silk weaver in the local village and she now faces an economic problem because she does not have enough money to buy silk to weave. Thus, Mrs. Phany P. is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials. Her husband, Mr. Lina Vann, owns a small restaurant where he sells Chinese noodles to the villagers. Mrs. Phany P. and her husband have one child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Phany P. has obtained a loan from AMK previously, to buy silk to weave. One of the group's members, Mrs. Sokhim Y., is not in the picture but her husband is.

loans.use: Buy silk to weave in order to improve her living condition.

loans.name: Phim

texts.en:
Phim S., age 33, is a true entrepreneur selling groceries, beef, pork, fish, and a variety of vegetables in front of her house. Everyday she has to get all the stuff she sells from a busy market which is not far from her house. Some people are very busy with their work, so they have no time to go the market and they just buy the food from Phim. Normally Phim can earn around $3 of profit per day. Her husband has been in the army since 1982. Of course, the army salary is extremely low and he just makes about $1 to combine with his wife's income to support the family. This couple has four children and all of them are students. They also have one niece who is a teacher at a state school.

Mrs. Phim's business is going forward even though she makes only $3 per day. She has many customers who always support her. To meet her customers' demands and also to make more profit to make her family's lives easier, she would like to request a loan to help her purchase a cow and pig for meat and some groceries. This will increase the amount she sells. The more she sells, the more money she makes.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and pig for meat

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is married to Muhammad M., who is 52 years old. (Baji is a term meaning 'elder sister' in Urdu.) Shamim and her family live in the small city of Arifwala in Pakistan. Shamim owns a two room brick house, and is a mother of one daughter whose is 21 years old. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, and she is applying for a loan for her husband, who wants to buy fruit.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members who are: Shamim baji, who wants a loan for her food business; Allah rakh baji, who wants a loan for her food business; Razia baji, who wants a loan for her fruit business; and Musarat baji, who wants a loan for her wheat business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Sokha Lay Group

texts.en: Five people in Sala Lek Pram village form one group, whose group leader is Mrs. Sokha L.. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup to the villagers. In order to make her business more successful, Mrs. Sokha L. wants to expand her business; thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more rice and fish to prepare her delicious rice soup to sell for an income. Mrs. Sokha L. is 51 and the mother of three children, all of whom are employed in garment factories. Her husband, Mr. Eang Chea Kean, is a chief soldier.

loans.use: Buy more rice and fish to prepare her delicious rice soup to sell for an income.

loans.name: Majidan's Group

texts.en:
Majidan baji is married to I. A., who is 59 years old. (Baji is a term meaning "elder sister" in Urdu.) Shamim and her family live in a small city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Shamim owns a two room brick house, and she is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Majida’s daughter is in 10th standard, and her sons work as property dealers. Her husband is a wedding organizer, and has been in this profession for the last 7 years. She is applying for a loan for her husband’s business, so that he will be able to buy attractive materials which look nice for occasions like weddings.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members who are: Zahida baji, who wants loan for her decorative embroidery business; Khalida baji, who wants a loan for her grocery shop business; Abida baji, who wants a loan for her vegetable business; and I. baji, who wants a loan for her cardboard business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji is married to M.S., who is 50 years old. (Baji is a term meaning 'elder sister' in Urdu.) Nusrat and her family live in the small city of Arifwala in Pakistan. Nusrat owns a two room brick house. She is a mother of one son, who is in 7th standard. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller, and has been in this profession for the last 20 years. She is applying for a loan for her husband’s business so that he will be able to buy more fruit and improve the financial conditions of the business.

She has been joined in her group by another member, Maqsoodan baji, who wants a loan for her fruit business. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To financially improve and expand their businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Bona Theang Group

texts.en: Mrs. Bona T. is the leader of a five-member group in Sala Lek Pram Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She makes yummy Khmer cakes that she sells to the local villagers. Mrs. Bona T. now wants to expand her business.  Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to buy more rice to make more Khmer cakes, thus she is asking for a loan for this goal. She is 44 and the mother of three children:  one is employed in a garment factory while another is attending state school. The remaining child is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Virak P., is unemployed but he always helps his wife to produce Khmer cakes. Previously, Mrs. Bona T. obtained a loan from AMK to start her cake-selling business.

loans.use: Buy rice to make more Khmer cakes.

loans.name: Bayim

texts.en: Bayim was born in 1974 and is married with 3 children.  The Israfilov family lives in Khachmaz region. Bayim started a cattle breeding business 5 years ago. Now she reqeusts a loan of $750 to buy a calf.  She promises to repay the loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Zokhra

texts.en: Zokhra (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children and lives in Khachmaz region. Zokhra was born in 1976. She has been in the farming business for 2 years. Now she requests a loan of $975 to buy fertilizer and seedlings.  She promises to repay the loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
B. Nargis is 21 years old and is not yet married.

Nargis has been running her own business for 4 years already. Nargis sells clothes for kids and women in a store which is located in one of the densely inhabited parts of the city. She began her business in order to have an independent income and to support her parents. Muhabbat is very nice and polite and has many clients. The business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for the family.

Now she requests $700 US in order to increase her stock of summer clothes for kids and women. Nargis is planning to repay the loan completely in 9 months. She promises to be accurate with the repayment of the loan and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing of new clothes to increase stock.

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en:
G. Sarvinoz is 19 years old and lives with her parents. In the past, she was helping her mother with her business of selling clothes. As she has always liked sales, it went well and she decided to open her own business.

Sarvinoz has been a market vendor for 3 years already. She sells underclothes for women in the local market, “Korvon”, in Dushanbe. Through these years, she managed to make her business stable and profitable, generating a stable income for her family, and allowing her to support her parents, brother and sister.

Now, Sarvinoz is planning to expand her business and in order to do so, she’ll need to increase her working capital for purchasing new, modern underclothes for women. From the profit of her business, she wants to buy her dearest brother a bicycle, which he has been dreaming about for a long time. With this purpose in mind, Sarvinoz requests $1000 US for a term of 12 months. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all for supporting her. Let’s get behind this loving sister to make her little brother’s dream come true. Your support will really help her.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for selling in order to expand the business

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en:
K. Mamlakat is 46 years old. She is married with 5 children.

Fifteen years ago, Mamlakat decided to start her own business with the purpose of improving the economical position of her family. She is a hard-working woman. Before having this business she had a job where she washed clothing, but it didn't generate sufficient income to cover her basic needs, and that was the main impetus to start her own business. Mamlakat is a market vendor. She has been selling shoes for kids and women in the local market. Her daughter helps her with the business. The husband of Mamlakat was unemployed for a long time, and not too recently he left for Russia to earn money. Therefore, Mamlakat’s business is currently the main source of income for supporting her family.

Now it is summer and Mamlakat is planning to purchase the new summer shoes for kids and women in order to increase the range of goods of her business. With this purpose she requests $ 700 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. Mamlakat thanks all for support and promises to repay the loan in time. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: Purchasing of the summer shoes to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Navruzgul

texts.en:
R. Navruzgul is 42 years old. She and her husband are raising three children of school ages.

For the last 2 years, Navruzgul has been selling clothing for kids in the local market. Each month, Navruzgul travels to the neighboring city to buy the clothing in order to enlarge and diversify her range of goods. Navruzgul is trying to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. Considering that the husband of Navruzgul is currently unemployed, her business is the main source of income for the family. Navruzgul is working hard and she dreams of educating all of her children, and improving the living conditions of the family.

With this purpose in mind, Navruzgul is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 US) for purchasing new kids clothing for the summer selling season. Navruzgul thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Navruzgul’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of new kids clothing for the summer selling season.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora K. was born in 1975 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. It is the high mountain region, where livestock is cultivated, so she is engaged in the family business of livestock raising and selling, as are many of her fellow villagers. Mrs. K. has 4 years of experience in this business and she has acquired good skills. She works on a collective farm. Now Mrs. K. is applying with KIVA with the request of a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 8 months to purchase another milk cow to start  milk production and selling it.

loans.use: Gulnora would like to buy one more milk cow.

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.en:
A. Shohsanam is a 27 year old lady. Shohsanam is the loving mother of two children, whom she is raising alone. Shohsanam is working hard in order to provide her kids with all they need, and also to pay for their education. In order to support her family, Shohsanam has been running her own business for 4 years already.

In the local market, she has been selling clothing for kids. Shohsanam is very successful in her business, considering that this is the only source of income for the family.

Shohsanam has previously been provided with loans by IMON, having a positive credit history without any violations. Today, Shohsanam requests $600 US, as this courageous woman plans to use the loan for increasing the range of goods and improving the lives of her children. She is promising to repay the loan in 4 months and thanks everyone for trusting and supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods in order to increase the range of goods and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en: Jumagul S. lives in the Asht region and she is married with three children. She has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but has showed herself to be a serious client. She is engaged in the family business of livestock. She works also works on a collective farm. Mrs. S. dreams of buying a pedigree bull to increase her livestock. So she is applying with KIVA with the request of financial support for her business's development with a loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months. Mrs. S. thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Jumagul would like to buy a pedigree bull to breed.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en: Gulnoza D. is 27 years old and she the mother of two children. She lives in the high-mountain region so she is engaged in the livestock business of milk production. It is the general direction that is developed in the Asht region. Mrs. D. also works on a collective farm. Now Mrs. D. is applying with KIVA with a request for a business support loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months. She would like to purchase special milk production equipment and equipment for making sour-milk products.

loans.use: Gulnoza would like to purchase special milk production equipment.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
B. Sabohat is 64 years old. She is a widow. Sabohat has a son who is a business man, and three wonderful grandchildren. She loves her grandchildren very much, and is doing the best she can in order to see their smiling faces.

Sabohat is a market vendor. She has been selling fabrics for national dresses for more than 11 years, and has gained a rich experience from her business. Sabohat has very good taste, and she is ready to advise her clients on which textile to choose for this or that occasion. Moreover, Sabohat’s prices for fabrics are attractive to various levels of the population, as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet.

She is applying for this loan in the hopes of expanding her business through the help of the additional funding. The additional generated incomes Sabohat is planning to use for improving the living conditions of the family. With this purpose in mind, she requests a loan of $300 US for a term of 3 months. She thanks all who are trusting her and supporting her, and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase of new fabrics for increasing the range of goods and improving the place of business.

loans.name: Toir

texts.en: MicroInvest has only worked with Mr. M. since 2008 but he recommends himself as being from the good side. His business's stability and income helped him to return previous loans on time and to improve his business so he brings thanks for the previous loan for a pedigree bull. Toir dreams of having a large herd so he can start his own business and open a trade outlet to sell his meat and milk-sour products. Now Mr. M. is applying with KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months so he can purchase a new cowshed area building.

loans.use: Toir would like a new cowshed area building.

loans.name: Manija

texts.en:
M. Manija is a 21 year old lady. She is a widow and the loving mother of her child. Manija is living with her parents. Manija’s child is small now, but already today she is working hard in order to ensure the best future for him. Her business is the main source of income of her family.

Manija has been running her own small business for three years already. She has a place in the local market for selling stationery and different kinds of detergents like soap, washing powder, shampoo, toothpaste and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Manija’s grandmother is pictured in the photo as Manija left that day by herself to purchase new goods.

Now she requests a loan of $450 US. Manija is planning to use the loan to purchase more goods for selling, thus increasing the range of goods and earning more income so that she can provide everything her darling child will soon need. Manija promises to repay her loan within 4 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing goods for selling in order to increase the stock

loans.name: Mukimjon

texts.en: Mukimjon M. was born in 1961 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Like many of his fellow villagers he is engaged in the livestock business. Mr. M. is very experienced in livestock; he has been in the business for 20 years. He has a large herd. His business includes raising the livestock and selling meat and milk-sour products he makes. He is married and has five children so he has to work hard to ensure good lives for his family. He works as a tractor driver on a collective farm. Now Mr. M. is applying with KIVA with a request for financial support. He requests a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 8 months to open a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.use: Mukimjon would like to open a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura A. is 21years old. She was born in and lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Mrs. A. has been in the livestock business for 10 years. She started when she was a young girl and helped her mother take care of the herd. Now Mrs. A. is married and helps her husband with taking care of and milking the animals. She trades the milk among fellow villagers and in the local bazaar. Now Mrs. A. is applying with KIVA to ask for the financial support of her livestock business. She asks for a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 8 months to purchase another milking cow.

loans.use: Manzura would like to purchase another milking cow.

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
M. Uguloy is 37 years old. She is a widow. She has an adorable son for the sake of whom she is living and working. Uguloy is a market vendor. She sells clothing for teenagers in the local market. Uguloy travels to the neighboring city to purchase the goods for selling, and her son helps in selling at the market. In general, the business is stable with a strong trend for further development.

However, Uguloy stresses that, after loans provided by the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON, she managed to accelerate the process of development of her business considerably. For instance, with one of the loans, Uguloy was able to rent one more trading place in the market.

Today, she is planning to increase the working capital in order to expand her business. For this purpose, she requests a loan of $475 US for the term of 4 months. Uguloy promises to mange the current loan with accuracy, as she did all the previous ones, and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Increasing of the turnover capital with the purpose of business development.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
M. Muhabbat is 47 years old. Muhabbat is the loving mother of two adorable sons. She is raising the children alone.

Not having the marital or moral support, Muhabbat decided to become an entrepreneur. For more than 15 years, she has been selling footwear. Only this business allows Muhabbat to support her family.

Now she requests a loan in the amount of $300 US as she is planning to expand her business in order to purchase more footwear and have a greater variety of goods. This way, she will earn more. From the profit of her business, she is planning to support her son in entering the university. Muhabbat promises to repay the loan in 4 months. Let’s support this brave and energetic woman.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for expanding the business.

loans.name: Rohila

texts.en: Rohila A. lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Like many of her fellow villagers she is engaged in the livestock business. It is the family business but she has her own duties. Mrs. A. is responsible for taking care of the animals and for milk production and making sour products. It is a very hard work. Mrs. A. is married and has a child. Besides this she works on a collective farm. She works hard and has a good reputation. Now Mrs. A. is applying with KIVA for help with a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 8 months. She'd like to purchase special modernized equipment to process milk to make milk-sour products.

loans.use: Rohila would like to purchase special modernized equipment to process milk to make milk-sour products.

loans.name: Ruzihol

texts.en:
S. Ruzihol is 59 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed. That is why Ruzihol's business is the main source of income for her family. Ruzihol is a market vendor. For more than 8 years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables such as apricots, apples, tomatos, cucumbers and many others in the central local market. Her younger daughter, who is pictured in the photo, helps Ruzihol with the business.

Every day, in the early morning, she buys fresh fruits and vegetables from the local farmers and sells them in the market. In the market, she is known among people because of the attractive prices and her friendly characteristics. All this allows Ruzihol’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family. Now it is a good season and her goods are in great demand.

She wants to expand her business in order to earn greater income to be able to arrange the marriage of her darling daughter. For this reason, she is planning to purchase new fresh fruits and vegetables for selling. Ruzihol is requesting a loan of $1000 US that will allow her to do these things. She is promising to repay within 12 months. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her arrange the marriage of her daughter. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.en: Ibrogim J. has been engaged in the livestock business for 20 years. He developed good and special skills by watching and helping his father in the livestock in his younger years. He has a good herd (a pedigree bull and a milk cow). Mr. J. also works on a collective farm. Mr. J. has a good reputation. He is a very good family man so he loves his family and wants a good future for them. He has five children. Now Mr. J. is applying with KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 4100 STJ for 10 months. He wants to purchase rams to develop his sheep business. He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Ibrogim would like to purchase rams to develop his sheep business.

loans.name: Thin Su Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thin S. is the leader of a group of four in Andong Chek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Mr. Hoeurn Mao, are basket makers in the village. They have three children:  one is employed in a garment factory, another is a cake maker, and the third works in a CD shop in the local village. Although all the members of the family have different business activities, the overall profit is still not sufficient to support the family; therefore Mrs. Thin S. wants to start a pig breeding business. In order to accomplish this task, Mrs. Thin S. asks for a loan to buy pigs and pig food to feed them. In September last year, Mrs. Thin S. got typhoid and she spent a lot of money to get cured.

loans.use: To buy pigs to start a business.

loans.name: Saom Art Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saom A. is the leader of a group of six members in Andong Chek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She makes and sells baskets in the local village. Mrs. Saom A. wants to expand her business so she is asking for a loan to bU. more baskets to re-sell.  The baskets she makes are not completed on time. Mrs. Saom A. is 56 and the mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Chheang Sok, is a laborer in the local village. Previously, Mrs. Saom A. had obtained a loan from AMK to stA. her basket business. Last year, her youngest child got dengue fever and Mrs. Saom A. had to spend an unforeseen amount of money to cure the disease.

loans.use: To buy more baskets to re-sell.

loans.name: Guliniso

texts.en: Guliniso M. has been an executive and reliable client of MicroInvest since 2008. She first applied to MicroInvest when she heard about the open and moderate loan procedure. Mrs. M. has been engaged in the commercial service of making yarn and warm yarn socks that she trades in the local bazaar for 5 years. She is 31 years old, divorced and has two children. She is very ready to work to ensure the good future of her children. She has no special or higher education, so she dreams of giving a great education to her children. Now Mrs. M. is applying with KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months.

loans.use: Guliniso would like to increase her yarn and homemade sock business.

loans.name: Thuok Saom Group

texts.en: Five people in Andong Chek Village have formed a group and Mrs. Thuok S. is their group leader. She sells baskets and her husband is a basket maker. They have two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is too young to work or study. In order to improve the family budget, Mrs. Thuok S. decided to ask for a loan both to buy bamboo to make more baskets and to buy ready-made ones to re-sell. Previously, Mrs. Thuok S. had obtained a loan to buy baskets to re-sell.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to make more baskets and to buy ready-made ones to re-sell.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom K. lives in the Asht region and she is married with three children. She has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but she has showed herself to be a serious client. She is engaged in the family business of livestock. She works also on a collective farm. Mrs. K. dreams of buying a pedigree bull to increase her livestock. So she has applied for a loan with KIVA for financial support. She's asked for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 8 months. Mrs. K. thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Dilorom would like to buy a pedigree bull for breeding.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira E. was born in 1984 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Mrs. E. has been in the livestock business for 13 years. She started when she was a young girl and helped her mother in taking care of the herd. Now Mrs. E. helps her husband with the animals, taking care of them and getting their milk. She trades the milk among her fellow villagers and in the local bazaar. It is a partial participation so Mrs. E. works on a collective farm. Now Mrs. E. is applying with KIVA to ask for financial support of her livestock business. She asks for a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months.

loans.use: Zamira would like to increase her livestock.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en: Faizullo K. lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Like many of his fellow villagers he is engaged in the livestock business. Mr. K. is very experienced in livestock and he has been in the business for 25 years. He has a large herd of cattle. His business includes raising the livestock, selling the meat and making milk-sour products and selling them. He is married and has five children so he has to work hard to ensure good lives for his family. Now Mr. K. is applying with KIVA with a request for financial support in his business's development with a loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months.

loans.use: Faizullo would like to expand his livestock business.

loans.name: Serifatu

texts.en:
Serifatu A. is 40 years old and is married with 5 children.She lives in Sabo Oniba, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells charcoal and firewood, a skill that she acquired 5 years ago. She has been in this business since 1988. Serifatu owns a shop and she also sells charcoal and firewood from her back yard.

Serifatu has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. She now needs a loan of $700 to buy 20 more charcoal and firewood to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is 53 years old and the mother of four children. She has rented a store and has been selling grocery products like pasta, cocoa products, tinned milk, tinned fish, soft drinks, sanitary towels, sugar, etc. for 14 years now. Millicent’s last child is currently in university and she pays fees from the proceeds of the business. She wants to use her loan to buy more products like sanitary towels, pampers, bathing and washing soaps, soft drinks, etc. to increase inventory and sales. Millicent is a member of the group called God is Good. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of grocery products

loans.name: Sahida

texts.en: Sahida (her husband is pictured) was born in 1957. She is a mother of 3 children. The Karimov family lives in Khachmaz town. Sahida has one year of experience in the farming business. Now she requests a loan of $625 to buy fertilizer and seedlings for improving her farming.  She promises to repay the loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a food vendor and she has three children who are currently in school. She prepares banku (local dish prepared from milled maize which is boiled with water and then eaten with soups) and sells her food in the evening. Many people cannot cook for themselves and this has created a very good market for her. She wants the loan to buy more bags of maize, assorted meat and vegetables to expand her operations. Faustina is a member of the group called God is Good. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, vegetables and assorted meat

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is married with one child. She is 37 years old and she has been selling assorted soft drinks in her local town for 5 years now. Her town is very popular with tourists who visit the country and, therefore, the demand for drinks is high. Vivian wants to use the loan to buy more crates and cartons of drinks to increase her inventory and sales. She is a member of the group called God is Good. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Christian is 42 years old and a mother with three children. She has a beauty salon and has been operating it for 8 years now. Christian feels that her community has helped her a lot, and therefore to give back to society she has taken on 11 young women who are learning the trade from her. She wants to use the loan to buy hair products like perm creams, activators, artificial hair for braiding, hair food, rollers, hair pins, etc. to expand her operations. She is a member of the group called Holy Cross. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan. In the picture, Christian is in a brown dress, and she is with five of the young women who are learning the trade.

loans.use: To buy more hair products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Onwugbenu

texts.en: G. Onwugbenu lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells tailoring materials. It took her a year to acquire this skill and she has been in this business since 1998. Her tailoring materials are well arranged in different, attractive colors, which distinguishes her from other small-scale entrepreneurs. Mrs. Onwugbenu is 38 years old and is married with 2 children. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more tailoring material to sell.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Surma

texts.en: Surma was born in 1967 and is a mother of 3 children. She lives in Khachmaz town. 10 years ago she started a clothing business. Now she requests a loan of $750 to buy more inventory.  She promises to repay the loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity O. owns a restaurant. She sells drinks and pepper soup. It took her 3 years to acquire the necessary skills and she has been in this business since 1988. Charity is 48 years old and is married with 5 children. She lives at Sabo Oniba, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy more drinks and pepper soup ingredients to meet the demands of her numerous customers.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and pepper soup ingredients

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke A. lives at Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells weave-ons and hair-lengthening attachments, and she is also a hair stylist. It took her two and a half years to acquires these skills and she has been in this business since 2001. Joke is 29 years old and is married with three children. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more weave-ons and hair attachments to sell. This, she said, will help her serve her customer better. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more weave-ons and hair attachments

loans.name: Adetutu

texts.en: Adetutu E. sells medicines in her community market, which is very close to her home in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 52 years old and is married with 3 children She has been in this business since 1980. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more medicine to sell. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Rahim was born in 1973. He is married and has 2 children.  The M. family lives in Khachmaz region. 6 years ago Rahim started a farming business. Now he requests a loan of $975 to buy fertilizer and seedlings.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Oyebola

loans.name: Rebecca

She hopes this loan would help her to start saving to enable her to register to become part of the National Health Insurance Scheme, so that she can also enjoy free medical care with her son. As part of her social responsibility, she is currently training 5 young women to become seamstresses so that they can also earn a living. Rebecca is standing in the middle of the photo. She is a member of the group called Sons of God. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

Justina has been engaged in her business for 10 years now. She wants to use the loan to buy more boxes of cereal to increase inventory and also to avoid price hikes. .

She is requesting a loan amount of $850 to buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sales.

loans.name: Kudirat

loans.name: Grace

She has three sewing machines, and this made her shop stand out from every other fashion designer's. She is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She is very optimistic and enthusiastic to lift her family above poverty. Grace lives at Akensan in Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $700 to buy one weaving machine so that she can meet and satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Madame Tene

texts.fr:
Mrs. Tene Traoré is a married woman aged 29 and the mother of three children. Faced with a lack of funds for running her fish selling business, she decided to join one of Soro Yiriwaso’s solidarity loan associations. After four solidarity loans, she has moved on to an individual loan. All previous loans were repaid successfully. She buys her stock mainly in Bobo Dioulasso (a town in the West African republic of Burkina Faso) and sometimes in Bamako (Mali’s capital). She plans to use this loan to buy 20 cases of fish and ice on a daily basis. She sells every day along Highway 2000 in Médine, Ségou. Sales are midway between wholesale and retail, or retail, and are generally paid for in cash. Because of the quick turnover of fish, she expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 90,000. This profit will be used to pay the interest on the loan, to pay for ice, for savings, and to contribute to the family’s expenses. She hopes to improve the appearance of her sales location and continue to grow her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Tene Traoré est une femme mariée âgée de 29 ans mère de 3 enfants. confrontée à un problème de fonds de commerce pour mener son activité de vente de poissons, elle décida d’intégrer une association de crédit solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso. Après quatre prêt solidaires, elle est passée au prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle s’approvisionne surtout à Bobo Dioulasso (Une ville de la république du Burkina Faso en Afrique de l’ouest) et quelques fois à Bamako (la capitale du Mali). Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 20 cartons de poissons de mer et de la glace quotidiennement. Elle vend tous les jours au bord de l’auto route 2000 à Médine Ségou. La vente se fait en demi gros ou en détail et généralement au comptant. En raison de la rotation rapide de l’activité de vente de poissons, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, payer la glace, épargner et participer aux charges de la famille. Elle compte améliorer la présentation de son lieu de vente et continuer à augmenter la taille de son activité.

loans.use: To buy cases of fish

loans.name: Mwamini

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Mwamini K.. She is married, and has three children aged five, seven and 13. She has two other dependents who live with her because they are orphans.

In 2000, Mwamini established her charcoal business. She opens her business seven days a week, 12 hours a day. She is assisted by her husband and on employee.

These small, black, and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

Mwamini has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk. In the future, Mwamini plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith A. lives in Iba, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes, shoes and recharge (phone) cards, a skill that she acquired for 6 months, and she has been in this business since the year 2003. She is 32 years old and single. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more clothes and recharge cards for sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and recharge (phone) cards

loans.name: Tunu

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Tunu M.. She is single and has one child, aged five. In 2005, Tunu established her furniture business in which she is assisted by two employees.

Tunu requires a loan in order to purchase materials for the construction of sofa sets, including sponge and fabric. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $40. In the future, Tunu plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase materials including sponge, cushions and fabric to make new sofa sets.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
Miguelina is a member of the group. She is an outgoing 30 year-old woman with one precious daughter and a drive to improve her economic situation. She owns a salon in her small community of Imbert, on the north coast of the Dominican Republic. With this loan she hopes to buy higher quality products, improve the appearance of the salon, and buy a new blow-dryer. When Miguelina isn’t working, she enjoys reading her Bible. Her favorite food is meat. In the future she hopes to have a proper home, and a safe place to raise her children.

Thank you Kiva lenders for supporting this amazing group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To improve her beauty salon and add new products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Gie Khoslou De Djirack Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of young women living in a region long reduced to poverty because of the armed conflict that raged for years in the southern region of Senegal. Consequently,  all the activities have been abandoned and except for farming we don’t do anything else during the 8 months following wintering. But Djirack is a coastal village, and we are planning to fish, to transform the fishing products, and to sell the fresh fish to the big towns or in the hotels and restaurants located in the region of Cap Skirring. Previously, we were all refugees outside of our village, but with calm returning, we came back home and are trying to practice activities that generate income. For this reason, we have solicited SEM for a loan through Kiva, to enable us to work with dignity.
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.
Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes femmes qui habitent une zone longtemps réduite à la pauvreté pour cause du conflit armé qui a sévit pendant de longues années au sud du Sénégal. Cette situation a fait que toutes les activités sont laissées à l'abandon et comme cela, hormis l'agriculture, nous ne faisons rien d'autre pendant les huits mois qui suivent l'hivernage. Mais Djirack étant un village côtier, nous envisageons de pêcher et de transformer les produits halieutiques, de vendre le poissons frais dans les grandes villes ou bien dans les hotels et restaurants qui sont installés dans la zone de Cap Skirring.Auparavant, nous étions toutes refugiées hors de notre village qui, avec le retour à l'acalmie, nous sommes rentrées chez nous et essayer de faire des activités génératrice de revenu. C'est pour cette raison que nous avons sollicité du SEM un financement par Kiva, afin de pouvoir travailler dignement.

loans.use:
Purchase and sale of fresh fish and resale in large towns in Senegal
Achat de poissons frais et revente dans les grande villes du Sénégal

loans.name: Bili

texts.en: Bili B. Sells drinks and water, a skill that she acquired for 6 years. She has been in this business since the year 2007. She is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She lives at Igando, Lagos State, Nigeria. Bili has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years; She needs a loan of $600 to buy more drinks and containers of water so that she can increase the prosperity of her business and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and containers of water

loans.name: Ololade
