texts.en: Ololade Y. sells kitchen utensils in Igando Community. She is 45 years old and divorced with 3 children. She is faced with both the challenges of being a single parent and also the being breadwinner of the family. She lives at Igando, Lagos State, Nigeria. Ololade acquired the skill of trading for 3 years. She has been in this business since the year 1990. She needs a loan of $700 to enable her to buy more kitchen utensils for sales.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils

loans.name: Deego De Djirack Group

texts.fr:
We live in the ecovillage of Djirack, left to fend for itself since the beginning of the 80’s because of the armed conflict that raged in the southern region of Sénégal. For a very long time, we remained victims of this situation that largely contributed to the impoverishment of this village’s population.  However, this region is rich in natural resources and mostly fishery products (oysters, shellfish, shrimps, cymbium and fish) . This is why we came to sollicit SEM so they could find us financing from Kiva in order for us to work. Our work will consist of fishing and transformation of fishery production (smoking, drying and salting of fish). We are also planning on selling fresh fish, because Djirack is a very important fishing harbor in the region situated nearby the resort of Cap Skirring. 
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Nous habitons l'écovillage de Djirack qui a été laissé à son sort depuis le début des années 80, à cause du conflit armé qui sévissait dans la région Sud du sénégal. Très longtemps, nous sommes restées victimes de cette situation qui a contribué largement à la paupérisation des populations de cette localité, pourtant riche en ressources naturelles et surtout, halieutiques (huîtres, coquillages, crevettes, cymbium et poissons). C'est pour cela que nous venons solliciter le SEM pour qu'il nous trouve un financement auprès de Kiva, afin que nous puissions travailler. Notre travail consistera à la pêche et à la transformation( fumage, sèchage et poissons salés) des produits halieutiques. La vente de poissons frais aussi est prévue, car Djirack est un port de pêche très important dans la zone qui se trouve non loin de la station balnéaire de Cap Skirring.

loans.use:
Purchase and sale of fresh fish and fishery products

Achat et vente de poissons frais, pêche produits halieutiques

loans.name: Kuburat

texts.en: Miss Kuburat B. sells phone (recharge) cards and also makes phone calls, a skill that she acquired for 6 months. She has been in this business since the year 2006. As a single lady this gives her enough opportunities and time to focus on her business so that she can maximize profit and increase her standard of living. At 24 years of age, she is optimistic and determined to diversify into the sales of phone lines and phone accessories, which she will be able to achieve with the loan she is requesting for. She needs a loan of $600 to buy more recharge cards and lines. She lives at Ikotun, Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more phone (recharge) cards and lines

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz lives with her husband and three children in the community of Laja in the Los Andes Province (3 ½ hours outside of La Paz). Her children are 22 years old, 19 years old and 17 years old. Cruz’s dedicates herself primarily to the raising of milk producing cattle, which she sells to the Andean Industrialized Milk Plant. She also works part-time as a transporter, as a way to increase the family income.

Cruz requests a loan in order to purchase high-breed cattle, which will increase the supply of milk her herd produces.

This will be her first loan from IMPRO. The evaluation of her economic status has approved her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Cruz vive en la comunidad de Laja, provincia Los Andes (ubicada a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La paz) junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 22, 19 y 17 años respectivamente. Su principal actividad comercial es la cría de ganado vacuno, por lo que produce leche que se comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Adicionalmente, trabaja como transportista para mejorar los ingresos familiares.

Cruz solicita crédito para comprar ganado de raza mejorada con el fin de incrementar su producción de leche.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of two milk cows in order to increase the volume of milk she is able to sell to PIL Andina.

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en: Ronke O. lives in Ikotun, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 51 years old and married with 6 children. She sells yam and garri (a food made from cassava). She travels outside the state, to Ogun State (a 3-hour drive by car) from Lagos State, to buy directly from farmers in their farms. This, she says, will cut costs, thereby making her able to sell at a lower price, which in turn will attract more customers to her shop. She acquired the skill for a year. She has been in this business since the year 1976. Ronke needs a loan of $700 to buy more yams and garri in large quantities so that she can increase her profit and lift her family above poverty.

loans.use: To buy more yams and garri

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco raises cattle for a living. He sells the milk he produces to the Andean Industrialized Milk Plant.

Fransico lives with his wife and children in the community of Pucarani, in the Los Andes Province (three hours outside of La Paz). Fransico earned a degree in agriculture and owns a small store in the plaza of Pucarani in which he sell veterinary products to other members of the community.

The requested loan will be used to purchase cattle, and thus to increase the production of milk. This is Francisco’s second loan from IMPRO and they have once again approved him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, la producción de leche es comercializada a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).

Su vivienda esta en la comunidad de Pucarani, provincia Los Andes (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz), vive con su esposa y sus hijos, él es egresado de la carrera de agronomía y tiene un local donde vende productos de veterinaria en la plaza del pueblo.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de ganado, de esa manera incrementará su producción de leche y sus ingresos. Es su segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow in order tin increase the production of milk.

loans.name: Gie Nénégoto Group

texts.fr:
In our region, it is the season of wild fruits ("madde" –raging apple-, "tolle" as they are called) and of forest products (palm nuts and fruits from palmyra palm, etc…). We want to work in this sector because there is a significant potential and there is something in it for everyone. For this reason we came to sollicit financing from Kiva, it will allow us to work well during the fruit picking season. We will have at our disposal a capital that will allow us to buy produce from the peasants. This is a very big market that will allow us to earn enough money to provide for the needs of our families and to prepare for wintering, which is always a very difficult time here. We are specialized is small retail according to the seasons and the produces available for resale.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Chez nous, c'est la période des fruits sauvages( madde, tolle, comme on les appelle chez nous) et aussi celle des produits forestiers (noix de palme, fruits du rônier,etc.). C'est dans ce domaine que nous souhaitons travailler, parce que le potentiel est très important et que tout le monde peut y trouver son compte. C'est pour cette raisons que nous sommes venues solliciter Kiva pour un financement qui nous permettra de bien travailler pendant la campagne de cueillette de fruits en ayant à notre disposition un capital qui puisse nous permettre d'acheter les produits chez les paysans. C'est un très gros marché, qui va nous permettre de gagner assez d'argent pour subvenir aux besoins de nos familles et préparer l'hivernage qui est toujours très difficile ici. nous spécialisées dans le petit commerce selon les saisons et les produits qui sont disponibles pour les revendre.

loans.use:
Trading of fruits and forest products

Petit commerce de fruits et produits forestiers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria raises cattle whose milk prodution is sold to PIL Andina (in English, “Andina Milk Industrialization Plant”). She lives in the community of Pucarani, a province located in the Andes, three hours from the city of La Paz. Victoria is married and has three children. She is also the owner of a general store that carries a variety of groceries. The store is in her home that is located in the town.

The loan will be used to purchase cattle to increase the production of milk and thereby raise her income. This is the second loan with Impro. The evaluation that was conducted qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche es comercializada a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la Comunidad de Pucarani, provincia Los Andes (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz). Victoria es casada y tiene hijos. Asimismo, es poseedora de una surtida tienda de abarrotes que esta en su casa, la cuál esta en el pueblo.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de ganado para incrementar su producción de leche y por lo tanto sus ingresos. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase milk-producing cattle of a better race to increase milk production

loans.name: Bukolola

texts.en: Bukolola O. lives in Ikotun, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells fabrics. These fabrics are well arranged in different colors. She was able to achieve this in full measure in the year 2006 when she started borrowing from LAPO Microfinance. She is 30 years old and married with two children. She has been in this business since the year 2001. Bukolola needs a loan of $700 to buy more cloth for sales. She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for sales

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, her husband and two children, ages 22 and 20 respectively, live on Gracilazo de la Vega Street in the Nueva Jerusalén neighborhood located in the city of El Alto. She works together with her husband in a small iodized salt processing operation whose production is sold directly to the public in the cities of El Alto and La Paz. The loan will be used to acquire the principle product (salt) at wholesale prices thereby benefiting from economies of scale due to the reduction in cost of said product. This is her third loan with Impro. Her track record and previous evaluation qualify her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana, su marido y sus dos hijos de 22 y 20 años respectivamente, viven en la calle Gracilazo de la Vega de la zona Nueva Jerusalén ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo en una pequeña procesadora de sal yodada, comestible cuya producción es vendida directamente al público de las ciudades de El Alto y La Paz. El crédito servirá para adquirir el principal insumo (sal) al por mayor y asi beneficiarse de las economias de escala, debido a la reducción del costo de dicho insumo. Este es su tercer crédito con Impro, sus antecedentes y la evaluación previa la califican para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase salt for an iodized salt production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Funds will be invested to purchase various items to boost a grocery store's inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke S. sells foodstuffs in her community market at Ikotun, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She acquired the skill for 3 years. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She has been in this business since the year 2005. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more foodstuffs for sales. She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sales

loans.name: Nicacia

texts.es:
Nicacia works offering housecleaning services in private homes and her husband is an electrician. She has a butcher shop that doesn’t operate at 100% of its potential due to the lack of working capital. Her home is located in Valle Hermoso Ladera Este in the city of La Paz and it belongs to her parents.

With this assistance she will be able to increase her income and quality of life. This is the fourth time that she is requesting a loan from Impro. The money will be used to buy merchandise for her business (groceries, meat and soft drinks). Her work and desire to get ahead allows her access to this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicacia trabaja ofreciendo los servicios de limpieza en domicilios particulares y su esposo es electricista. Tiene una carnicería que no trabaja en un 100% ya que le falta capital de trabajo y con esta ayuda podrá incrementar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de valle Hermoso Ladera Este de la ciudad de La Paz. que es de propiedad de sus padres. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para compra de mercadería de su negocio ( abarrotes, carne, y refrescos). Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise like meat, soft drinks and various other items to sell in a butcher shop

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario has a car that he uses to transport people from the airport to the center of the city of La Paz. His wife is a businesswoman who sells hamburgers. This is the seventh time that he is requesting a loan from Impro. The money will be used for the conversion of his vehicle from gasoline to gas thereby increasing his income by reducing the amount spent on gasoline. He is a responsible client in making his payments and his objective in the future is to be able to buy another car that will generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario tiene una movilidad que trabaja en el servicio de transporte del aeropuerto al centro de la ciudad de la Paz, su esposa es comerciante que vende hamburguesas. Es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para la conversión de gasolina a gas y así mejorar sus ingresos reduciendo sus gastos de gasolina. Es un cliente responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, y su objetivo en el futuro es poder comprarse otra movilidad que le pueda generar mas ingresos.

loans.use: Convert the car used in transportation business from gasoline to gas

loans.name: Elsi Del Rosario

texts.es:
Elsi lives in the municipality of Tepecoyo, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her son Julio, who she affectionately calls Julito. She worked very hard to have her own house, which she was able to do with the help of an Integral loan. Now, she wants to make some home improvements, including the construction an additional bedroom, which is the reason why she requested this loan. It should be noted that Elsi repaid her previous loan promptly and in full.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Elsi vive en el municipio D. Tepecoyo, del departamento D. La Libertad, junto a su hijo Julito, como le llama D. cariño. Ella ha trabajado muy duro con el afán D. lograr tener casa propia, lo cual ha conseguido a través D. un crédito brindado por Integral, ahora quiere empezar a mejorar la casa, iniciando con la construcción D. un cuarto adicional, siendo esta la razón por la cual doña Elsi esta solicitando un préstamo. Cabe mencionar que el crédito anterior adquirido con Integral lo pago puntualmente.

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Aaron Adepeju

texts.en: Aaron A. is business-oriented and very determined to expand her business. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more kitchen utensils and gift items for her shop. She is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She has been in this business since the year 1986. She remains grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more utensils and gift items

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo works making gift bags and piñatas to order. He has one school age son that helps him with his business. He is a widow and the only one working to support his family. This is the twelth time that he is requesting a loan from Impro and the second time he requires the support of Kiva. The money will be used to purchase materials (paper, cardboard, glue and colored paper).

His work and his desire to work allow him access to this credit because he has experience as a craftsman. He is a very responsible person because in all of the time he has worked, his behavior with regard to the loans he has obtained has been good and he has not had difficulty making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Arturo realiza todo trabajo de cotillones y piñatas a pedido. Tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar que le ayuda en su negocio. Es viudo y el único que se encarga de trabajar para su familia. Es la décima segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva, el crédito será destinado para la compra la compra de materia prima ( Papel, cartulina, carpicola y papel de color). Su trabajo y las ganas de trabajar le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como artesano. Es una persona muy responsable ya que en todo el tiempo que trabaja, su comportamiento en los créditos otorgados fue bueno y no tuvo problemas para efectuar sus pagos respectivos.

loans.use: Purchase paper, cardboard, glue and colored paper to make gift bags and piñatas

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina is a seamstress and has experience making women’s hats. Her husband travels to the interior part of the country to deliver her finished products. Her home is located in the Llojeta section of the Tiwiña de la Ladera Oeste neighborhood in the city of La Paz.

This is the ninth time that she is requesting a loan from Impro. The money will be used to buy materials (fabric, lining, jute and thread). Her work and the experience that she has allows her access to credit and her objective for the future is to be able to set up a shop with industrial machinery that allows for the creation of jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Ernestina es costurera y tiene experiencia en la elaboración de sombreros de mujer. Su esposo se dedica a viajar al interior del País para entregar su producto terminado. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Llojeta sector Tiwiña de la Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la novena vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, Forro, Yute, Hilo) Su trabajo y la experiencia que tiene le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que su objetivo para el futuro es poder instalar un taller con maquinarias industriales que le permitan generar fuentes de empleo.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, lining, jute and thread that are the materials needed to make women's hats

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun B. sells kerosene in Oyokoro Community, located at the northern part of Lagos State. She acquired the skill of trading for 6 months. She has been in this business for just one a year. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She has been a leader in a lending group under LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy more kerosene so that she can increase her sales and also lift her family above poverty.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for sales

loans.name: Ebun

texts.en: Ebun A. hails from Isheri Olofin in the outskirts of Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a hairstylist and also she sells weavons and attachments (extensions). She is 33 years old and married with 2 children; she acquired her skill for three years. Ebun has been in this business since the year 2006. She needs a loan of $525 to buy more weavons, attachments and hair cream for sales.

loans.use: To buy more weavon (hair weaving product), extensions and hair cream for sales

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo A. sells drinks and containers of water. This is a skill that she acquired one year aso, and she has been in this business since the year 2005. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She has been a leader in a lending group for the past one year. She lives at Isheri Olofin, a river area in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is asking for a loan of $525 to buy more drinks and containers of water for sales.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and water for sales.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Señora Justa lives in her own house in 3 de mayo Street, in the neighbourhood of Villa Nuevo Potosí, La Paz. She makes all types of ice cream that she sells at colleges, schools, and in the street. She has made enough money from this work to support her children for the last ten years. Because they are familiar with the work, the children also help in the business. The loan she is asking for is to buy a machine that will hygienically seal the packages in which the ice cream is sold.

Justa has had a previous loan with Kiva and paid it back satisfactorily. Her credit history is good, and she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Justa vive en casa propia en la calle 3 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, ella se dedica a la elaboración de helados de todo tipo los cuales los vende en los colegios, escuelas e incluso ambulando por las calles; con esta actividad ella mantiene a sus hijos desde hace 10 años así mismo los hijos, como conocen el negocio, trabajan con ella; el crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina selladora para que los helados sean vendidos higiénicamente dentro de sus sobres.

Justa ya obtuvo anteriormente un préstamo a través de Kiva y pagó muy bien. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To buy a machine that will seal the packages in which ice cream is sold, and thus improve the quality of the product.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Señor Jose lives with his parents in Juan de Vargas Street, in the neighbourhood of Miraflores, La Paz. He works in the Communications field as a producer, commentator, and cameraman. He is asking for a loan to pay for his studies at a private university in the city. If he pays all the money in advance, he will get a 10% discount—naturally he wants to take advantage of this offer.

He has no credit history with Impro, but he qualifies for a loan because of his wish to better his situation. We at Impro believe that Jose deserves this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Jose vive en casa de sus padre en la calle Juan de vargas de la zona de Mira flores de La Ciudad de La Paz , trabaja en un medio de comunicación como productor , locutor y operador. El crédito que solicita es para pagar sus estudios ya que en las universidades privadas de la ciudad cuando se paga por adelantado hay una rebaja del 10% y él quiere aprovechar esta situación.

No tiene antecedente con Impro pero califica para obtener un crédito, por sus deseos de superación. En IMPRO creemos que Jose se merece esta oportunidad.

loans.use: To pay university fees—100% payment in advance results in a 10% discount.

loans.name: Nusurat

texts.en: Nusurat I. lives at Isheri Olofin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells baby clothing, and she has been in this business since the year 2006. She is 25 years old and married with a child. Nusurat sells her products door to door. This is not an easy task, as she has to take her baby along with her. She is, however, determined and enthusiastic to succeed in her business. She is asking for the loan of $425 to buy more baby clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more baby items to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Señor Eduardo lives with his parents in Jaimes Freyre Street in the neighbourhood of Alto Sopocachi, La Paz. He uses his car as a radio taxi everyday, and this income is sufficient to cover his daily living expenses such as food and clothing even though he has no other income.

He is asking for a loan to improve the condition of his vehicle—a taxi has to be properly maintained—and the car needs some work. Eduardo has no credit history with Impro. However, as it is clear that he wants to improve his lot in life, he is eligible to join the part of the program that encourages new businesses, in the service sector, and access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Eduardo vive la la calle Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Alto sopocachi de la ciudad de la Paz en casa de sus padres, tiene un auto con el cual trabaja todos los días como radio taxi y con estos ingresos él puede mantenerse y cubrir su necesidades de alimentación y ropa ya que no cuenta con ningún otro ingreso.

El crédito que solicita es para mejorar las condiciones de su auto ya que trabajando como radio taxi la movilidad debe estar en buen estado de funcionamiento, es decir que el auto necesita su mantenimiento.No tiene antecedente con Impro, pero por sus deseos de superación entra dentro del programa de créditos de fomento, sector servicios, y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en: Bintu S. is a fashion designer. She has three sewing machines in her local shop. She is 24 years old and single. She has been in this business since the year 2007.  She acquired the skill for 3 years. She needs the loan of $425 to buy tailoring materials so that she can meet the demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you!

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Señora Maria lives with her daughter and mother in rented accommodation in Street D in the neighbourhood of Las Lomas in La Paz. Her job is recycling garbage. She sorts it according to demand: cardboard, glass, paper, used clothes etc, which she then sells by the kilo. Her mother helps her with this work, and they manage to get by if they live very frugally.

With this loan, Maria will have enough capital to buy a special machine to cut up the clothing. A machine would make this work a lot easier. Her previous credit history with IMPRO is good, and she qualifies for another loan. She has been a client of ours since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria vive en alquiler en la calle D de la zona de las lomas de la ciudad de la Paz con su hija y su mama; ella se dedica al reciclaje de basura, es decir que ella recicla basura y la selecciona según le pidan cartones, botellas, papel y ropa usada, etc., para luego vender por Kilo. Este trabajo lo realiza con ayuda de su madre y con este negocio pueden mantenerse y cubrir sus mas mínimas necesidades.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que la ropa usada la tiene que cortar y para eso necesita una maquina especial para cortar, lo cual le facilitará su trabajo. Su antecedente crediticio con IMPRO es bueno por lo cual puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Ella es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: To buy a special machine to cut up the used clothing she receives through her recycling business and then re-sells by weight.

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en: Mrs Jennet A. sells provisions and cosmetics in Olowora community. She is 37 years old and married with four children. She lives at Isheri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She acquired the skill of trading a year ago. She has been in this business since the year 2006. She is asking for a loan of $425 to buy more provisions and cosmetics for sales.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Miralem

texts.en: Miralem A. is a 46-year-old trader who keeps his own store in the Bilasuvar region. He has more than twenty years of experience in this field. He is married and has three children. He has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Señor Estanislao lives with his parents in Heroes del Acre Street, in the neighbourhood of Pura Pura, La Paz. As a student in Information Technology, he rented a store near to the house and installed networked computer games there. This little business provided him with a steady income, and so he decided to open an Internet Café. There are several colleges in his neighbourhood, and there is a need for Internet access.

The loan he is asking for will be used to buy a server from which he will run Internet service. His income will increase, and he will be able to pay for his studies, and his daily living expenses such as food etc. His credit history is good, and he qualifies for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Estanislao vive en la calle Heroes del Acre de la zona de Pura Pura de la ciudad de La Paz en casa de sus padres; Estanislao es estudiante de Informática motivo por el cual alquiló una tienda cerca de su casa e instaló juegos en red; este pequeño negocio le dió buenos ingresos y por lo tanto decidió poner un negocio de Internet ya que por su zona hay varios colegios y la necesidad de uso de servicio de Internet.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora que le sirva de servidor e instalar el Internet y así poder mejorar sus ingresos, seguir pagando su estudios y también solventar su alimentación y otros. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To buy a computer server for an Internet Café.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in raw materials to keep producing fried dishes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell in her community.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan A. is a 34-year-old man who has raised sheep for meat production since 1990. He breeds sheep for local bazaar traders. Once a week he goes to the livestock bazaar in Imishli region to sell his sheep and purchase lambs. Rovshan lives with his family in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. Because of hyper inflation, Rovshan's earnings are enough to feed his family but not enough to expand his business and increase the number of his sheep herd. To improve the life conditions of his family and expand his business, he has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase 10 sheep (for an estimated cost of $60 USD for each sheep and fodder for $200 USD).

loans.use: To purchase ten sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of various goods for a small cafeteria.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Adhemar

texts.es:
Mr. Adhemar lives in his parent’s house in the El Tejar zone of the city of La Paz. He lives there with his wife and small child. Adhemar has a car which he uses to run a taxi service, generating income to meet the living expenses of the family. With his savings, he bought another car that was in better condition than the previous one. The loan that he requests is to pay processing fees and obtain a title in his name so he can start working the new taxi to increase his income. This will allow him to provide more comfort and financial stability for his family.

His previous history is good, and he qualifies for a new loan. Adhemar has been a client of ours since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Adhemar vive en casa de sus padres en la calle final Eduardo Avaroa de la zona El tejar de la Ciudad de La Paz , vive con su esposa y su hijo pequeño. Adhemar tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como taxi generando así sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia; con los ahorros que tenia compro otro auto en mejores condiciones que el anterior; el crédito que solicita es para poder pagar los tramites y poner el título a su nombre y hacer trabajar el nuevo taxi y mejorar sus ingresos y dar comodidad y estabilidad a su familia. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Adhemar es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Pay for processing and change of title fees for the taxi he just purchased.

loans.name: Madame Koura

texts.fr:
43-year-old Mrs Koura Dembélé is the mother of 5 children and lives in a polygamous family in Ségou’s Médine neighborhood. She is unusual because she works in a sector monopolized by men, that is, selling timber (for use by building contractors). Her business is flourishing. After four solidarity loans (group loans), all of which were repaid, she is now requesting her first individual loan. She buys her supplies in the villages around Ségou and from the classified Faya forest (in the Koulikoroi region). The wood is taken to and stocked in Ségou. She expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 30,000. The profit will go towards the clothing, health and schooling of her five children. She plans to increase the size of her business and add on some complementary businesses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Koura Dembélé est une femme mariée de 43 ans et mère de 5 enfants, vivant dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou. Elle est une femme spéciale car évoluant dans un secteur monopolisé par les hommes à savoir la vente de bois (utilisé par les entrepreneurs de bâtiment pour faire les bétons). Elle mène une activité florissante. Après quatre prêts solidaires (prêts de groupe) tous remboursés, elle est à son premier prêt individuel. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages de la région de Ségou et dans la forêt classée de la Faya (Région de Koulikoroi). Le bois est acheminé et stocké à Ségou. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice est utilisé pour les dépenses d’habillement, de santé et de scolarité de ses cinq (5) enfants. Elle compte augmenter la taille de son activité et y ajouter d’autres activités complémentaires.

loans.use: To buy timber for the building trade.

loans.name: Sumaq Warmikuna Group

texts.es:
The communal bank “Sumaq Warmikuna”, which means “Beautiful Women” in the Incan dialect of quechua, is a newly-started institution with 14 members. The members are from the Asoc. Villa Militar, which is located 15 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

The members conduct a variety of types of businesses such as the sale of cereals, groceries, sweets, cosmetics, clothing and beverages. They market their goods in their neighborhoods, as well as on foot throughout the city of Ayacucho.

The members need different loan amounts, some need 300 Peruvian soles, others 600 soles, making the total loan 6,900 from the bank.

The loans will be invested into the purchase of sugar, rice, oil, milk, noodles, wheat, quinoa, beans, cookies, candies and sodas.

Their dreams incluD. expanding their businesses, building their homes and providing a good education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal “Sumaq Warmikuna” que significa “Mujeres Hermosas” en quechua, es un Banco que recién inicia con 14 socias. Las socias son D. la Asoc. Villa Militar que se ubica a 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, abarrotes, golosinas, cosméticos, ropas, bebidas. Sus ventas lo realizan en su barrio y también en la ciudad D. Ayacucho D. manera ambulatoria.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 6,900 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche, fideo, trigo, cebada, quinua, haba, galletas, caramelos y gaseosas

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Their loan will be invested into the purchase of sugar, rice, oil, milk, noodles, wheat, quinoa, beans, cookies, candies and sodas.

loans.name: Kusi Killa Group

texts.es:
The communal bank “Kusi KilL.”, which means “Happy Moon” in the Incan dialect of quechua, is a newly-started institution with 20 members.

The members undertake varied types of businesses such as the sale of ice creams, wood, cheeses, food items, fruits, sweets and groceries. Their sales activities are conducted in the different markets in the city of Ayacucho as well as on foot.

The members need different loan amounts, some need 300 Peruvian soles, some need 450 soles, some need 600 soles, etc., making the total loan for the group 7,650 soles from the bank.

They will invest their loans into the purchase of cookies, sodas, cheeses, rice, sugar, vegetables, meats, various fruits, wood, fish, lemons and crafts.

Their dreams incluD. helping their children become professionals, to have prosperous businesses and homes, and also to grow their enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal “Kusi KilL.” que significa “Luna Alegre” en quechua, es un Banco que recién inicia con 20 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. helados, leña, mercería, quesos, comidas, frutas, comida, golosinas, artesanías y abarrotes. Sus ventas lo realizan en los diferentes mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho y ambulantemente.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 7,650 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra galletas, gaseosas, quesos, arroz, azúcar, verduras, carne, frutas variadas, leña, pescado, limón y artesanías.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener negocios prósperos, una casa y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: They will invest their funds into the purchase of cookies, sodas, cheeses, rice, sugar, vegetables, meat, varied fruits, wood, fish, lemon and crafts.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a noble, hard working woman dedicated to growing flowers that are then transferred to Tarma, “the city of flowers”. It’s for this reason we find her cutting flowers that will be moved to the city to be offered for sale at excellent prices, given the large quantity of tourists who visit the area to admire the beauty of the countryside. Given that agriculture is her primary source of income, she wants to improve her production and try to start also planting vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

DELIA, es una noble mujer trabajadora dedicada a la producción de flores que son trasladados a la ciudad de las flores ( TARMA). Es por ello que la encontramos cortando las flores que serán trasladadas a la ciudad para ofertarlas a un excelente precio dada la acogida de las mismas por la inmensa cantidad de turistas que llegan para apreciar la belleza de los campos. Debido a que la agricultura es su principal fuente de ingresos desea mejorar su producción y probar con la siembra de vegetales.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her products and purchase seeds to also plant vegetables.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Don Guillermo is an honest worker who has installed a small corral so his animals can live adequately as he used to keep them in the kitchen where they interrupted the activities within the home. As it is his wish to be able to make selections and take care of them properly, he built a small environment where they can live and procreate adequately so he can later separate them and maintain the breed of his guinea pigs. Now he is thinking of building a proper environment next to his home with wider divisions allowing the animals to mate and increase their number without obstacles.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

DON GUILLERMO, es un noble trabajador que instaló en su casa en pequeño corral para que sus animalitos puedan vivir adecuadamente porque anteriormente los tenía en su cocina e interrumpían de cierta forma las actividades dentro de su hogar. Es por ello que con el anhelo de que pueda seleccionarlos y cuidarlos construyó para ellos un pequeño ambiente donde puedan vivir y procrearse adecuadamente para luego separarlos y mantener la raza de sus cuyes. Ahora tiene pensado construir un ambiente más adecuado a lado de su domicilio para ampliar sus separadores para que así puedan aparearse y aumentar sin ninguna dificultad su número.

loans.use: Build divisions to increase breeding of guinea pigs.

loans.name: Guisella

texts.es:
Guissela is a very determined lady at work and very careful at home, especially looking after her young children who are her daily inspiration. She is a merchant and together with her partner it is her wish to improve their sales. But at the present she has a great necessity to increase sales and above all produce a larger quantity of farm products on their land and therefore she requires seeds to improve the quality of their crop.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

GUISSELA, es una dama muy empeñosa en su trabajo y muy cuidadosa en su hogar sobre todo en el cuidado de sus pequeños hijos quienes son su impulso de día a día. Ella es comerciante y junto a su pareja trabajan con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas. Pero en estos momentos tiene una gran necesidad de aumentar sus ventas y sobre todo de producir mayor cantidad de productos agrícolas en sus terrenos de cultivo y para ello requiere de semillas que aumenten la calidad de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase improved seeds to increase quality and quantity of farm products.

loans.name: Madame Maimouna

texts.fr:
Mrs. Maimouna D. is a 29-year-old married woman who lost the use of a foot when she was younger. In order to provide for herself, she quickly learned to run a business, and now has 10 years' experience. She began five years ago with a solidarity loan through a women’s association, before requesting an individual loan. All her loans were repaid successfully. In addition to selling wood (her main activity), she also sells condiments, fabric and soap. She sells these items at Sikasso’s Médine neighbourhood market and in the villages surrounding Sikasso. She runs her business all year round without any major difficulties, compensating for the weaknesses of one business with the success of the others. She makes an average monthly profit of CFA 30,000. With this profit, she meets most of her expenses and helps her husband meet the expenses of the family (health, education, food, clothing, etc.). She has also bought a moped for getting around during the course of business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Maimouna D. est une femme mariée de 29 ans ayant perdu l’usage d’un pied dès sa jeunesse. Pour subvenir à ses besoins elle a vite appris à faire le commerce dont elle a une expérience de 10 ans. Elle a commencé il y a 5 ans par le prêt solidaire dans une association des femmes avant de demander le prêt individuel. Tous ses prêts ont été correctement remboursés. En plus de la vente de bois (son activité principale), elle vend aussi des condiments alimentaires, des tissus et du savon. Elle vend ses articles au marché du quartier Médine de Sikasso) et dans les villages environnants de Sikasso. Elle mène son activité durant toute l’année sans difficultés majeures en compensant les faiblesses d’une activité par les réussites des autres. Elle réalise en moyenne un bénéfice de 30.000 FCFA par mois. Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle assure l’essentiel de ses dépenses et aide son mari à assurer les dépenses de la famille (Santé, Education, Nourritures, Habillement, etc.). En plus, elle a acheté une mobylette pour ses déplacements dans le cadre de son activité.

loans.use: To buy wood supplies, cases of condiments, fabric and soap.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
Thanks to the support from his beloved family William has been able to fulfill his dream of owning a house where his children can grow in a healthy way with no limitations, and thanks to his work as a farmer he can cover their needs for their development. William’s land is necessary for the support of his economy and his animals represent an extra income as he obtains earnings daily from selling milk and cheese, activity carried out by his wife. Due to the loss caused by climate factors he has not been able to capitalize and for that reason he requests a loan in order to improve the sowing and production for this season.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

William, gracias al apoyo de sus seres queridos ha podido consolidar su sueño de tener una casa propia donde sus hijos puedan crecer sanos y sin limitaciones y gracias a su labor de agricultor puede ofrecerles lo necesario para su desarrollo. Los terrenos de William son indispensables para el mantenimiento de su economía y como una ayuda son sus animales con los cuales puede obtener ingresos diarios gracias a la venta de leche y queso que realiza su esposa. Debido a las pérdidas que tuvo por factores climatológicos no ha podido capitalizar su inversión y por esa razón solicita un préstamo a fin de mejorar su siembra y producción esta temporada.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer to increase production.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika works hard on her farm, and her work is increasing due to the absence of her partner, who works in remote areas and gets together with the family every month. Coping with the daily demands of her children is very difficult for Erika, despite having the support of her husband, and she needs help in providing an education for them. This really gets her down, but until now she has without doubt been a very good mother to her children. And thanks to her hard agricultural work, she is able to meet the daily needs of her little ones. Erika needs a loan so that she can buy the various tools necessary for her work, as well as the products she needs to take care of her plots of land, which will help her to cultivate products which are both profitable and of high quality.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Erika, trabaja duramente en la chacra y su esfuerzo se acrecienta debido a la ausencia de su pareja quien trabaja en zonas alejadas y mensualmente se reúne con su familia.Para Erika es muy difícil tener que lidiar diariamente con las necesidades de sus hijos y a pesar de tener el gran apoyo de su esposo requiere de ayuda para educar a sus hijos, este motivo la deprime mucho pero sin duda hasta hoy ha sabido ser una buena madre para sus hijos y gracias a sus labores de agricultora y ganadera satisface las necesidades diarias de sus pequeños.Requiere un préstamo para la compra de diversas herramientas necesarias para su trabajo y diversas productos para el cuidado de sus parcelas agrícolas que le ayude a cosechar productos rentables y de buena calidad.

loans.use: To buy tools and fertilizer.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
Bacilia earns a living by sowing vegetables in the fields, which she inherited from her very loving parents. Her children and husband are also very engaged in this, working endless hours every day looking after the vegetables with the objective of getting the expected yields at harvest time. The wish of this selfless mother is to optimize the cultivation time, and to buy natural fertilizer for the final stages of cultivation.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Bacilia, gracias al apoyo de sus padres se dedica a sembrar vegetales en los campos de cultivo que ellos con mucho cariño le heredaron. Sus hijos y esposo también están muy vinculados con esta labor y a diario dedican interminables horas de trabajo y de cuidados a sus vegetales con el objetivo de obtener las ganancias que esperan durante la cosecha.El deseo de esta abnegada madre es optimizar el tiempo de cultivo y comprar abonos y fertilizantes naturales para los últimos días de cuidado.

loans.use: To buy tools and natural fertilizer.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Don Hilario is fully engaged in the production of onions and wheat, some of them as end products, others as processed products - it all depends on the demand. So he can receive better prices for his work, he has to travel to other parts of the country and this requires a sum of money which he doesn't have at the moment. This is his motive for his request, especially now that harvest time is approaching.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

DON HILARIO, esta plenamente dedicado a la producción de cebollas y trigo algunas veces comercializadas así y otras procesadas, todo dependiendo de la demanda. Para recibir una mejor cotización por su trabajo tiene que desplazarlo a otras partes de su país y su traslado requiere de importantes sumas de dinero con los que no cuenta hoy y ese es el motivo de su petición ya que el tiempo de cosecha se acerca.

loans.use: To transport his goods to the market.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is a mother who is very focussed on her ideals and concrete plans. Her work is her priority because if she didn't go out to sell, she wouldn't be able to provide food for the home, nor would she be able to meet the various needs of her children. This is what gives her the determination and extraordinary ability to sell, as well as the effort and motivation for her business of selling corn, better known as "choclos" which are very sought-after in this part of Peru for their extremely rich flavour. Lidia is one of the better sellers but what keeps her back is her limited product range. In order to sell more, she needs to grow more on her land and she also has to buy a larger quantity of products to resell. This is the reason why Lidia is asking for a loan, and she expects that it will help her to increase her business and, above all, give her the purchasing power to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

LIDIA, es una mujer muy centrada en sus ideales y sus planes a concretar es por ello que sus actividades son la prioridad porque si no sale a vender no podrá llevar los alimentos a su casa y mucho menos podrá satisfacer las diversas necesidades de sus hijos.Es así que su empeño y su capacidad de vender es extraordinaria con las fuerzas y ganas que le pone a su negocio de venta de maíz más conocido como choclos que son tan solicitados en esta parte del Perú por su riquísimo sabor.Lidia es una de las mejores vendedoras pero lo que no le ayuda es los productos escasos que tiene porque para vender más significa producir más en sus chacras y comprar mayor cantidad de productos y revenderlos. Es por ello que Lidia solicita un préstamo que le ayudará a crecer en sus negocios y sobre todo a tener capacidad adquisitiva para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

loans.use: To increase her product range.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Yaye Diabou

texts.fr:
Yaye Diabou Cissé is 39 years old, unmarried with 3 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Manguiline Santhiaba in Bignona in the Ziguinchor area for 7 years. She runs a business selling thioub (a type of dyed cloth). She buys her goods in Tambacounda and sells them in Bignona. With her income, she looks after her family and supports the education of her children. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Yaye Diabou Cissé ,39 ans, célibataire, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona dans la région de Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente de thioub (tissus teintés) .Elle va acheter à Tambacounda pour vendre à Bignona. Avec ses revenus elle entretien sa famille et assure la scolarité des enfants. Yaye est très dynamique. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell thioub (a type of dyed cloth)

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr:
Marie Jeanne C., aged 50, is married with five children to look after, and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona for seven years. She wants to strengthen her business, which consists of buying lemons, palm oil, dried fish and oysters in Kafountine and selling them on in Dakar with the help of her daughter. Her earnings allow her to help take care of her family. Marie Jeanne is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Marie Jeanne C., 50 ans, mariée 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona depuis 7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter du citron, de l’huile de palme, du poisson sec et des huitres à Kafountine et revendre à Dakar avec l’aide de sa fille. Ses revenus lui permettent d’aider à la prise en charge de sa famille. Marie Jeanne sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Food retail

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Amy Diémé, aged 64, is a widow with three children to look after, and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona for seven years. Her business consists of buying dried fish, lemons and palm oil in Kafountine and selling them on in Bignona. She replenishes her stock twice per cycle. She uses her earnings to take care of the family expenses and save for future investments. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Amy Diémé, 64 ans, veuve 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona depuis 7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter du poisson sec, du citron et de l’huile de palme à Kafountine et revendre à Bignona. Elle renouvelle son stock deux fois par cycle. Avec ses revenus elle assure les charges de sa famille et épargne pour faire des investissements dans l’avenir. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Food retail

loans.name: Julia

texts.fr:
Julia B., aged 67, is a widow with five children to look after, and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona for seven years. She would like a loan for a business selling palm oil and lemons which she buys in Kafountine and sells on in Dakar with the help of her daughter. Her earnings allow her to provide for the care of her grandchildren. Julia is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia B., 67 ans, veuve 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona depuis 7 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour faire le commerce de l’huile de palme et du citron qu’elle achète à Kafountine et revend à Dakar avec l’aide de sa fille. Ses revenus lui permettent d’assurer la prise en charge de ses petits fils . Julia sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Food retail

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr:
Louise B., aged 45, is married and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona – in Senegal’s Ziguinchor region - for seven years. She runs a business selling gold-plated jewelry. She gets the jewelry from France with the help of her sister. She uses her income to contribute to the family expenses and put towards finding a permanent stall. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Louise B., 45 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona dans la région de Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente de bijoux en plaqué or. Les bijoux lui viennent de la France avec l’aide de sa sœur. Avec ses revenus elle participe aux charges familiales et cherche le moyen de se trouver une cantine. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Jewelry business

loans.name: Felícita

texts.es:
Felicita is a sweet woman who earns a living by making cakes and pastries for her neighbors. Thanks to her great skills and creativity in making these delicious pastries, she receives many orders for every occasion. This business has helped her provide an education to her children, who are currently studying in the capital city and therefore need large sums of money. Felicita and her partner cover these expenses with her business and with the income he earns by selling books as a street vendor. Rosa must now increase her orders and speed up production. She therefore requires certain materials that will help boost sales. She would like to obtain those cake pans that will improve the appearance of her cakes, thereby causing customers to choose her baked goods at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Felicita es una dulce dama que se gana la vida haciendo pasteles o bocaditos que le piden sus vecinos y gracias a su gran habilidad y creatividad para elaborar estos riquísimos pastelitos recibe constantes pedidos para diversos compromisos.Esta actividad de igual manera le ha ayudado a educar a sus hijos quienes estudian en la capital y quienes por motivos de estudios requieren de grandes sumas de dinero y de inversión, gastos que son solventados con el trabajo de Felicita y su pareja quien se dedica a la venta de libros de manera ambulatoria.Siendo la educación de sus hijos la prioridad en su familia Rosa necesita incrementar sus pedidos y agilizar su trabajo, y requiere de ciertos materiales que ayude a mejorar sus ventas y adquirir estos moldes que le ayudarán a mejorar la presentación de sus pasteles y tener preferencia en el mercado.

loans.use: Purchase of bakeware to improve appearance of her cakes

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot sells salchipapas, Peruvian street food made of pan-fried sausages and french fries, for a living outside her shop, which is located on the central highway. She had a chance to obtain a small hot dog cart after much hard work and daily dedication to her store. Because her husband works as a driver, he was able to help her with a large sum of money so that she could purchase whatever she needed in order to start this profitable business. However, she is currently experiencing some financial difficulties due to the tuition fees she must pay for her 3 children, and the rent she must pay for both her house and her business space. For this reason, Margot is requesting a loan that will help her improve her services and boost sales. In so doing, she will increase her income and savings so that she can obtain her own space in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Margot, todas las noches se dedica a la venta de salchipapas fuera de su tienda ubicada en la carretera central.Ella tuvo la posibilidad de adquirir una pequeña sanguchera con el esfuerzo y dedicación de su desempeño diario en su tiendita y gracias al trabajo de transporte de su esposo quien la ayudó con un gran cantidad de dinero para adquirir lo necesario a fin de emprender este rentable negocio.Sin embargo está atravesando ciertos apuros económicos que le ocasionan los grandes gastos de educación de sus 3 hijos y las costosas sumas de dinero por el alquiler de su casa y el local donde trabaja.Por tal motivo Margot solicita un préstamo que le ayude a mejorar sus servicios y amentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos y ahorros para adquirir pronto un espacio propio.

loans.use: Improve fast food business

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Thanks to the support he received with the first loan, José was able to obtain his work vehicle, thus providing wellbeing for his beloved family. He would like to create a safe place in which his young children can grow up without any difficulties. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can repair his work vehicle because he has decided to increase his income. He hopes that after much hard work, he will be able to obtain a space on which to build his home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

José, gracias al apoyo de un primer préstamo ha podido adquirir su herramienta de trabajo para otorgarle bienestar a su querida familia, tiene deseos de establecerse en un lugar seguro para que sus pequeños dos hijos se desarrollen sin inconvenientes. Por esa razón solicita un préstamo para reparar su herramienta de trabajo ya que ha decidido mejorar sus ingresos con esfuerzo y adquirir un espacio para construir su hogar.

loans.use: Repair work vehicle

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar has always grown vegetables in order to maintain his household. Nevertheless, he has been experiencing low profits because he has few crops, so he has decided to sell his products without any middlemen, thus ensuring that he will earn a fair amount of proceeds. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that he will used to obtain a vehicle for transporting his vegetables from the countryside to the city.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

EDGAR, se ha dedicado desde siempre a la siembra y cosecha de vegetales para el sostenimiento de su hogar, sin embargo observando los bajos ingresos que obtiene por la venta ya que la oferta es poca, ha decidido iniciar la comercialización de sus productos sin intermediarios, así está seguro que obtendrá el dinero justo por sus productos. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo ya que planea adquirir un vehículo para el transporte de sus vegetales del campo a la ciudad.

loans.use: Purchase of vehicle to transport vegetables

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma has gradually been overcoming the vast emptiness that was left with the loss of her beloved son due to a terrible illness. Now with more strength than ever, she is dedicated to raising small animals from home. Thanks to the love and care with which she provides them, the animals have multiplied considerable. She would like to invest in her business because it gives her the sustenance she needs to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

NORMA, se viene reponiendo poco a poco del gran vacío que le dejó la pérdida D. su amado hijo a causa D. una terrible enfermedad, y ahora con más fuerza que antes se dedica a criar a sus pequeños animalitos en casa, éstos gracias al inmenso amor y cuidados que les otorga se han multiplicado considerablemente y desea seguir invirtiendo en esta ocupación debido a que le otorga el sustento necesario para vivir.

loans.use: Purchase of food for small animals

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is a craftswoman whose family is in the same business because they have always welcomed the tourists who visit the central rain forest zone. These visitors generate great profits for the locals during the tourist season in the locality of La Merced. In order for Paulina to be able to meet the demands of the tourists, she needs certain supplies so that she can make her handicrafts. Hence, she is requesting a loan that will help her purchase the supplies she needs for her original and lovely, handmade ornaments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina es artesana y su familia se dedica a esta labor ya que siempre ha tenido acogida por los turistas que visitan la zona de la selva central lo cual trae grandes ganancias acorde a las temporadas de visita en la localidad de La Merced.Para poder Paulina cubrir los requerimientos y la exigencia de los turistas requiere de ciertos materiales que le faltan para procesar sus artesanías y solicita un préstamo que le ayudaría a comprar materia prima para sus novedosos y hermosos adornos artesanales.

loans.use: Purchase greater quantity of supplies needed to make her beautiful ornaments

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is the epitome of strength and constant effort. She grows gladioli for a living because she enjoys cultivating flowers and because this business provides her with reasonable profits. She would like to improve and expand her field so that she can sell a greater amount of these flowers. She has seen a demand for these plants for a long time, but she has not been able to meet those demands because she lacks the funds to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA, es un ejemplo de fuerza y esfuerzo constante. Se dedica a sembrar gladiolos porque le gusta agrada mucho el cultivo de flores y porque le otorga módicos réditos. Desea seguir mejorando y ampliar su campo de trabajo ya que comercializa en mayor cantidad sus vegetales y ha observado la demanda de estás plantas por mucho tiempo y debido a su falta de capital no ha podido iniciar su proyecto.

loans.use: Expand gladioli field

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria launched her business because her husband really likes hojarascas (a traditional Mexican sweet) and baked cookies. Since she had never made them at home, she decided to learn how. She grew to enjoy it, and offered the homemade sweets to her acquaintances, who told her that it would be a good idea to sell them. She listened to them, and that's how her business came to be.

She felt the need to open the business because of her family's low income. They were spending more now that their son was older, and so she opened a bakery - a business that she enjoyed - which enabled her to earn extra money to cover her family's needs.

Luz Maria began her business seven years ago, and has never regretted that decision. She has brought in good earnings, which have allowed her to pay for severla unforseen expenses. She has a very good clientele, and even distributes her sweets to big businesses like Helados Sultana, an ice cream company. This creates a steady stream of income to cover household expenses.

Today, Luz Maria needs a loan of $600, which she will repay in 6 months. She will use the money to buy ingredients to make her sweets so that she can fill her existing long list of orders.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Luz Maria inició el negocio porque a su esposo le gustan mucho las hojarascas y galletas horneadas y como en su casa ya no le hacian, se propuso aprender a hacerlas y poco a poco le comenzo a gustar mas, entonces las ofrecio a conocidos quienes le comentaron que, seria buen negocio el venderlas y les hizo caso, asi fue como inicio el negocio que ahora tiene.

Su principal necesidad para emprender su negocio, fue la poca entrada de dinero, ya que tenian mas gastos ahora que su hijo estaba creciendo por lo que tomo la reposteria como un negocio que ademas le gustaba, y le iba a dejar dinero extra para cubrir sus necesidades.

Comenzó hace 7 años con el negocio y no piensa dejarlo porque desde aquel entonces, le ha dejado buenas ganancias para salir de algunos imprevistos, tiene muy buena clientela e inclusive tiene reparto a negocios grandes como Helados Sultana donde coloco sus productos y este tambien es un ingreso seguro para los gastos de su casa.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses, le va a servir para comprar materia prima para hacer su productos ya que actualmente tiene muchos pedidos

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make cookies

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda launched her business after her divorce, when she took the initiative to take on a short course of study and get a job to pay for her family's living expenses in order to give her two children a better life. This is what led Esmeralda to go to beauty school and open her own business. Eleven years ago, she began giving haircuts and doing dye jobs. As her clientele has grown, she has been able to begin offering additional services.

Today, Esmeralda needs a $250 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy a wider range of dye colors so that she can earn more money. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Esmeralda inició el negocio a raiz del divorcio, tomo la iniciativa de estudiar una carrera corta y conseguir un empleo para solventar los gastos familiares y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos, fue asi que se decidio a estudiar belleza, y depsues emprendio su negocio. Comenzó hace once años empezo haceindo solo cortes de cabello y aplicaciones de tintes; poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes y esto le permitio ir brindando mayores servicios.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para tener una gama mas amplia de tintes y obtener mas ganancias para la estetica. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase more colors of hair dye

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank of Villa Huatatas. Victoria is from the town of Huatatas which is located 20 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. It is a small valley where the people dedicate themselves to farming and raising cattle.

Victoria is widowed, is 47 years old and has 6 children. Victoria buys grains at the different towns and fairs in the region. She then processes the grains in a rented mill. She sells her products in the city of Pisco which is located 6 hours from the city of Ayacucho. She also makes dried potatoes and farms.

Victoria needs a loan of $375.00 which she will invest in the purchase of barley and potatoes.

Victoria’s dream is to purchase land to build her house and that her children will have secure jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas, Victoria es natural D. la comunidad D. Huatatas que se encuentra a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, es un valle pequeño donD. la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Victoria es viuda, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Victoria compra cereales D. los diferentes pueblos y ferias D. la región, posteriormente procesa los cereales en un molino alquilado, sus productos los venD. en la ciudad D. Pisco que queda a 6 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, también elabora papa seca. Además Victoria se dedica a la agricultura.

Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cebada y papa.

Los sueños D. Victoria son comprar un terreno para construir su casa, sus hijos tengan trabajos seguros.

loans.use: Purchase of barley and potatoes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura launched her business in order to help her two children get ahead in life. Since she is a single mother and gets no support from the father of her little ones, Laura must pay for her children's studies and living expenses. Ten years ago, Laura began selling tamales and atole (a traditional Mexican drink) in the offices and businesses down the street from her house, and bit by bit, she has gained regular customers and has earned enough income to support her family.

Today, Laura is requesting a loan of $250, which she will pay back in six months, to purchase a bigger steamer for making tamales and a bigger ice chest to transport the atole she sells. With your help, Laura will continue to prosper.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Laura inició el negocio para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos ya que es madre soltera y no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus pequeños. Ante la necesidad de tener un empleo para pagar los gastos de estudio de sus hijos y su manutención. Comenzó hace 10 años vendiendo tamales y atole en las oficinas y negocios por el rumbo de su casa, y asi poco a poco ha logrado hacerse de clientes y esto le ha generado ingresos suficientes para mantener a su familia.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una vaporera mas grande para hacer los tamales así como también una hielera más grande para transportar el atole que vende. Con tu apoyo Laura podrá seguir prosperando

loans.use: To buy a bigger tamale steamer and ice chest

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is a member of the communal bank Villa Huatatas. Paulina is from the town of Huatatas which is located twenty minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. It is a small valley where the people dedicate themselves to farming and raising cattle.

Paulina is widowed, is 46 years old and has 6 children. She buys potatoes and grains in the different fairs in the Ayacucho region and then sells them at the Nery Garcia market. She transports her products in rented cars. In addition, Paulina sells fruits as a traveling salesperson and also farms.

Paulina needs a loan of $450.00 which she will invest in the purchase of potatoes and quinoa.

Pualina’s dream is to get ahead, to get a car to transport her products and a home to give her children comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas, Paulina es natural D. la comunidad D. Huatatas que se encuentra a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, es un valle pequeño donD. la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Paulina es viuda, tiene 46 años y 6 hijos, Paulina compra papa y cereales en las diferentes ferias D. la región D. Ayacucho y luego lo venD. por mayor en el mercado Nery García, sus productos son transportados en carros alquilados. Además Paulina venD. frutas D. manera ambulatoria. También Paulina se dedica a la agricultura.

Paulina necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa y quinua.

Los sueños D. Paulina son progresar, tener un carro para transportar sus productos y casa para dar comodidad a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes and quinoa.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria began selling tostadas because making and selling tostadas has been a family tradition for more than 30 years. Her in-laws launched the business and have run it for more than 5 years. Maria began working there in order to support her family while working in a family business.

Today, Maria is asking for a loan of $250, which she will pay back in 6 months, to buy ingredients to make tostadas. With your help, Maria will get ahead.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Maria inició el negocio por ser un negocio familiar y seguir con la tradicion de mas de 30 años en la elaboracion y venta de tostadas,comenzaron el negocio sus suegros y desde hace 5 años es atendido por ellos. Esto lo incio con la finalidad de mantener a su familia y tener un trabajo en un negocio familiar.

Ahora solicita un prestamo poor US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de materia prima para elaborar las tostadas. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante .

loans.use: Purchase tostada ingredients

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina launched her business after her father-in-law became afflicted with a prostate ailment and needed money to pay for the treatment. She saw that natural remedies improved his health, and so she began to distribute these products.

That was February of 2001. Josefina became a distributor, hanging posters announcing not only that she was selling these products, but that she had witnessed their effectiveness. Today, she runs a support center out of her house, where she trains and prepares people interested in using the remedies and shows video testimonials of patients whose health has been improved by her remedies. She also travels to rural communties to promote her products.

Josefina needs a $400 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, to acquire more products. She will sell them in nearby municipalities, where her sales are highest. With your help, Josefina can continue to expand her business.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Josefina inició el negocio debido a la enfermedad de su suegro, ya que se enfermó de la próstata y necesitaban dinero para su tratamiento, fue así como se convertieron en distribuidores de estos productos naturistas.al constatar que su suegro comenzó a tomar dichos productos y tuvo mejoría en su salud.

Comenzó febrero de 2001, como distribuidora colocando posters donde anunciaba que además de ser distribuidores eran testigos de los beneficios de dichos productos. En la actualidad ya tiene un centro de apoyo en su casa donde capacita y preparo a la gente que se a iniciar y en donde organiza juntas con sus promotores y les muestra videos de testimonios de la gente que ha mejorado su salud; también recorre comunidades rurales en donde promociona los productos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para adquirir mas productos y venderlos en municipios cercanos, ya que le han funcionado mejor las ventas en esos lugares. Con tu ayuda Josefina seguira haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy natural remedies

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma is a very cheerful and hard-working young woman, who learned to sell at the markets together with her parents when she was just a girl. She now has her own business, selling agricultural produce and she is doing very well. One of her desires is to be the best trader in the area and until now she is more or less achieving that and her neighbors give testimony to the hard work she puts into her work. However, Enma told us of her weaknesses and limitations which her business has, and they are related to economic factors. She is therefore looking for people just like you who can help her in her business. By responding to her request, she will be able to buy a larger quantity of products for resale to the largest stores. She would also invest, above all, in the cultivation of potatoes on her parents' land.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.
