Su solicitud de crédito es para cambiar la herramienta de trabajo (el automóvil), la que cuenta actualmente se encuentra en mal estado y no le permite trabajar continuamente. Este es su cuarto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica favorablemente la solicitud de este cliente.

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima produces and sells cow’s milk, distributed through the company Delicia (an ice-cream factory). Maxima and her husband work as small garden agriculturalists, selling their products in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. Milk and vegetables are their principle sources of income, by which they maintain their three children. The couple lives in the community of Palomar (two and a half hours from La Paz).

Maxima requests a loan in order to purchase a cow of average quality. In this way she will increase her milk production and have a better income. This is Maxima’s first loan through Kiva’s field partner Impro. An evaluation showed that she qualifies for the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Maxima es productora de leche de vaca, su producto es comercializado a la empresa Delicia (fábrica de helados). Máxima y su esposo trabajan como pequeños agricultores de hortalizas, las cuales son vendidas en la ciudad de La Paz, estas son sus principales fuentes de ingresos con las que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos. El matrimonio vive en la comunidad de Palomar (a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz). Máxima solicita crédito para comprar una vaca de mediana calidad, de esa manera incrementará su producción de leche y tendrá mayores ingresos económicos. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada nos permite aprobar su solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milking

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Mr. Walter J. M., his wife (Elsa Medrano) and his daughter own their own home, located in the Tacagua zone of La Paz, Bolivia. Walter works as a salaried chofer for the city public transportation authority, and his wife is a cook employed in a pensión (a moderately priced restaurant) in the city.

The family’s home contains two rooms that have yet to be finished (they have only constructed the walls, floors, and ceiling). The credit that the family needs will be used to finish these two rooms.

This is the first time that Walter has requested a loan and he qualified favorably after a socioeconomic analysis (credit check), therefore Walter qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Walter J. M., su esposa (Elsa Medrano) y su hija tienen domicilio propio, este se encuentra en la zona de Tacagua (ciudad de La Paz). Walter trabaja como chofer asalariado en el transporte publico de la ciudad y su esposa es cocinera empleada en una pensión (restaurante de precios módicos) en la ciudad. La vivienda de la familia posee dos habitaciones que aún no están concluidas (solo se construyeron los muros pisos y techo). El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de las dos habitaciones. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente, por lo que Walter puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: To finish the construction of two rooms in the family home

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 46 years old and originally from Matutuine district in the Maputo Province. Benjamin is married and the father of five children: the oldest with 24 years old and the youngest with 5 years old. Besides his children, Benjamin also supports two nephews from a deceased brother.

Benjamin studied until 3rd grade and stopped due to his family’s difficult financial situation. At the age of 15 years he started fishing with his father, but soon stopped to join the obligatory military service. In 1988 Benjamin was involved in an ambush and lost both legs. Benjamin decided to move to Maputo rather than returning to Matutuine due to the civil war that was intense in the countryside. Benjamin started to repair shoes and only in 1998 started to receive a pension from the government.

In 2004 Benjamin decided to go back to Bela Vista in Matutuine with plans to work in an agricultural field, but the lack of rain didn’t allow him to proceed with his plans. He then went back to repairing shoes and also started to sell used clothes, blankets and duvets in a small stand. Benjamin’s wife goes to South Africa to sell pans and buys the blankets and duvets that are then sold in Mozambique. During wintertime the sale of blankets and duvets intensifies. Benjamin’s wife buys them for MTn 350 and he sells them for MTn 800 each.

Benjamim is an old client of Hluvuku. His last loan was used to buy some consumer goods such as a fridge and a radio and his second to last loan was used to pay his son’s medical expenses, as he stayed three months in the hospital with cancer.

In the future Benjamin would like to go back to fishing. He dreams about buying a boat and once again making a living out of the business.

loans.use: To buy used clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 64 years old and originally from the Salamanca District in the Maputo Province. Helena is married and has six children, three daughters and three sons, all above 18 years old.

Helena studied until 3rd grade and stopped to help with her parents’ house duties, as she was the older daughter. As soon as Helena married she started to sell alcoholic drinks made of sugar cane. With the profits from this business she was able to buy cattle, achieving a herd of 50 cows. During the Mozambican Civil War Helena lost all her cattle and was forced to move out of her house.

In 1986 Helena moved to Salamanca village, where she built a small house with a grocery store in front. Ever since Helena has been selling basic needs products. Helena’s most famous products are sugar, cooking oil and peanuts. She has a daily sale of MTn 750 and has one employee to help her during the day. Helena pays him MTn 500 per month.

Helena has been a client of Hluvuku since 1996. Her first loan was a group loan of MTn 600 to help her with her commerce business. Helena has had more than 10 loans, some to help buy consumer goods and some to help build her house. With this loan of MTn 7,000 Helena intends to buy more merchandise in bulk, reducing the acquisition cost and increasing her profits.

In the future, Helena would like to repair her house and would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and buy in bulk.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Mrs. Gladys L. C., her husband (Rogelio Conde) and her three children live in her parent's house in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz, Bolivia. Gladys works as a maid in a private residence, and her husband works in a mine located in the Paceño district.

Gladys’s parents gave the married couple a portion of their property in order to build a home. Gladys and her husband have already constructed two rooms with previous loans. Gladys is asking for a new loan in order to build an additional room made of brick. This is the sixth time that Gladys has requested a loan, and she has received high ratings in socio-economic analyses.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladys L. C., su esposo (Rogelio Conde) y sus tres hijos viven en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. Gladys es empleada domestica en un domicilio particular y su esposo trabaja en una mina que se encuentra en departamento paceño. Los padres de Gladys otorgaron al matrimonio parte de la propiedad para que construyeran su vivienda, misma que cuenta con dos habitaciones construidas con anteriores créditos. Con el préstamo actual, Gladys planea construir una habitación nueva de ladrillo. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo, la clienta califica favorablemente en el análisis socioeconómico realizado.

loans.use: To build a new room in the family home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of materials for a small cafeteria.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock a small grocery and move it forward.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: José Ariel

texts.es:
Mr. José Ariel L. has worked very hard since he was a young man raising cattle. He has developed his skills in raising livestock such as calves, cows, heifers, and pigs.

He is the father of three children and since he started his business, he has been through difficult situations such as the lack of financial resources for the acquisition of animals. Nonetheless, despite these difficult situations he has survived thanks to his hard work and the support that Ceprodel has provided him through business loans. Today he is requesting a loan with the purpose of obtaining enough money to purchase calves. It is important to point out that this credit will bring him greater opportunities to improve his financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero José Ariel L. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo desde muy joven al negocio de la ganadería el cual ha desarrollado habilidades en la crianza de ganado como terneros, vacas, vaquillas y cerdos.

Es padre de tres hijos y desde que inició en este negocio ha atravesado múltiples situaciones adversas como la ausencia del recurso económico para la adquisición de los animales. Sin embargo a pesar de sus difíciles situaciones ha sobrevivido gracias a sus esfuerzos y al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel por medio de los créditos para el negocio. Hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito con el propósito de adquirir el dinero para la compra de los terneros. Es menester destacar que gracias a este crédito logrará mayor oportunidad para mejorar su condición económica.

loans.use: Purchase calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Carlos Guillermo

texts.es:
Carlos Guillermo O., as the father and the person responsible for his nuclear family, has set a goal to give his children and wife better living conditions through the reconstruction of his humble home. Through the years that they have lived there, the home has been deteriorating and conditions continually worsening for its inhabitants.

For this reason Mr. Carlos initiated part of the reconstruction of his home by investing financial resources in order to fulfill his dream of having better living conditions. Nonetheless, after beginning the work he needed to stop for financial reasons, and because of this he is requesting a loan from Ceprodel. He will purchase construction materials and continue the reconstruction of his home with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos Guillermo O. como padre de familia y responsable de su núcleo familiar, se ha propuesto la meta de brindarle a sus hijos y esposa mejores condiciones de vida por medio de la reconstrucción de su humilde casa de habitación ya que ha medida que han transcurrido los años esta se ha venido deteriorando y brindando malas condiciones para habitar en ella.

Por este motivo es que el señor Carlos al haber iniciado parte de la reconstrucción de su casa ha invertido recursos económicos para llevar a cabo su sueño de tener mejores condiciones de vida. Sin embargo, al haber iniciado esta labor decidió detener la obra por el factor económico, por esta única razón busca un financiamiento en Ceprodel con el único fin de comprar los materiales de construcción para continuar con la obra de reconstrucción de su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Filogenio

texts.es:
The business activity from which Mr. Rios makes a living is the breeding of livestock from his home in the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. He started this business 25 years ago with a small number of livestock, but as his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale and gain from their derivatives.

According to Mr. Rios, he works very hard so that he can maintain his three children and two grandchildren that are in his care. For that reason, he is looking for a way to facilitate their studies, and because there is no electric power in his neighborhood, he has requested the installation of a solar panel to obtain illumination so that his children and grandchildren study in the evenings without using an oil lamp, and so they have access to electricity to carry out household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica el señor R. es a la crianza de ganado en su sector de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Inicio este negocio desde hace 25 años con poco ganado pero a medida que ha venido desarrollándose ha adquirido mayores cantidades de ganado para su respectiva comercialización y aprovechamiento de sus derivados.

Según el señor R., trabaja muy fuerte para mantener a sus tres hijos y dos nietos a su cargo. Para ello busca la manera de cómo facilitarle los estudios y al no contar con energía eléctrica en su sector, ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para obtener la iluminación para que sus hijos y nietos estudien por las noches sin necesidad de candiles y a la vez para tener acceso a energía eléctrica para realizar las actividades del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase calves for his livestock breeding business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Glendy Jessenia

texts.es:
In the municipality of Villanueva of the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Glendy P. is working very hard to accomplish her dream of reconstructing her house of residence, which has been deteriorating over the years due to the natural phenomena that had befallen it.

With the responsibility of maintaining her small son, this lady together with her husband is looking for ways to improve their living conditions. For this reason, Mrs. P. is seeking the support of Ceprodel in obtaining a loan that will give her the means to get the construction materials needed to continue the work they have started, work that they had to pause due to financial difficulties. However, currently realizing the need to continue the work, she hopes that her loan will be granted without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Glendy P. se esfuerza grandemente para llevar a cabo su sueño de reconstruir su casa de habitación el cual a través de los años se ha venido deteriorando debido a los fenómenos naturales que le han azotado.

Con la obligación de mantener a su pequeño hijo, esta dama en conjunto con su esposo se dedica buscan la manera de como mejorar sus condiciones de vida y para ello, la señora P. busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le de la oportunidad de adquirir sus materiales de construcción para continuar con esta obra ya que al haberla iniciado en parte, se vio en la obligación de no continuar por la falta del recurso económico. Sin embargo hoy en día al darse cuenta de la necesidad de continuar espera en que su crédito será otorgado sin ningún problema.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Helyn Martinez

texts.es:
Helyn Martínez is a hard-working and dedicated woman who raises cattle and has her own calves, which feed her community in Villanueva de Chinandega.

According to Helyn, she began her business with a minimal number of animals (calves) but little bit little as time has passed she has been able to acquire greater quantities of calves. She raises the calves and then sells them, which is the cycle of her business. Today she is requesting support in the form of a loan from Ceprodel. With the loan, she will be able to purchase more calves which will allow her to continue her business and thus maintain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Helyn Martínez es una dama que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación se dedica a la labor de la ganadería contando con terneros propios los cuales alimenta en su comunidad en Villanueva de Chinandega.

Según comenta su negocio lo inició teniendo las mínimas cantidades de animales (terneros) pero a medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo ha logrado adquirir mayores cantidades de terneros los cuales los cría, y comercializa siendo este su ciclo de negocio. Hoy en día busca apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada por medio de los créditos otorgados por Ceprodel. Por medio de ellos logrará la adquisición de los terneros el cual le urgen para continuar con su negocio y por ende con el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Ms. María Luisa A. began her cattle-raising business over 5 years ago. She went into the business because she realized that her husband’s income wasn’t enough to maintain her home and family. For this reason she has worked very hard raising cattle, which has allowed her to gain a lot of experience in raising animals.

With the responsibility of improving her family’s living conditions, Mrs. María Luisa turns to Ceprodel in order to get a loan that would make it possible to purchase the calves to grow her business. It’s necessary to point out that through this acquisition of the calves, this woman will be able to obtain milk that she can sell. What is more, she will be able to increase her sales and improve her business, while at the same time improving her home that needs repairs in order to give her family a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Maria Luisa A. desde hace mas de cinco años se dedica al negocio de la ganadería incursionando en esta área debido a que los ingresos que percibía su cónyuge no eran suficientes para el mantenimiento de su hogar. Por este motivo es que con mucho esfuerzo ella se ha dedicado al negocio de la ganadería el cual ha adquirido basta experiencia en la crianza de los animales.

Con la responsabilidad de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, la señora Maria Luisa acude a Ceprodel para obtener un préstamo que le haga posible la compra de los terneros para incrementar su negocio. Es necesario destacar que por medio de la adquisición de estos terneros esta dama logrará extraer la leche para su respectiva venta y además lograra incrementar sus niveles de venta y mejoramiento en su negocio y a la vez logrará mejorar su vivienda que necesita de infraestructura para dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Martires

texts.es:
Martires C. is a native of the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. His principal economic activity is in the livestock and agricultural sector. He is the father of two children, and his duty is to offer them the education they deserve being that they are still minors.

Today, Martires has a cattle ranch in his home where he houses his animals for their development. To improve the condition of his business, he has begun the remodeling of this area with the goal of having his livestock develop with no problems. To do this, he has turned to Ceprodel for support in obtaining a loan that will enable him to purchase barbed wire to enclose his ranch and have better conditions for his livestock. This loan will benefit him as much as his family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Martires C. es originario del municipio de Villanueva en la ciudad de Chinandega. Su actividad económica es el sector agropecuario. Es padre de dos hijos cuyo deber es brindarle los estudios que estos se merecen por ser menores de edad.

Hoy en día el señor Martires C. posee un potrero en su casa de habitación donde aloja a sus animales para su desarrollo. Para mejorar las condiciones de su actividad ha iniciado a remodelar esta área con el propósito de que sus animales alcancen sin ningún problema. Para ello ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de alambre para rodear la cerca y tener mejores condicione para su ganado. Con este crédito es beneficiado tanto él como su familia.

loans.use: Purchase barbed wire to place around his cattle ranch.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina inició el negocio debido a la enfermedad de su suegro, ya que se enfermó de la próstata y necesitaban dinero para su tratamiento, fue así como se convertieron en distribuidores de estos productos naturistas.al constatar que su suegro comenzó a tomar dichos productos y tuvo mejoría en su salud. Comenzó febrero de 2001, como distribuidora colocando posters donde anunciaba que además de ser distribuidores eran testigos de los beneficios de dichos productos. En la actualidad ya tiene un centro de apoyo en su casa donde capacita y preparo a la gente que se a iniciar y en donde organiza juntas con sus promotores y les muestra videos de testimonios de la gente que ha mejorado su salud; también recorre comunidades rurales en donde promociona los productos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para adquirir mas productos y venderlos en municipios cercanos, ya que le han funcionado mejor las ventas en esos lugares. Con tu ayuddda Josefina seguira haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Adquirir mercancia

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalinda started her business out of necessity. She needed the extra income in order to help her husband with the household expenses and to have her own money to provide a good education for her children.

She got started in March of 2000, when she bought a sawing machine with some money she had saved up. Rosalinda then made a butterfly costume for her daughter, to wear at school, and her neighbors liked it very much. They started to order pieces from her and nowadays she has a good number of clients and is doing very well.

She is now requesting a loan for $300, which she plans to pay in 3 months. She will use it to purchase sawing materials in order to fulfill her client's orders and to continue delivering her pieces on time. Which in turn, can generate more clients and income. With you help Rosalinda can expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalinda inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y ademas tener su propio dinero para darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Comenzó en Marzo del año 2000, compro una máquina de coser con un dinero que tenía guardado y le hizo a su hija un disfraz de mariposa para la escuela el cual le gustó mucho a sus vecinas quienes le empezaron a hacer encargos de costura y a la fecha tiene un buen numero de clientas y le va muy bien.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $ 300 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material que le permita cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientas y seguir siendo puntual en las entregas, lo cual le puede generar mas clientes e ingresos. Con tu ayuda Rosalinda hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase sawing materials

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa started her business in order to help her husband with the household expenses, especially since her mother lives with them and she is an elderly woman that requires special care and medications.

After getting married, she wanted to have her own source of income to help her husband with the household expenses as well as being able to help her mother who depends on Teresa, since she is the only woman of the house and her brothers live outside the city. They also want to provide a good education for their son.

She got started in February 2006, after a neighbor told her that the sale of used clothing was a good business. She put the clothing on a small table right outside her home and also on the gate of her home. She purchased the clothes from the neighbor, who receives large shipments of clothes she buys in bulk in border towns near the United States.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300, which she will pay in 3 months. She will use it to purchase more seasonal clothes since during this time of the year more people buy summer clothing such as shorts, bermuda sorts, capri pants, blouses, skirts, etc. In this manner she will be able to offer more variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que vive con ellos su mamá que es una persona my avanzada de edad que necesita de cuidados especiales y medicinas.

Después de que se caso quería tener una ingreso propio para ayudar a suesposo con los gastos de la casa y ayudar también a su mamá ya que ella depende de Tere, pues es la única mujer de la casa y sus hermanos viven fuera de la ciudad, además de que quieren darle una buena educación a su hijo. Comenzo en Febrero de 2006, cuando una vecina le comentó que la venta de ropa usada era un buen negocio,entonces afuera de su casa en la entrada puso una mesita en donde coloco ropa y también en el portón, ropa que la misma vecina le vendió ya que a ella le llegan grandes bultos que compra en ciudades fronterizas con los Estados Unidos.

Solicita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar más ropa de temporada, ya que en esta época del año la gente compra mucha ropa fresca como shorts, bermudas, pescadores, blusas, faldas, etc y de esta forma tendré un mejor surtido que ofrecer a mis clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk to sell in her community.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Phearum

texts.en:
Mr. Phearum C., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sokheng Heng, 29, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2003 and have two young sons. 

Mr. Phearum has been a fisherman since he was young. He fishes on the Mekong River and a lake behind his house, selling his catch around the village, while Mrs. Sokheng has been a silk weaver for three years.
 
Mr. Phearum is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-Oeun C., 59, and her second husband, Mr. Khun Khan, 60, who live on an Island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have no children. However, she has five children, two sons and three daughters, from her first marriage. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home, while the other three are in school.

Mrs. Sam-Oeun has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her neighbor, since she was 29 years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh; Mr. Khun is a fisherman and farmer. Mrs. Sam-Oeun is now requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun C., 73, and her husband, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married since she was 16 years old and have six children, three sons and three daughters. All of them are married and live outside the family home with the exception of their youngest daughter, who has full time employment in Phnom Penh, while Mrs. Yun’s son in-law sells mobile phones and motorcycle at his shop, also in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yun, formerly a silk weaver, has been selling silk products for many years. She buys the products from her village for resale in nearby provinces, and she also spins silk at home. Although of advanced years, she is still strong enough to work. Now she is requesting a loan of $1000 for her son-in-law to expand his business of selling cell phones and motorcycles.

loans.use: For her son-in-law to expand his business of selling cell phones and motorcycles.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeng M., 36, and her husband, Mr. Sim Sorn, 35, who live about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1994 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Their daughter works in a garment factory, and their oldest son grows rice, while the other two are in school.

Mrs. Soeng has been growing rice since 1994 and started to raise pigs early this year, while Mr. Sim has been a motor remoque (a motorbike with a trailer at the back) taxi driver since 2000. Besides operating the taxi, he also grows rice. Now Soeng is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase feed for pigs and buy extra six piglets.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs and buy six piglets.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sophoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoeun C., 37, and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Phan, 40, who live about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. All of their children are in school. 

Mrs. Sophoeun has been selling corn and sweet potatoes for three years, buying them from the market to sell in the village.  Mr. Chhorn has been a motor remoque (a motorbike with a trailer at the back) taxi driver for five years, carrying garment factory workers from his village to Phnom Penh and back. Now his trailer is broken and Mrs. Sophoeum  is requesting a loan of $250 to repair it so her husband can continue operating the taxi.

loans.use: To repair the motor trailer used in running the motor taxi.

loans.name: Mean Oun Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mean O. lives in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is the leader of a six-person business group. Mrs. Mean O. is a mat maker and her husband, Mr. Leang Meas, is a fisherman. He doesn't have enough fishing equipment for his fishing business. In order to improve her husband's business, Mrs. Mean O. needs to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets for his business.

Previously, Mrs. Mean O. has obtained a loan from AMK to start her mat business. Mrs. Mean O. is 40 years old and is the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while five others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fish nets for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeng C., 49, and her husband, Mr. Sarim Ros, 50, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1978 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home; of the remaining four, two sell bananas and two are in school.

Yeng and her husband have been farming since 1979, growing bananas, corn, cucumbers, and other vegetables. In addition, Yeng sells sweets in the village. Now she is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase fertilizers and pesticide for growing corn and cucumbers.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide for growing corn and cucumbers.

loans.name: En Prak Group

texts.en: Five people in Samrith Chey Village have formed a business group with Mrs. En P. as the group leader. She is a mat maker. Her business now has a problem, because she does not have enough money to buy more raw materials to make mats to sell. Thus,  Mrs. En P. decided to access a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Chanthou L., is a subsistence farmer.  Mrs. En P.  and her husband have five children, three of whom are studying at state school while the remaining two are too young to work or study. Last year,  Mrs. En P.  obtained a loan to buy raw material in order to start her mat business.

loans.use: buy more raw materials to make mats to sell.

loans.name: Savinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Savinh D., 50, and her husband, Mr. Boeun Chea, 64, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for thirty years and have six children, two daughters and four sons. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Of the other three children, one is a soldier, another is a construction worker, and the youngest one is in school.

Mrs. Savinh has been a silk weaver since she was 27 years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then sells them in Phnom Penh; Mr. Boeun is an artist. Mrs. Savinh is now requesting a loan of $100 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Bunnarith

texts.en: Mr. Bunnarith H., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Sokmoeun Soy, 31, who live about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1994 and have two sons, both in school. Sokmoeun has been a garment factory worker since 1993, and Bunnarith has been a motor remoque  (a motorbike with a trailer at the back) taxi driver for two years. He carries people and goods from his village to Ta Khmao market.  Unfortunately, his trailer is broken, so he is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase a new one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motor trailer..

loans.name: Saron Pho Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saron P. is the leader of a five-person business group in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a mat maker in the local village. She is 30 and the mother of four children, three of whom attend school while the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sokhom Phann, is a subsistence farmer.

Mrs. Saron P.’s business has improved, but she has a small problem because, she does not have enough money to buy more raw materials to make the mats that she needs to expand her business. Mrs. Saron P. has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make more mats to sell

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun H., 56, and his wife, Mrs. Kin Nao, 54, who live about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1970 and have nine children, six sons and three daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. Of the remaining children, one is a carpenter, another a mason, another a farmer, and the last one a garment factory worker.

Mr. Savoeun and his wife have been farming since 1991, growing a variety of vegetables and fruits. Now he is requesting a loan of $1000 to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy H., 47, and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Navy is a widow with six children, two sons and four daughters, three of whom are married and live outside the family home, while the other daughter lives at home and weaves silk. One of her sons attends school in their village, and the other one is a carpenter.

Mrs. Navy has been weaving for over ten years. She learned her skill from her mother, and hopes to continue to develop her business so she can support her son’s studies to the highest possible level. She is requesting this, her third loan, in the amount of $800, to buy thread and silk material and to set up her loom and her daughter’s loom.

loans.use: To purchase thread, silk material, and a loom for weaving.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun H. and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Phun is a widow with four children, two sons and two daughters, all of whom attend school in their village. Her daughters weave silk when they are free from school.

Mrs. Phun has been sewing mosquito nets for over twenty years. She hopes to continue to expand her business so she can support her children’s studies to the highest possible level. She is requesting this, her second loan, in the amount of $600, in order to buy thread and silk material for weaving and to set up a loom for her daughters.

loans.use: To purchase thread, silk material, and a loom for weaving.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Mrs. Nara K., 37, and her husband, Mr. Savun Bin, 35, who live about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have two children, one son and one daughter, both of whom are in school.

Mrs. Nara has been working in a garment factory for eight years, while Mr. Savun has been a fisherman since year 1993. He fishes from the lake and river around his village and sells his catch at Prek Phnao market. Now Nara is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase zinc to roof her house.

loans.use: For purchasing zinc to roof her house.

loans.name: Chanthy Chea Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy C. is the leader of a five-person business group in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a mat maker in the village. Her business has improved, but her family's living conditions have not improved, so Mrs. Chanthy C. wants to start a pig breeding business. Thus, Mrs. Chanthy C. is asking for a loan to buy pigs to raise.

Her husband, Mr. Sopheourn Reang, is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Chanthy C. is 46 years old and is the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while four others are studying at local school. The one remaining is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Kor Toeur Group

texts.en:
Four people in Samrith Chey Village have formed a business group with Mrs. Kor T. as the group leader. She is a subsistence farmer and a fish seller. Her husband, Mr. Nol Long, is a fisherman. Mrs. Kor T. has two children, both of whom attend the local school.

Mr. Nol Long's business now faces problems because he does not have enough money to buy fishing nets. Thus, Mrs. Kor T. has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tools to construct more rooms and decorate existing rooms

loans.name: Thi Nang

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Năng is 26 years old. She's requesting 2.006.000 VND to buy chicks & piglets to raise. She has 2 school aged children. She also works as a construction worker to make more money. Her family income is 100.000 VND a day.

- Mrs Đinh Thị Miền needs capital to open a grocery store.
- Mrs Trần Thị Vân needs a loan to buy basic goods to resell at the market.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Thanh Lâm sells flowers and fruits. - Mrs Kiều Thị Hằng sells wooden furniture.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Năng (MS: 030017), năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND về nuôi lợn, gà. Chị có hai con đang đi học. Ngoài chăn nuôi anh chị còn đi làm thợ xây để có thêm thu nhậpcho gia đình. Mức thu nhập của gia đình anh chị là 100.000 VND/ ngày. Chị Đinh Thị Miền (MS: 030018), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn bán hàng tạp hóa. Chị Trần Thị Vân (MS: 030019), vay 2.006.000 VND để đi chợ mua bán phế liệu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thanh Lâm (MS: 030013), vay 2.006.000 VND về đi chợ mua bán hoa quả. Chị Kiều Thị Hằng (MS: 030020), vay 2.006.000 VND mua hàng gỗ bán.

loans.use: raise pigs and poultry

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Huyen

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Huyền is 41 years old. She would like to borrow 2.006.000 VND to buy wood, she is a furniture maker. She has 2 children who are working and 1 still in school. Her family income is 110.000 VND a day. She like SEDA program very much.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hiền has a butcher stand at the market, she sells pork.
- Mrs Lưu Thị Thanh needs the money to buy feed for her chickens.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị An needs the money to buy feed for her chickens.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hoa sells chicks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn Thị Huyền (MS: 030011), năm nay 41 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND về bổ xung thêm vốn mua gỗ về đóng bàn ghế. Cô có hai con đã đi làm và một con đang đi học. Mức thu nhập của gia đình cô là 110.000 VND/ ngày. Cô rất thích tham gia vay vốn với hình thức trả góp. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 030012), vay 2.006.000 VND về để buôn bán thịt lợn ở chợ. Chị Lưu Thị Thanh (MS: 030014), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi gà. Chị Nguyễn Thị An (MS: 030015), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám về chăn nuôi gà đẻ. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 030016), vay 2.006.000 VND lấy vốn đi chợ mua bán gà con.

loans.use: buy wood to make furniture

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Taleb Jan

texts.en:
Taleb Jan, son of S. N., is 33 years old. He returned to his home country of Afghanistan two years ago. During the war in Afghanistan, he was not able to continue his education in Pakistan because he encountered numerous financial problems while he was living there.

Fortunately, however, now he is the owner of a small shop near his house in the Shewa district. He wants to improve this small business and to generate a nice income from the shop, so he is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,100 (50,000 Afghanis) to buy many things for his shop and to thereby increase his income.

loans.use: To generate greater income by purchasing necessary goods for his shop

loans.name: Nematjon

texts.en:
Nematjon I. first applied to MicroInvest in 2008. Mr. I. is engaged in the family livestock business. He has a good flock and 30 years’ experience raising livestock. He lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is the father of 3 children and is a very good family man. Mr. I. dreams of having a big livestock business to leave to his children. He would like to significantly increase his business income.

Therefore, Mr. I. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 US to purchase a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Thi Dong

texts.vi:
Mrs Đặng Thị Đông is 48 years old. She is requesting 2.242.000 VND. She needs capital to buy rice for resale. She has 2 children: 1 is working and the other one is still in school. Her family income is 130.000 VND a day. She likes SEDA program because the loan process is fast and simple.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Đặng Thị Đông (MS: 030029), năm nay 48 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND để bổ xung vốn mua bán gạo. Cô có hai con đã đi làm còn một con đang đi học. Thu nhập của gia đình cô là 130.000 VND/ ngày. Cô rất thích tham gia chương trình vì thủ tục nhanh, thuận tiện.

loans.use: buy rice for resale

loans.name: Iy Nak Long Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Iy Nak L. is the leader of a four-member business group in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is a security guard, while the two others are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Iy Nak L. owns a small restaurant where she sells breakfast to the villagers. Because he business has improved, Mrs. Iy Nak L. now wants to expand her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more tables and chairs for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tables and chairs for her small restaurant.

loans.name: Thi Bich Ngoc

texts.vi:
Mrs Kiều Thị Bích Ngọc, group leader, is 21 years old. She sells refreshment drinks.She's requesting 2.006.000 VND to replenish her stock. Her husband is a truck driver. They do not have children yet. Her family income is 120.000 VND a day. She likes SEDA program because it enables her to save money.
- Mrs Hoàng Thị Liệu raises pigs.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Kha raises cows.
- Mrs Ngô Thị Dương raises pigs & poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Kiều Thị Bích Ngọc (MS: 020028), năm nay 21 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn mua bán hàng nước ngọt, chồng chị đi lái xe. Hiện nay anh chị vẫn chưa có con. Mức thu nhập của anh chị là 120.000 VND/ ngày. Chị rất thích tham gia trả góp để tiết kiệm thêm cho gia đình. Chị Hoàng Thị Liệu (MS: 020029), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Kha (MS: 020030), vay 2.006.000 VND về chăn nuôi bò. Chị Ngô Thị Dương (MS: 020032), vay 2.006.000 VND về chăn nuôi lợn, gà.

loans.use: buy refreshment drinks

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for SEDA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Hien

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 020031), 38 years old, would like to apply for a loan of 354,000VND to buy fertilizer. Her average daily income is 60,000VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 020031), năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị vay 354.000 VND mua phân lân phục vụ nông nghiệp. Mức thu nhập của chị là 60.000/ngày.

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Aisak Sat Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Aisak S. lives in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is the leader of a four-person business group and she sells fish in the local village. Mrs. Aisak S. and her husband have three children, two of whom are enrolled in school, while the youngest stays at home.

Her husband, Mr. S. Mouth, is a fisherman. He doesn't have enough fishing equipment, so he cannot catch many fish for his business. Therefore, Mrs. Aisak S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets and to fix their leaking boat.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets and to fix a leaking boat.

loans.name: Thi Luong

texts.vi:
Ms. Luong Thi N. is 35 years old. She works as a seamstress, and her husband works as a construction contractor. They have two small children. In the past the couple has borrowed from the Bank of Agriculture and Regional Development and repaid the loan. She joined the Fund because of the way it is able to save her money. She is borrowing 2,006,000 Viet Nam Dong (VND) to buy a sewing machine to do sewing work at home. The family’s income is more than 300,000 VND per week. Ms. Nguyet Thi Duong is borrowing 2,006,000 VND as capital for her business. Ms. Ngoc Lan Thi N. is borrowing 2,006,000 VND to buy a sewing machine. Ms. Binh Thi N. is borrowing 2,006,000 VND to buy stock for her business. Ms. Hai Nam Thi N. is borrowing 1,534,000 VND to also buy stock goods for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lương (MS: 13010030), năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị làm thợ may, chồng chị làm chủ thầu xây dựng. Anh chị hiện có hai con còn nhỏ. Trước kia anh chị đã tương vay vốn của ngân hàng nông nghiệp và phát triển nông thôn huyện và đã trả hết. Chị rất thích hình thức tiết kiêm của chương trình nên đã tham gia. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua thêm máy khâu về làm may. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị là lớn hơn 300.000 VND/tuần. Chị Dương Thị Nguyệt (MS:13010034), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc Lan (MS: 13010035), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua máy khâu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Bình (MS: 13010036), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ buôn bán . Chị Đinh Thị Hải Nam (MS: 13010037), vay 1.534.000 VND để đi chợ.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sinon Pen Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinon P. is the leader of a four-person business group in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a mat maker. Her husband, Mr. San K., is a commune chief in the village. Mrs. Sinon P. and her husband have a child who attends the local school.

Mrs. Sinon P. now wants to expand her business because her business activity has improved, but she does not have enough mats to sell to her customers. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials to make more mats to sell.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in order to make more mats to sell.

loans.name: Toshbibi

texts.en:
Toshbibi S. is 48 years old. She is married and has 7 children. She works on a collective farm in the Asht region of Tajikistan, where her husband is a stock keeper and she is engaged in the family business of raising and selling livestock. Mrs. S. has 30 years’ experience raising livestock because she grew up helping her mother take care of the animals.

Mrs. S. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 US to build a cowshed.

loans.use: To build a cowshed

loans.name: Isomiddin

texts.en:
Mr. Isomiddin U. is married and has 5 children. He has a good reputation as a very hard working family man. MicroInvest has been working with Mr.U. since 2008 and he is a serious entrepreneur. Mr. U. raises livestock like many of his fellow villagers. He has 2 cows, a bull, and some rams.

Now Mr. U. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $775.00 US to purchase one more pedigreed animal.

loans.use: To buy one more pedigreed animal

loans.name: Khean

texts.en:
Khean C. sells vegetables in her village market in the Taing Kor Thmey Village, Battambang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Sorm Ty, is a motor-taxi driver with an average income of $4 per day. C. has one child who is young and attends school.

C. is seeking a loan to expand her growing vegetable business and to buy small pigs to breed. She said this loan can help to increase her family’s income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her growing vegetable business and to buy small pigs to breed

loans.name: Zamirahon

texts.en:
Zamirahon B. lives in the high mountain Asht region of Tajikistan where she raises and sells livestock. She also works on a collective farm. Mrs. B. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008, and she is a serious entrepreneur. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to take a well-paying job, so now Mrs. B. is raising her child on her own.

Mrs. B. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $775.00 US to build a cowshed.

loans.use: To build a cowshed

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.en: K. Sohiba is 21 years old and lives with her parents. In order to support her parents, she runs her own business. Already for three years, Sohiba has been selling children's clothing and shoes in a local market. Her brother helps her with the business. To buy goods for sale, Sohiba travels to the neighboring town, Istaravshan. Over the past three years, she has managed to make her business stable and profitable, so that it generates sufficient income for Sohiba and her parents. Now Sohiba is planning to expand her business and, in order to do so, needs a loan to be able to purchase new children's summer clothing and shoes for sale. Sohiba is asking for US$600 for a term of 12 months. She promises to manage the loan with accuracy and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Expansion of a clothing sales business

loans.name: Chanuka Support Group

texts.en:
The Chanuka support group was formed on 1st May 2005 with six founder members: Janet O. Achola, Samuel O. N., Selline J. O., Hyrene A. O., Lucas A. Odera, and Clarice O. Oluoch. The founding members came together to address issues that were affecting their lives. They came together with the aim of assisting each other and also contributing money to pay for the group members' transportation to attend clinical services at Chulaimbo Rural Health Centre.

With time, more members joined the group. The group currently has 45 registered members although only 40 are active. The members have also been trained by K-MET in Nutrition Support, Home Based Care services, and IGA (income generating activity) Management. The group is run by the Executive which is comprised of the Chairperson, Secretary, Assistant Secretary, Organizing Secretary, and the Treasurer. Those who are willing to join the group are required to meet certain conditions including paying a registration fee. Members are involved in well-established income generating activities such as poultry keeping, dairy farming, cereal businesses, vegetable sales, and community pharmacies. Since HIV/Aids is a concern in this area and nutrition supplements have played a role in HIV/Aids management, the group has applied for US $4000 from K-MET to enable them to buy Nutriflour in bulk and sell it to the community.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Buy Nutriflour in bulk for sale to the community.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Barfioy

texts.en:
M. Barfioy is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children.
Barfioy earns income selling children's clothing and shoes in a local market. She has been in this business already for 10 years. Her husband could not find work for a long time and left the country two years ago to go to Russin in search of employment.  As any mother, Barfioy wants her children to have everything they need. She also hopes that all of them will have the opportunity to obtain higher education. Considering that such goods as children's clothes and shoes are highly demanded regardless of the season of the year, the business is a rather stable income generation source for Barfioy, allowing her to support her family. Currently, Barfioy needs a loan to be able to purchase a stock of children's summer shoes for sale. She is asking for US$600 for a term of 6 months. Barfioy thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be timely in the loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase of new children's shoes for sale

loans.name: Desak Putu Pujawati

texts.id:
Desak Putu Pujawati, a mother of 3 children, is a client of DINARI. When she joined DINARI, she has been a pig breeder. With her business, she is able to help her husband, who is a farmer, to fulfill their family’s daily needs.

The proposed loan will be the second loan for Desak Putu Pujawati. The first loan has helped her improved her financial condition. At first, she was able to earn Rp 200,000.00 income a month, and has used them to fulfill her family’s needs and to afford her children’s tuition fees. To continue the business, she still needs the loan from DINARI, until she is able to run the business to be a self-financing business. The proposed loan will be used to invest in piglets and fodders.

Desak Putu is very optimistic that the income she would earn will be higher than before, for she is getting more expert in taking care of pigs. She is also trained by veterinary and DINARI staffs.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Desak Putu Pujawati adalah salah satu klient binaan Dinari .Sejak awal bergabung dengan Dinari Ibu 3 Orang anak ini memiliki usaha memelihara babi.Karena dengan usaha ini Desak Putu Pujawati dapat membantu menunjang pendapatan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani. Kali ini merupakan pinjaman periode ke dua yang diterima oleh Desak Putu setelah melewati tahap pertama dengan hasil yang cukup membantu keuangan keluarganya. Keuntungan sebesar Rp. 200.000.- / bln yang di dapat oleh Desak Putu pada periode awal di pergunakan untuk biaya kebutuhan sehari –hari dan biaya sekolah anak –anaknya, sehingga untuk kelangsungan usaha ternak babinya Desak Putu masih melanjutkan pinjamannya, sampai nantinya Desak Putu bisa mandiri. Modal yang didapat ini oleh Desak Putu dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit babi baru dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan. Desak Putu sangat optimis bahwa hasil yang akan di dapatnya akan lebih baik dari sebelumnya, mengingat Desak Putu semakin terampil dalam memelihara ternak babi dan mendapat penyuluhan langsung dari dokter hewan maupun staf Dinari.

loans.use: To invest in piglets and fodders

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: R. Jamila is 33 years old and has 2 children. Her husband is a cook in a local restaurant. In order to help her husband support the family, Jamila is running her own business. She sells clothes and shoes for children in a rented store that is located in her home town. In addition, each Friday, Jamila sells clothes and shoes in a market in the neighboring city. Those days she works from 5 a.m. until late evening. Jamila's husband helps her run the sales business on Fridays. Currently, Jamila is planning to increase the store inventory by purchasing more goods for the summer season. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US$500 for a 6-month term. Having proved herself as an honest and reliable client of her loan organization, Jamila promises to repay also the current loan on time. Jamila is thankful to everyone who has supported her thus far, allowing her to develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase of new children's clothes and shoes for the summer season

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Dewi

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Dewi believes that working hard is important, and she has done so for many years. To ensure the longterm survival of her family and to help relieve some of the burden of her hard work, she hopes to get another loan to help increase her family's income. Although already older in her years, as the wife of I Made Ardana, she must continue to farm pigs with as much energy as if she were newly married. Little by little her savings grows thanks to the pigs she is able to sell. She and her husband also save the money that her husband earns as a farm laborer on someone else's land. Their system of saving has already helped them to purchase their own piece of land. During her first loan from Kiva/Dinari Ni Nyoman Dewi received 1,400,000 Rupiah which she used to purchase 3 piglets. She was able to sell them for 3,500,000 Rupiah, netting her a profit of 1,200,000 Rupiah over 6 months, or 200,000 Rupiah/month. For her next loan Ni Nyoman Dewi plans to further increase her pig population so her profits further increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Untuk dapat mempertahankan kelangsungan hidup suatu keluarga dan bisa terlepas dari himpitan kebutuhan yang semakin banyak di butuhkan pengorbanan dan kerja keras. Karena dengan usaha dan bekerja keras pasti akan mendapatkan hasil yang lebih baik. Demikian prinsip yang di anut oleh Ni Nyoman Dewi. Meski tergolong sudah usia lanjut, Istri dari I Made Ardana ini masih memiliki semangat dalam menjalankan usaha ternak babi yang telah di tekuninya sejak baru menikah. Sedikit demi sedikit keuntungan yang di peroleh Ni Nyoman Dewi dari menjual babi ditabung. Dan bersama penghasilan suaminya yang berkerja sebagai petani ( mengerjakan sawah milik orang lain ). Dengan sistem bagi hasil keluarga ini telah mampu membeli sepetak tanah . Dalam pinjaman periode pertama, Ni Nyoman Dewi mendapat pinjaman modal Rp 1.400.000,-yang oleh Nyoman Dewi di belikan 3 ekor bibit babi. Babi itu kini telah laku dijual dengan harga Rp 3.500.000.- dengan keuntungan bersih yang di dapat Ni Nyoman Dewi sebesar Rp. 1.200.000.- 6 Bln atau Rp. 200.000.- bln. Dalam pinjaman tahap kedua ini, Ni Nyoman Dewi merencanakan untuk meningkatkan populasi ternaknya sehingga hasil yang didapatnya pun akan meningkat.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Ni Made Wisani

texts.id:
After her first loan from DINARI has been settled, Ni Made Wisani, a Melayan pig breeder, enjoy a significant impact. With Rp 1,400,000.00 as her initial capital that she earned 6 months a go from DINARI, Wisani could earn Rp 1,000,000.00 income. The result is also supported by DINARI team who gave coaching and facilitation. All income she earned from the business is used to fulfill her family’s daily needs, to be saved, and to invest in piglets.

Thinks that the economic condition of her family is getting better because of her business, Ni Made Wisani is very happy, and getting more and more excited in managing it. And with support from her husband, Ni Made Wisani asked for the second loan from DINARI with the same value as the previous. The second loan will be used to invest in fodder for the pigs.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Setelah melalui pinjaman tahap pertama, Ni Made Wisani seorang peternak babi asal Melaya merasakan hasil yang di perolehnya cukup lumayan. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 1.400.000.- yang diterimanya 6 bulan lalu dari Dinari, Wisani bisa meraup keuntungan bersih Rp.1000.000.- Hal ini juga tak terlepas dari pembinaan dan pendampingan yang di lakukan oleh Dinari. Semua keuntungan itu dipergunakannya untuk kebutuhan keluarga, menabung dan untuk membeli bibit babi. Merasa perekonomian keluarganya berangsur - angsur membaik oleh adanya usaha ini, Ni Made Wisani merasa sangat senang dan lebih bersemangat lagi dalam mengembangkannya. Dan dengan mendapat dorongan semangat dari suaminya, Ni Made Wisani melanjutkan pinjamannya ke periode kedua dengan jumlah yang sama. Hal ini dilakukannya karena dari hasil beternak ini Ni Made Wisani bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Pinjaman kedua dipergunakannya untuk membeli pakan ternak

loans.use: To invest in piglets and fodder

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sumadi

texts.id:
Resilient is a good title for Ni Nengah Sumadi, who experienced a loss at her first business loan because 4 of her pigs were infected by some diseases that even killed 1 of the pigs. This misfortune did not kill her spirit to persevere in expanding her business. From the 3 pigs that she had, she could only sell them for $280, which only brought her to a break even point because she spent $25 to buy each pig, and paid $50 for the feed and medicines.

Ni Nengah Sumadi hopes that this second loan can yield a better result. She is determined to learn from her first experience in order to avoid certain pitfalls in her second endeavor in the pig farming business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Tekun dan pantang menyerah, julukan ini cocok di berikan kepada Ni Nengah Sumadi, meski mengalami kerugian pada pinjaman tahap pertama karena 4 ekor ternak babi peliharaannya terserang penyakit, bahkan satu ekor mengalami kematian tak menyurutkan semangatnya untuk tetap bertahan dan kembali mengembangkan usahanya. Dari 3 ekor ternak babi yang tersisa , hanya laku di jual Rp. 2.800.000.- itu berarti hanya kembali modal karena untuk pembelian bibit saja modal yang di keluarkan Rp. 250.000.- ekor sedangkan untuk biaya pakan dan obat mencapai Rp. 500.000.- ekor. Ni Nengah Sumadi sangat berharap pinjaman kedua ini bisa mendapat hasil yang lebih baik dan dia menjadikan pengalaman ini sebagai pelajaran sehingga tak terulang lagi.

loans.use: To buy sow and pig feed

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sinten

texts.id:
As a pig farmer, Ni Ketut Sinten really enjoys her profession. It is not only the source of her family income, but also a hobby that brings excitements in certain situations. In particular, Ni Ketut Sinten is looking forward to the moment when the sow bears piglets because that is when she can forecast how much income she can earn.

Today Ni Ketut Sinten has one sow, which she bought 6 months ago from her first loan. The sow has born 7 piglets, which were sold for $25 each. Ni Ketut Sinten received a net profit of $80 after all expenses for the feed and medicine for the pigs. She used this profit to pay for her children's school tuitions.

With this second loan, Ni Ketut Sinten would like to buy one more sow. With this additional capital, she hopes to earn even more profit in order to support her household needs and children's tuitions.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai seorang peternak babi Ni Ketut Sinten sangat menikmati pekerjaannya ini , karena disamping sebagai sumber pendapatan keluarga beternak babi ini juga merupakan hobi sekaligus hiburan disaat - saat tertentu. Apalagi saat - saat menunggu kelahiran dari induk babi peliharaannya menjadi moment yang selalu di tunggu tunggu oleh semua peternak. Karena dari situ peternak telah bisa memperkirakan berapa hasil yang akan di perolehnya. Ni Ketut Sinten telah memiliki 1 ekor induk babi yang di belinya 6 bulan lalu dari pinjaman tahap pertama, bahkan dari induk ini sudah melahirkan 7 ekor anak yang telah laku di jual dengan Harga Rp. 250.000.- / ekor. Dari hasil penjualan ini Ni Ketut Sinten memperoleh keuntungan bersih setelah di potong biaya pakan dan obat sebesar Rp. 800.000.- Keuntungan ini di pergunakan untuk biaya keperluan pendidikan anaknya . Dengan pinjaman tahap kedua ini Ni ketut Sinten juga berkeinginan untuk menambah 1 Ekor induk lagi. Dengan tambahan modal ini Ni Ketut Sinten berharap akan memperoleh hasil yang lebih baik lagi dan mampu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya terutama untuk pendidikan anak-anaknya.

loans.use: To buy a sow

loans.name: Ni Kadek Wartini

texts.id:
The first loan that Ni Kadek Wartini received was used to buy one sow. Every morning and evening, she worked to prepare the feed for the sow. The sow bore 8 piglets, which were raised for 3 months. After the piglets were old enough, Ni Kadek Wartini sold them. In Bali, people buy pigs for consumption and for religious ceremonies. A pig can sell for $35 - $40. All her sales reached $300 with a net profit of $70 after all expenses for the feed. This income has not been able to support her family of 5.

With this second loan, Ni Kadek Wartini needs an additional capital of $150, which will be used to buy 2 more sows. She hopes to increase her profit even more in order to help her husband support their household needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Pinjaman tahap pertama dipergunakan oleh Ni Kadek Wartini untuk membeli 1 induk babi. Setiap pagi dan sore menyiapkan pakan untuk babinya. Satu induk dapat melahirkan 8 ekor bibit babi dan dipelihara selama 3 bulan. Setelah dirasa cukup besar kemudian anak babi dijual. Kebiasaan yang ada di Bali adalah keperluan daging babi untuk konsumsi dan keperluan untuk upacara keagamaan. Harga per ekornya mencapai Rp. 350.000.- sampai dengan Rp. 400.000,- Total penjualan seluruhnya dapat mencapai Rp. 3.000.000,-Keuntungan bersih mencapai Rp. 700.000,- setelah dikurangi semua pengeluaran untuk pakan. Dari pendapatan ini belum bisa menopang kehidupan keluarganya yang berjumlah 5 orang. Dengan pinjaman tahap kedua ini, Ni Kadek Wartini membutuhkan tambahan modal usaha Rp. 1.400.000.- Pinjaman ini akan dibelikan 2 ekor induk lagi sehingga keuntungan akan lebih banyak lagi, sehingga dapat membantu pendapatan suami untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya

loans.use: To buy pig sows

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir has been in the dairy business for 10 years. He was born in 1958, is married and has three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which was built for IDPs. Now he requests a loan of $975 to buy another cow for producing more milk.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir was born in 1970. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town and has settled in the Finnish houses, which were built temporarily on the front line in the Fuzuli region. Shakir is married and has 3 children.  He started dairy business 5 years ago. Now he requests a loan of  $750 to buy another cow.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Yalchin

texts.en: Yalchin is single. He was born in 1980. He has been in clothing sales business for 5 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town and has settled in the Fuzuli region. Now he requests a loan of $975 to buy more inventory for his business.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
Nanda Kumari M. lives with her husband and two children in Thecho. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur district, and is a developing village in the region. In general, the majority of people who live in this region are engaged in farming operations.

Both Mrs. M. and her husband are engaged in handicraft work. In particular, they make different types of traditional idols which are in high demand by their customers. In Nepal, the demand for such traditional idols is constantly increasing, yet Mrs. M. and her husband do not have sufficient funds to invest in their works to meet their customers' demands. Accordingly, they are seeking a loan in the amount of $375 (Rs 25,000) to buy raw materials such as silver, gold, wax, etc., to be used in making traditional idols.

loans.use: To meet the high/increasing demand for their products by purchasing additional raw materials

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik was born in 1975. He is married, has 2 children.  Malik started a cattle breeding business 5 years ago. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan,  Fuzuli town and has settled in the Finnish houses, which were built temporarily on the front line in the Fuzuli region. Now he requests a loan of $625 to buy a calf to raise and breed.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Bishnu

texts.en:
Mrs. Bishnu S., a resident of Kuleshwor, lives with her husband and her 2 sons. Kuleshwor is located in the Kathmandu district, and most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses such as grocery stores. Her husband, Mr. Rajesh S., works in a motor workshop. Meanwhile, both of her sons are studying in grades 10 and 11, respectively.

Mrs. Bishnu S. opened her meat shop 4 years ago in the town of Kuleshwor. Primarily, she sells buffalo meat in her shop. Nowadays, in her area, there is a very high demand for buffalo meat and the demand continues to rise, so she is requesting her second loan in the amount of $225 (Rs 15,000) to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To satisfy the region's high/increasing demand for meat by investing in her shop

loans.name: Nancy 2012-9 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine P.. She is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Christine is 30 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children and her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately 100 Sudanese Pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Christine is joined in her small group by Eva K., Victoria J., Jenifa M., and Akong R.. Eva K. has a business selling tea at the restaurant and wants to expand her business. Victoria J. is currently operating a business selling fried eggs and meat at the hotel and wants a loan to build houses for rent. Jenifa M. operates a business selling local brew and wants to build an internet café for internet facilities. Akong R. currently sells ice cream and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Laxmi Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi Devi M. lives in Thecho village with her husband and four children. Five years ago, her husband left for India to earn more money. Her older son works in a private office and her younger son is studying in grade 9; as for her daughters, they too are studying, in grades 10 and 11, respectively.

Mrs. Laxmi Devi M. has been working in the handicraft profession for the past 6 years. More specifically, she makes different types of traditional idols, which are in high demand by her customers. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the rising demands of her customers. So, Mrs. M. is requesting a loan in the amount of $225 (Rs 15,000) to buy raw materials such as wax, bronze, silver, etc. for her work.

loans.use: To meet her customers' demands by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., wax, bronze, silver) that will go into her work

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita G. 26 year’s old lady lives in a Thecho, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this area are engaged in farming. Mrs. G. lives in a single family with her husband and 2 daughters. Her husband is Mr. Bidesh G. and he works in a private office. Her older daughter is studying in grade 3 and younger son is in preprimary school.
Mrs. G. opens her grocery store 3 years ago to improve the living standard of her family because only the income of her husband is not sufficient to run her family smoothly. Mrs. G. sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as maize, rice, noodles and so on. Now she is requesting for Rs 30000.00 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Khaladdin

texts.en: Khaladdin is 38 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which was built for IDPs. This man is married and has 3 children. He has been in the taxi business for 5 years. He transports people on a minibus from Fuzuli to Baku. Now he requests a loan of $975 to buy spare parts for improving his business.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura T. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and works on her local collective farm, as well as in a variety of other businesses.  She currently owns two cows and has over ten years of experience in raising livestock.  Because she wants to one day own a large flock, she plans on raising money by making milk products and selling them in the local market.  Therefore, she is applying for a loan of $1,200 for ten months, which will be used to purchase special equipment that will help her in milk production.

loans.use: To buy equipment for milk production.

loans.name: Twaha Ally's Tupendana C Group

texts.en:
Twaha A., age 38, is married with one 2-year-old daughter. He sells mosquito nets, a business he started eight years ago. He works from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $31.

Twaha has taken out four previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his capital. He hopes for a new loan to buy bricks to build a small house. Twaha will share this loan with his loan group, named Tependane C, whose 18 members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

In the picture Twaha is second from right, standing at the back.

loans.use: To buy bricks to build a house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en: Kurbon A. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and employs three people on his farm, where he grows dehkan and raises livestock.  His business is stable and he has been able to pay back previous loans, which were used to buy pedigree bulls and other livestock.  Kurbon dreams of having a large flock one day, and therefore wants to open a trading outlet to sell meat and milk-sour products.  Therefore, he has applied for a loan of $1,200 for ten months, which will be used to buy the equipment necessary for producing commercially valuable milk-sour and meat products.

loans.use: To buy equipment for producing milk-sour and meat products.

loans.name: Samnang Yang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang Y. is the leader of a five-person business group in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Samnang Y. can earn only a small income from her rice plantation, because she owns only a small part of a rice field. Mrs. Samnang Y. now wants to expand her rice product, so she is asking for a loan to buy another section of the rice field to grow vegetables, as well as rice.

Mrs. Samnang Y. is 29 years old and the mother of two children. One attends the local school. The youngest stays at home. Her husband, Mr. Savon Each, is a palm juice collector and a pig breeder.

The three men in the picture have come to receive the loans, instead of their wives since their wives (Soeurn P., Pheom Y. and Sary P.) were not present at the group meeting.

loans.use: To buy a piece of a rice field to grow rice and vegetables

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en: Alisher E. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and is married with four children.  Along with many of his fellow villagers, Alisher raises and sells livestock for a living.  With over 20 years of experience, his business has grown and now employs three people who help care for his animals.  In order to increase his herd and acquire more farmland, Alisher is requesting a loan of $1,200 for ten months.

loans.use: To acquire more farmland and increase his herd.

loans.name: Tey Man Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tey M. lives in Kampong Tralach Krom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia and she is the leader of a five-person business group. She is a farmer who cultivates her crops twice a year. In the dry season, she grows vegetables and she cultivates rice during the rainy season. Mrs. Tey M. is the mother of five children, one of whom assists his father in his fishing business, while three others are enrolled in the state school. The remaining one is at home because he is too young for school.

Mrs. Tey M.'s husband, Mr. Sar Leb, is a fisherM.. His business not doing well now, because he has insufficient fishing equipment and his boat needs to be repaired. In order to improve his business, Mrs. Tey M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets and to fix the boat.

One member in this group, Mrs. Chilheour M., is not present in the photo. Instead, her husband is in the photo because he is asking for a loan, instead of his wife.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets and to fix their boat.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Mrs. Ang A. sells groceries and earns around $2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Heang Phal, charges batteries in his village and earns around $3.50 per day. They live with their four children, all of whom are single, in the Boeng Ngort Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

With a growing business and a desire to expand, A. is seeking a loan to decorate her grocery store. The remainder of loan is to purchase more groceries. This loan will help her to expand her business and to improve her family’s income.

loans.use: To decorate her grocery store and purchase more groceries

loans.name: Mao Khuon Group

texts.en:
Mr. Mao K. is the leader of a four-person business group in Au Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is 37 years old and the father of three children, two of whom attend school, while the other is too young to work or study.

Mr. Mao K. is a subsistence farmer and a fisherman. In addition, he makes pots in the local village. His wife, Mrs. Chanthorn Ven, is employed in a garment factory. Even though the family is engaged in many different business activities, Mr. Mao K. cannot support the family well, so Mr. Mao K. has decides to start a pig breeding business. He is asking for a loan to buy pigs to raise. Previously, Mr. Mao K. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and to hire a pump to water his rice field.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy pigs for raising.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en: Alisher U. was born in 1977 in Asht, Tajikistan, and is married with two children.  He works in the commercial services sector, and has a trade outlet in the local bazaar selling a variety of food products, including meats, flour, sugar, and vegetable oil.
